description:
Have you ever wanted to know what it is like to build a startup from the ground up? If you’ve ever wanted to found your own company, or just get experience of scale at this unique stage - this is the role for you.

In this role you will do many things that might be familiar as a Principal, Full-Stack, or another type of Engineer. What’s different about a Founding Engineer is you’re first building a company and a culture. And the customer and product follows that.

What we really want in a Founding Engineer is someone who wants build something great from the ground up. More importantly, someone that wants to share the experience with a great team.

Who are we?

Our mission is to create calmer organizations. With Pyn, employees get more of the messages they need, and fewer of the ones they don’t. We do this by providing companies with tools for targeted, tailored communications.

Our founders are Jon Williams and Joris Luijke. Jon previously co-founded the technology company Culture Amp. Joris helped scale the culture of Atlassian and Squarespace as their Head of People. Pyn is backed by Accel; an early investor in Facebook, Slack, Dropbox, and many more great companies.

Pyn originates from Sydney, Australia. However, we have employees and customers across the globe. While we work remotely, we still love to get together if and when we can. Ideally our employees have good overlap with the Australian Eastern or Pacific time zones.

Your impact

As Founding Engineer, you will champion new features all the way from ideation to implementation. As this champion, you will be talking to our customers every day.

At Pyn, you will work across the whole organization. Everything from building our Web Application, to helping customers, mentoring engineers, and building our culture.

In terms of nuts and bolts: The Pyn Application uses React and GraphQL. The codebase is largely TypeScript and deployed on a serverless AWS infrastructure.

We expect this architecture to evolve considerably as we grow. As a Founding Engineer, you’ll be responsible for technical direction in this evolution. You will be a key part of Pyn shipping fast, scaling up, and staying secure for our customers.

What we offer

At Pyn you will:

  • work directly with the Founders on product direction, strategy, and execution.
  • be part of forming our values, and a leader for the culture we are building.
  • work with Jon and the team on the software architecture and strategy.
  • have regular, direct contact with our customers to understand their needs.
  • use your experience to mentor and grow other team members.
  • * be in a dynamic remote-work environment, with flexible hours and parental leave.
  • exercise your curiosity and grow technical, product, and people skills.
  • continue to ship code daily (if not hourly!) to get value to customers hands as soon as possible.

… change the way companies communicate with their employees.

What you bring

We recognize that people and careers are a unique journey. Recognizing this, we do not have strict skill and education requirements. Whilst there will always be specific skills we see as useful, we value the whole of what you can bring to Pyn.

As one of our most senior hires, we want to draw upon your experience. As such it’s likely you’re a number of years into your career (or careers!). Whilst a traditional engineering background will suit this, so will many others.

We’re striving to create a diverse environment and encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply. If you’re curious and passionate about improving employee communications, then we’d love to hear from you.

position: Mobile Full Stack & Front End Developer (React/React Native)

location.city: New York City • Washington DC • Maryland • Remote

description:
We’re growing, we’re hiring, and we’re looking for awesome people! If you want a basic job, look elsewhere. If you want to be part of an amazing, tight, and mission-driven team, look no further!

This is a rare and exciting opportunity to join a startup that already has global momentum and work closely with the CTO. Lots of room for growth with the company.

Join us and help us make a difference for people around the world.

If you're passionate about what you do, you do it well, and are looking to be a part of an awesome movement, BurnAlong is the right place for you.

We're currently searching for a Mobile and Front End Developer to work on our most important initiatives.

We are looking for a problem solver, not just a doer. Become part of a culture of integrity, innovation, and creativity as we revolutionize an entire industry.

Ideal candidates need not apply. Exceptional and motivated applicants only. Join us as we help people & businesses achieve better outcomes.

Job Summary:

BurnAlong is looking for a Mobile and Front End Developer to help us rapidly iterate and improve.

We’re looking for someone who understands what it’s like to be part of a startup; someone who works hard and has the optimism to plow through any challenge with a positive attitude.

We’re looking for the perfect fit for the team, not the role - as long as you have a strong skills, a desire to learn, and a positive attitude, we want to hear from you!

Qualifications and Skills:
5+ years of development experience with at least 2 using React / React Native
React Javascript Framework (Must and Primary)
Open Source Backend Familiarity (Python Preferred)
Database Concepts (SQL)
React-Native (Mobile) a Plus
Automated Test Frameworks a Plus
React Web Frontend Development
React-native Web Development
Mobile Development Experience & Eco-systems
Node.js Experience a Plus
Some Python Web Experience (Or Equivalent) a Plus
API Integration (Rest) & Data Familiarity
CSS/SASS and Ui/Ux Implementation
Automated Testing: Basic JS or Python Test Frameworks a Plus
Good Communication, Planning/Organization & Teamwork Skills

About you:

  • You are a good person and recognize others are too. You maintain respect of others while working through tough challenges and tight timelines;
  • You’re passionate about building a great product and you’re a quick learner who is passionate about code. You take initiative to self-teach when needed;
  • Ability to work independently and as part of a team with a strong attention to detail.
  • You approach problems from a product perspective, thinking through how the user will interact with what you're building;
  • You have strong communication skills. You ask questions, let others know when you need help, and tell others what you need;
  • You're a problem solver. You believe the best work is the result of finding the simplest solution to complex challenges;
  • You have a strong desire to learn and try new things!

About BurnAlong:

When friends want to play video games together but can't do so in person, they play online together.

When we can't do an in-person meeting, we connect using tools like Zoom, Skype, FaceTime or google hangout.

When we can't make it to the gym with friends, why should we be stuck at home working out to solo, one-directional experiences… with instructors who we don’t know?

BurnAlong comes to solve the problem, of life often getting in the way of staying mentally and physically fit -- especially with your friends and instructors who you know and trust from your local gym, studio or wellness professional. We have 45+ categories to choose from and more than 10,000 classes.

Whole Mind, Whole Body, Whole Life.

We’ve built BurnAlong – to bridge the gap between online and in person - to help those who are struggling to keep wellness and fitness engaging and social.

How?

On BurnAlong you can take classes live online with the friends you invite and your favorite local wellness instructors. Less Hollywood and more neighborhood – authentic people helping each other stay connected and fit (mentally & physically)… it’s a surprisingly cool experience and exploding.

Apply Now and Join Us.

This is a rare and exciting opportunity to join a startup that already has global momentum. Check out our site for more: www.BurnAlong.com.

Apply today - we want to hear from you!

Engineering Intern (2022 - 6 months)

We are looking for self-starting interns with a passion for learning and growth mindsets. Candidates must be highly motivated college students willing to intern with SOE for a 6-month period. Interns will gain a range of hands-on electrical engineering experience going through a design cycle for engineering hardware.

SOE’s interns have the opportunity to gain significant on the job learning and will directly apply engineering design fundamentals to produce impactful results.

Responsibilities:

  • Interns will report to a mentor who will be responsible for candidate feedback and learning— mentors will also assign tasks and projects to work closely with the teams
  • Perform electrical prototyping, schematic capture, PCB layout, and general electrical engineering work
  • Using electrical test equipment to make measurements and troubleshoot boards
  • Gain exposure to electronic assembly, PCB soldering, and wire harness assembly
  • Program microcontrollers or FPGAs and test software applications

Basic Qualifications:

  • Currently enrolled at an accredited four-year university or college for relevant degree programs (Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, Physics, Math, related field)
  • Proficiency in at least one programming language (Python, C, C++, R, etc.)
  • First or second year circuits classes and knowledge of electrical engineering fundamentals
  • Curious and passionate about electrical engineering and technology with the ability to learn and take instruction

Preferred Skills Experience:

  • Experience in a team-based design and build project (e.g., Formula SAE, Solar Car, CubeSat, etc.)
  • Experience with embedded software development, preferably with microcontrollers such as MSP430, STM32, or AVR
  • Familiarity with machining tools including milling machines, lathes, and CNC equipment
  • CAD software design experience for PCB and/or mechanical designs
  • Experience with circuit simulation using LTspice, Pspice, or similar programs
  • Experience in soldering and crimping for complex systems
  • Experience with Linux operating systems

Additional Requirements:

  • Applicant must be willing to work 40 hours a week on-site in El Segundo, CA
  • Applicant must be eligible to work on ITAR projects
  • Job Type: Full-time (Paid, Seasonal)

ITAR Requirements:

  • To conform to U.S. Government space technology export regulations, including the International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR) you must be a U.S. citizen, lawful permanent resident of the U.S., protected individual as defined by 8 U.S.C. 1324b(a)(3), or eligible to obtain the required authorizations from the U.S. Department of State. Learn more about the ITAR here.

About Oishii:

At Oishii, we grow the best fruit in the world by deploying ground-breaking vertical farming technology that pushes the boundaries of agriculture. We’re the first in the world to grow fruit in an indoor vertical farm at commercial scale. We started with strawberries, which we debuted at Chef’s Table at Brooklyn Fare, the three star Michelin restaurant considered by critics to be among the best in the world. Since then, we have supplied our strawberries to food-loving consumers, world-class restaurants, and specialty retailers across NYC. Our proprietary technology, developed through years of intensive research in Japan and the US, enables us to grow the very best produce year-round, at the same high level of quality, all without using any pesticides. Since raising $50mm in series A funding from leading investors, we have rapidly expanded our farm facilities and assembled a world-class team with backgrounds spanning vertical farming, industrial automation, farm operations, and data analysis. Oishii has been profiled in Eater, NPR, Time, and Fortune. If you’re interested in building the farm of the future with us, we look forward to hearing from you!

About the role:

You will join a world-class team with backgrounds spanning vertical farming, industrial automation, controls engineering, farm operations, photovoltaic cell design, oil and gas platform management, consulting, military intelligence, and data analysis, with graduates from MIT, Yale, Georgetown, Stanford, Georgia Tech, and University of California Berkeley.

What you’ll do:

Your mission will be to build Oishii’s next generation of indoor agricultural facilities. Mechanical and electrical engineering students looking for hands-on experience in a fast-paced startup environment and a high degree of ownership will thrive in this role. You will drive projects that will build your expertise across many disciplines, including:

  • HVAC, thermodynamics, and fluid mechanics
  • Lighting systems
  • Controls, industrial automation, and production engineering
  • Irrigation, water management, and plumbing
  • Rapid prototyping and iterative design
  • Construction team management

  • Machining
    Who you are:

  • Working towards a BS or MS in Mechanical Engineering or related technical field

  • Strong knowledge of core engineering principles.

  • Proactive, willing to take on responsibility and own outcomes.

  • Capable of rapid prototyping and track record of bringing concepts to life.

  • Strong written and verbal communication skills.
    You must be open to a highly hands on and collaborative environment, and you will be driven to deliver results.

We believe that the way people interact with their finances will drastically improve in the next few years. We’re dedicated to empowering this transformation by building the tools and experiences that thousands of developers use to create their own products. Plaid powers the tools millions of people rely on to live a healthier financial life. We work with thousands of companies like Venmo and SoFi, several of the Fortune 500, and many of the largest banks to make it easy for people to connect their financial accounts to the apps and services they want to use. Plaid’s network covers 11,000 financial institutions across the US, Canada, UK and Europe. Founded in 2013, the company is headquartered in San Francisco with offices in New York, Salt Lake City, Washington D.C., London and Amsterdam.

We’re architected around decoupled services. You could be working on our internal distributed systems framework that holds them all together, or building out the newest version of our API. Most of our back-end core systems are written in Go, but that's not a prerequisite. We pick the right tool for the job and have systems in Go, TypeScript, and Python.

What excites us

  • Degree in engineering, CS, physics, math, statistics, or another related field
  • Strong track record of building interesting projects, whether during internships, for school, or independently
  • Great fundamentals and a strong command of at least one language
  • Product mindset. You understand that building the right tools and systems can impact millions of users
  • Adaptability. Most of our engineers work across the entire stack, touching everything from the front end to our core infrastructure

Plaid is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and values diversity at our company. We do not discriminate based on race, color, national origin, ethnicity, religion or religious belief, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, military or veteran status, disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state, and local laws. Plaid is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for candidates with disabilities in our recruiting process. If you need any assistance with your application or interviews due to a disability, please let us know at accommodations@plaid.com.

The role will require maintaining strong overall quality control of products made by the company adhering to reliability, performance and customer expectations.

Ideal for a current student or a very recent graduate. See www.superworldapp.com to learn more.

description:
We are looking for an intern who can help improve our web application and real estate application for superworldapp.com Intern may also work on other web applications built to be integrated with our platform.

  1. Good working proficiency with React, Express, MongoDB
  2. Knowledge of Nodejs needed
  3. Experience working with APIs and Mapbox.

Culture:
We are seeking autonomous, self-motivated individuals that are experimental.

Ideal for a current student or a very recent graduate. See www.superworldapp.com to learn more.

ROLE OVERVIEW

We're looking for interns to join our Summer 2022 intern class in San Francisco (Benchling HQ). You'll learn to design complex and highly scalable product and systems. Our past interns have built DNA search engines, key pieces of our AWS infrastructure, and analytics pipelines.

WHAT YOU'LL DO

  • Work with and learn from a strong team of scientists and engineers coming from industry leaders. We grow our interns through mentorship and ownership.

  • Own a project from initial research to design, prototype, and maybe large-scale rollout. You might:

    • Research and prototype a way for lab scientists to analyze results using computer vision instead of human review
    • Improve the way we detect and act on outliers in data that Benchling users upload to our systems
    • Build a system to do guided physical experimentation using state-of-the-art optimization algorithms

YOU

  • Are pursuing a PhD degree in a science, statistics, mathematics, or a related technical field.
  • Have prior experience with software engineering (via previous work history, internships, or coursework)
  • Care about the real world impact of your research and code
  • Can work both independently on research and as part of a team to build a more complex product
  • Enjoy ownership and building key pieces of product and/or platform.
  • Are interested in learning about life science, but prior knowledge is not required!

The perks/benefits below are only offered to our full-time Benchling employees

We're looking for interns to join our Summer 2022 intern class in San Francisco (Benchling HQ). As an intern, you'll be entrusted with a significant degree of ownership to work alongside full-time engineers who hail from MIT, Google, Facebook, Stripe, and more. You'll learn to design complex and highly scalable product and systems. Our past interns have built DNA search engines, key pieces of our AWS infrastructure, and analytics pipelines.

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Work with and learn from a strong team of engineers coming from top computer science programs and industry leaders. We grow our interns through mentorship and ownership.

  • Own a project end-to-end, from initial design, to prototype, to large-scale rollout. You might:

    • Design and implement backend models and API endpoints for complex scientific workflows.
    • Design and implement rich frontend components and architecture. We build and operate one of the largest, richest React applications out there and power complex scientific analyses.
    • Design and build a platform framework or infrastructure tool for other Benchling engineers to use.

YOU

  • Are pursuing a BA/BS and/or MA/MS degree in computer science, math or a related technical field.
  • Have had a prior Software Engineer Internship or similar experience.
  • Build software with a product-first approach. You ship code quickly and care about the real world impact of your code.
  • Have strong abilities in problem solving and iterating on feedback.
  • Enjoy ownership and building key pieces of product and/or platform.
  • Are interested in learning about life science, but prior knowledge is not required!

YOU MIGHT WORK ON

Check out our blog posts for some examples of past intern work. Here are some other examples of recent and future projects:

  • Tools to simulate DNA assembly - Computers can assist scientists by informing scientific decisions with complex calculations. Our bulk assembly tool allows scientists to simulate constructing hundreds of DNA constructs in parallel, visualizing the end result and highlighting potential issues.
  • Complex querying and visualization tools - The big advantage of keeping all your data stored in one system is that you can query that data all at once, without digging up multiple sources. This works best when you can query Benchling the same way you can query a database: by choosing from a large number of possible filters on any related objects, joining together various sources, and performing aggregations. We want to enable this in a user-friendly experience, without leaving your browser.
  • Improving our deployment process - Being able to reliably and quickly deploy changes to our hundreds of customers is critical to getting new features out and responding quickly to regressions or incidents. Our CD (continuous deployment) process is responsible for releasing tens of changes to customers everyday. As the codebase grows and the engineering team grows to 100+ engineers, we’ve needed to rearchitect parts of our CD pipeline.

The perks/benefits below are only offered to our full-time Benchling employees

Parallel Systems is an early-stage startup company developing the future of intermodal freight transportation. Our mission is to reduce transportation costs and make an impact on emissions and safety. We are developing the vehicles and software to create new autonomous and electric transportation systems for existing rail infrastructure.

At Parallel Systems, we value the team as much as the mission. We want to collaborate with diverse people that are motivated, persistent, and take personal accountability for their work. Our most successful team members are self-starters, take the time to explain things to others, and accept constructive feedback.

Internship Description
Join us in Palo Alto for an in-person software internship! You will be assigned a project and a mentor, and interact daily with fellow engineers to write code and design systems to be deployed in the real world.

As an intern, you'll be working on code to solve various challenges. These include: managing our autonomous fleet, identifying and reacting to hazards on the rail, validating our software stack, simulating the rail environment, planning and routing trains on the network, and much more!

We are looking for interns with experience in any of the following: Machine Learning/AI, Systems Software, Embedded/Firmware development, Test and Validation, Networking and Communications, Back-end services, React and web app development

Preferred language experience in Rust, C/C++, or Python.

Requirements

  • Currently enrolled in a full-time program working towards a bachelors, masters or PhD in computer science or a related engineering field

About Parallel Systems

Parallel Systems is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to any discriminatory factor protected by applicable federal, state or local laws. We work to build an inclusive environment in which all people can come to do their best work.

Internship Description
Join us in Culver City for an in-person software internship! You will be assigned a project and a mentor, and interact daily with fellow engineers to write code and design systems to be deployed in the real world.

As an intern, you'll be working on code to solve various challenges. These include: managing our autonomous fleet, identifying and reacting to hazards on the rail, validating our software stack, simulating the rail environment, planning and routing trains on the network, and much more!

We are looking for interns with experience in any of the following: Machine Learning/AI, Systems Software, Embedded/Firmware development, Test and Validation, Networking and Communications, Back-end services, React and web app development

Preferred language experience in Rust, C/C++, or Python.

Requirements

  • Currently enrolled in a full-time program working towards a Bachelor's, Master's, or PhD in computer science or a related engineering field

About Parallel Systems

Parallel Systems is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to any discriminatory factor protected by applicable federal, state or local laws. We work to build an inclusive environment in which all people can come to do their best work.

Digital Analytics Engineering Intern (Google Analytics)

Are you a passionate and driven data engineering student seeking to gain real world experience in a hyper-growth company? Look no further! InfoTrust, LLC is looking to add a Data Engineer Intern to join our Discovery Team in Blue Ash, Ohio. On our team you will have opportunities working on Google Analytics website implementations, data engineering, visualization and data validation for clients like L’Oreal, Nestle, Funimation, Sephora, Lonovo, and many more!!

Requirements:

  • Familiarity with Java, JavaScript, or relatable programming languages

  • Strong SQL skills

  • Interest in digital analytics, website design and/or user behavior.

  • Growth mindset, eagerness to learn

  • Enjoys a fast paced, dynamic, challenging and team-oriented work environment

Benefits:

  • Extensive Javascript experience with a certified Google partner.

  • Exposure to Data Science, Visualization, Data Engineering, Automation, and Audience Activation teams within our Discovery organization.

  • Flexible Hours

  • Extensive training

  • Work laptop

More about InfoTrust:

Our company was started with one principle – we are going to provide the best workplace for the best people and as long as we keep our eyes on this #1 goal, all other things will fall into place. This strategy has been extremely successful and we are thrilled to be #1 Employer in Ohio, #1 for Cincinnati, and ranked on national lists such as Ad Age's Best Places to Work and Inc. 5000 Fast Growing Companies (6 years strong). Learn more about us at infotrust.com/careers

Location:

Due to the recent recognition from the State of Ohio and the Job Creation Grant, we prefer that our next hire is in the Ohio area. Due to Covid-19, all InfoTrusters are currently working remotely. Once we return to the office, it would be preferred to have someone that can report to Cincinnati, Chicago, or our Columbus locations.

Diversity is one of our 6 core values at InfoTrust: InfoTrust is committed to a diverse workforce and we are an equal opportunity employer. We want strong, diverse teams built from different backgrounds, experiences and identities. We are building an inclusive, supportive place for you to do the best work of your career.

Position Overview

As a Software Engineer, Intern, you'll have the opportunity to spend 12-16 weeks working on one (or more) of the engineering teams at SingleStore. As an intern, you will be at the forefront of real-time technology that’s revolutionizing how companies run their businesses every day. With release cycles throughout the year, our engineers are accustomed to moving quickly in a rapid production environment. To do this successfully, we work collaboratively and creatively across teams to maximize our opportunity for impact. We also believe it’s important to celebrate our wins together whether it be at local spot or getting out of the city for some exploring.

As a Software Engineer Intern, you will be empowered to own your projects end-to-end and be an active contributor throughout the product life cycle. To expedite your growth path, you will partner with engineers who deeply care about your success and will lend their expertise to your professional development. Our engineers are not just technical partners/mentors, but are also business partners who are exposed to all areas of the business, working with teams such as product, marketing, and sales.

Role and Responsibilities

Our Software Engineers work on small, collaborative teams to help drive our company forward. Whether you’re building new features in Javascript and React.js, increasing the runtime and performance of a SingleStore cluster, or writing new C++ code for the query optimizer, our interns are responsible for brand new and existing projects that are deployed into production with each release. Your work will include everything from writing to testing software, and you’ll gain a significant understanding of both the product and the business.

Required Skills and Experience

  • Enrolled in a B.S. Degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, or related discipline
  • Deep understanding of C.S. fundamentals
  • Strong programming skills with C++, C, Go, Javascript, or Python
  • Passionate about building highly reliable software
  • Firm grasp of algorithms and data structures

SingleStore is one platform for all data, built so you can engage with insight in every moment. Trusted by industry leaders, SingleStore enables enterprises to adapt to change as it happens, embrace diverse data with ease, and accelerate the pace of innovation. SingleStore is venture-backed and headquartered in San Francisco with offices in Portland, Seattle, Boston, Bangalore, London, Lisbon, and Kyiv. Defining the future starts with The Database of Now™.

Consistent with our commitment to diversity & inclusion, we value individuals with the ability to work on diverse teams and with a diverse range of people.

To all recruitment agencies: SingleStore does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to SingleStore employees. SingleStore is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes and will not pay fees to any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with the Company.

At Healing Innovations, we are passionate about developing products to help people walk again. Under the direction of our engineering lead, you will support our team’s product development efforts, gain hands-on experience with prototyping and testing, and communicate your findings and progress with the team. You will get an unmatched experience with the product development process as we refine our existing device and develop our next product line. This will be the third summer this program is being offered.

We believe that internships are a vital part of your education and growth as an engineer, since working in industry is often very different from the coursework you’ve done. Your projects will build on your previous classes while challenging you to develop new skills. We are a small hardworking team and expect a lot from our interns.

Intern responsibilities may include:

  • Designing and modeling parts and assemblies in CAD
  • Performing load & stress analyses
  • Creating & updating manufacturing drawings
  • Building prototypes of new designs
  • Planning and executing tests for FDA registration
  • Assisting with FDA documentation
  • Supporting manufacturing engineering efforts

We’re looking for someone who:

  • Has project experience with part design and assemblies in CAD software (OnShape, SolidWorks, Fusion 360, Inventor, etc.)
  • Has a strong mechanical aptitude & intuition
  • Has some exposure to anatomy and gait biomechanics
  • Has exceptional communication skills, a strong desire to learn, and a passion for problem solving
  • Lives in or can spend the summer in the Nashville, TN area

To be considered for this internship, you must be enrolled in a bachelor’s or master’s degree program in mechanical engineering or biomedical engineering, have a minimum 3.0 out of 4.0 cumulative GPA, and be a U.S. citizen.

Program Dates: (12 weeks)

Please send a message a brief introduction highlighting:

  • Your school, year, major, & location
  • CAD experience
  • Prototyping experience
  • Examples of past team projects
  • Any internship requirements (hours/week, duration, etc.)

location.city: New York City • San Francisco • Menlo Park

description:
At Instabase, we’re passionate about building software to advance the state of the art in computing. We’ve built a fearlessly experimental, customer-obsessed team who are making discoveries to fundamentally change how people build and consume business applications.

Today, we’re partnering with the world’s leading companies to transform how they use data and technology. If these challenges excite you, we’d love to hear from you!

Our Engineering Team architects the underlying operating system, core services, platform infrastructure, dev toolkits, core algorithms, machine learning models, packaged end-user apps, and app store marketplace. Instabase engineers are excited to solve hard problems for complex organizations and are self-starters from day one.

Our Tech Stack is React and Typescript on the frontend. Our product and infrastructure is written in Go, Python, Java, and C++. We operate using the micro-services model and leverage Docker and Kubernetes for our deployments.

We're hiring across all teams and technical areas! This includes Frontend, Product/Full-Stack, Systems, Infrastructure, Machine Learning and AI!

Interested in learning more? Explore the Instabase product and read about the Intern experiencehere.

Chronicled has established the decentralized MediLedger Network, which connects the pharmaceutical industry and runs mission critical processes. You will be working on the software that connects to and runs the Network. You will be building a cutting-edge platform using the latest technological advancements at the intersection of blockchain, cryptography, distributed computing and network protocols.

The Opportunity:
Our internship program will provide an opportunity to work on meaningful products that support mission critical functions of Fortune 100 companies. Through the internship, you will contribute to critical components and microservices that support the delivery of information to end users of the Chronicled solutions. You will work with a talented engineering team to build an event-driven, enterprise grade solution based on microservices.

What you will do:

  • Contribute to critical components of the Dashboard stack of the Chronicled solutions, including the Dashboard Server, reusable React components and other backend microservices.
  • Help design and implement Dashboard-related services as reusable SDK to enable third parties to create custom functionality on top of Chronicled solutions
  • Work with product team, UI/UX team, software architects and engineers to design easy-to-use user experience
  • Transform functional and non-functional requirements into software deliverables
  • Work with the team to break down complex features into manageable work deliverables
  • Deliver performant, scalable and resilient software
  • Contribute to the technical documentation of application
  • Contribute to system test automation (CI/CD)

What you will need:

  • Pursuing or completed a BS or MS in Computer Science or similar technical degree
  • Working towards mastering one or more languages , such as Java, Javascript, TypeScript, NodeJS, React, Angular, GraphQL, Apollo, MySQL, PostgreSQL and RabbitMQ.
  • Eager to work with industry-leading frameworks and libraries
  • Excited to learn more about blockchain, crypto, ethereum

** This is a 3 month position, with possibility of converting into full time

Perks: At Chronicled we take pride in our Total Rewards Package which is available to all full time Chronicled Employees:

Competitive Rewards: Comprehensive and competitive employment and rewards packages for all employees
Equipment: Macbook pro and accessories standard issue.
Location: 100% Remote
Flexibility: We believe flexibility comes in multiple forms. Freedom to express yourself with an open startup casual dress code, Flexible schedules. Best of all we have an unlimited vacation policy that allows you to get the rest and relaxation you need to refresh.
Welcoming Culture: We call ourselves a family for a reason. We foster a fun and creative atmosphere where anyone can openly contribute ideas, feel appreciated, and feel empowered to be who they are. Fun is also highly encouraged! Frequent offsite team building events and weekly happy hours.
Recognition: Respect and prominence due to work contributions, working on cutting edge technology. Our employees are celebrated and recognized for their contributions
Variety: Opportunities to experience different job tasks, responsibilities, and project opportunities
Workload: Challenging and fast paced work. There is never a dull moment in our Enterprise Blockchain Laboratory.
Work Importance: The typical Chronicled team member has a bias for action. We do. We build. We step outside of the scope. We believe we will change the world.
Control your own Destiny: Ability to influence others and control one’s own destiny.

Advancement: Opportunities to get ahead both personally and professionally.

What is Pathrise?
Pathrise (YC W18) is an online program for tech professionals that provides 1-on-1 mentorship, training and advice to help anyone land their next job. On top of that, we're built around aligned incentives. Fellows only pay when they get hired and start working at a job first.

Every day we are expanding our team and our services. We are looking for individuals who are ready to jump into a new role with us. We are a flourishing team and we really enjoy working together to improve our fellows chances of getting the jobs of their dreams! If this sounds like something you'd be interested we’d like the opportunity to get to know you more.

Our Mission
We seek to uplift job seekers in their careers and help them fulfill their hopes, ambitions, and livelihoods. Read more about why we’re driven to do this in our manifesto.

The Role
We’re looking for natural teachers who care about mentorship and uplifting others. As a Data Science Intern, your main responsibility would be to perform admission sessions for our Data track, helping fellows with technical interview prep and from time to time working on internal data projects.

Responsibilities

  • Handling 1-on-1 admissions sessions, technical interview prep and occasional behavioral prep
  • Investing in students’ personal stories and advising them on their career trajectory in the admissions calls and giving proactive feedback
  • Building up and improving on the admissions process for data fellows
  • Conduct data analysis for Pathrise and contribute to the overall effectiveness of the data track

Qualifications

  • 1+ years of experience working on data-related projects whether that be in academic projects, internships or other related work experience
  • A passion for mentorship!
  • Be available for 10+ hours a week
  • 1+ years of experience in data science, technology industry or in a related field
  • Experience with teaching, career advising, and mentorship in education or tech

Pathrise Values...

  • Growing employees: we value giving and receiving feedback (constructively) and we value continuous improvement. We want you to grow professionally and we include a professional development stipend to help you achieve that.
  • Diversity, equity and inclusion: we value people, opinions and thoughts from diverse backgrounds. Our culture is built upon the pillar of ‘DEI is not a separate initiative from Pathrise it is a part of Pathrise.’ We invite all to share their stories and we believe that it is through acceptance and curiosity that we can create a diverse, equitable and inclusive workplace.

We cannot sponsor visas for this role at the time. Thank you for your interest.

Pathrise is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer that proudly pursues and hires a diverse workforce. Pathrise does not make hiring or employment decisions on the basis of race, color, religion or religious belief, ethnic or national origin, nationality, sex, gender, gender-identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, military or veteran status, or any other basis protected by applicable local, state, or federal laws or prohibited by Company policy. Pathrise also strives for a healthy and safe workplace and strictly prohibits harassment of any kind. Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance and other similar state laws and local ordinances, and its internal policy, Pathrise will also consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

If you are also interested in the fellowship, please apply here: https://www.pathrise.com/apply.

SolarFI is a Techstars backed company supported by Alabama Power, Georgia Power, NYSERDA (The New York State Energy Research and Development Authority), and the University of Alabama. At SolarFi, we are focusing on solving issues in the circular economy using solar energy and innovative technology. We provide e-scooter charging stations, internet, device-charging, and access to city services in a modern way. Currently, we are tackling the challenges brought up by COVID-19 and looking to assist the everyday person, local businesses, and government. I hope that you can join us as we use sustainable solutions to solve complex environmental, social, and economic problems.

Experience with Rasberry Pie and Python
passionate about renewable energy

Proficiency in software QA practices and testing tools

We are hiring a Part-time Blockchain Developer to help develop our cryptocurrency/token, Zentoken (ZENT).

Zenbase is a mindfulness and wellness platform with an attached cryptocurrency rewards system. We aspire to improve the world by encouraging self-development through cryptocurrency incentives. Zentoken is our token of exchange in an opt-in advertising system, entailing sponsored meditations based within Zenbase, our mobile app and Web platforms. Zentoken can be used for less expensive customer listening attention and pronounced recognition for creatives, purchasing premium content within Zenbase, digital goods such as gift cards and other utilities in our self-development marketplace.

In light of full transparency, Zenbase is still in its infancy. The Zentoken (ZENT) was recently released into the market via ICO on March 15, 2021. Zentoken positions itself at the perfect time to see its price hit the moon. Once our mobile app, Zenbase, is developed our target audience will be the estimated 500 million people who meditate. In the meantime, we seek out passionate application developers who wish to change the world through blockchain activity.

At Zenbase, we have fun, we move fast, we celebrate & support our fellow teammates

We would like to spread our message of love, peace and mindfulness with the help of your knowledge and skillset. Before doing so, we feel it is pivotal to supply you with the necessary information to determine if this position would be a good fit for you. You can visit our website (www.zenbase.us) to learn more about us and read our white paper.

We are looking for a Data Annotator who can support our Machine Learning team by labeling images, annotating data, and providing feedback to improve processing tools and new features.

A Data Annotator will participate in Computer Vision projects (Government ID Verification, Check Issuance, Legal Documents, etc.) and be a part of improving people’s financial success.

At Synapse, our mission is to accelerate democratization of best-in-class financial products for everybody. In addition to daily responsibilities, a Data Annotator is expected to keep up-to-date with company developments and have a general understanding of our products and services.

In order to be successful at Synapse, you should have:

  • An ability to work independently within a small, fast-paced team
  • An entrepreneurial spirit and unrelenting passion to deliver the best service possible
  • A data driven and analytical mindset that challenges usual conventions
  • The ability to implement feedback, learn quickly, and contribute new ideas
  • A general concern for the wellbeing of others and the desire to work on problems that maximize a positive future for humanity

Key Qualifications:

  • Technical background a plus
  • Reliable, self-motivated and hardworking individual
  • Good communication skills
  • Attention to detail

Perks:

  • Perks:

  • Competitive Salary
  • Insurance (Health//Dental//Vision)
  • One Medical membership
  • 401(k) with company matching
  • Monthly commuter allowance, for travel to and from work

Synapse is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all of our employees. position: Senior Rust Open Source Maintainer - Bitcoin
description:
About Kraken

Our mission is to accelerate the adoption of cryptocurrency so that you and the rest of the world can achieve financial freedom and inclusion. In our first decade, Kraken has risen to become one of the largest, most successful and respected crypto exchanges on the planet.

We are changing the way the world thinks about finance and our range of successful products are playing a critical role in the mainstream adoption of crypto assets. We continue to trail-blaze into new territory with the introduction of Kraken Bank, providing a more seamless integration between crypto and the traditional financial system. This makes us the first crypto company (ever) to be awarded a U.S. state banking charter.

Our diverse group of 2,000+ Krakenites are distributed all over the world as part of our 'remote first' culture, united by a shared passion for delighting customers, upholding crypto values and achieving our meaningful mission. We attract people who push themselves to improve, are radically transparent and think differently in order to unlock their potential.

Crypto is a rapidly evolving industry and we’re just getting started. We’re growing fast and you're invited to join the revolution!

About the Role

The Tamás Blummer Memorial Fund was established by Kraken to honor the memory of an early contributor to the Rust Bitcoin ecosystem. The fund is searching for a senior maintainer to coordinate and improve the development process of Bitcoin-related Rust libraries.

Responsibilities

  • Release management for multiple crates
  • Solicit stakeholder feedback for bug fixes and features
  • Triage issues and pull requests
  • Coordinate code review and assist with merge conflicts
  • Help, encourage, and sponsor new contributors
  • Schedule and facilitate regular contributor meetings
  • Interact with Rust working groups with a focus on:Compiler versioning, back-porting, and toolchain compatibilityDeterministic and reproducible build processes
  • Excellent knowledge of Security and cryptography
  • Provide quarterly updates to the fund's board
  • Participation in webinars and on social media to showcase major releases

Bonus

  • You are able to work full-time
  • Interest in the Rust language, Bitcoin, Lightning, Liquid, and hardware wallets
  • Excellent reputation of humility and empathy with references available
  • Proven track-record of release management involving many stakeholders
  • Focus on project quality and maturity
  • Security-conscious

We’re powered by people from around the world with their own unique backgrounds and experiences. We value all Krakenites and their talents, contributions, and perspectives.

Check out all our open roles at https://www.kraken.com/careers. We’re excited to see what you’re made of.

Learn more about us

Watch "Top 10 Qualities of Kraken - How to Grow a Decacorn Remixed""
Follow us on Twitter
Catch up on our blog
Follow us on LinkedIn

We are looking for Software Engineering Summer Interns to join our growing Engineering team and make an impact alongside a collaborative team that’s transforming the homeownership industry.

What to expect during your 10 week internship:

  • You’ll have a direct impact on how Better is redefining the traditional mortgage industry. We’re putting the customer first and using technology to rebuild the homeownership process from the ground up.
  • You will work on a specific project critical to Better’s needs. We love when our engineers are versatile, display leadership qualities and are enthusiastic to take on new problems across the full-stack as we continue to push technology in the mortgage industry forward.
  • You’ll work in a collaborative team, be mentored by top engineers in the industry and see your work go live quickly.

Requirements:

  • Actively pursuing a Bachelor’s, or Master’s in Computer Science, or a related technical discipline with at least one remaining semester of school left after completion of the internship
  • Excited to work in a fast paced, high growth startup environment
  • A commitment to writing understandable, maintainable, and reusable software
  • A desire to deliver and a strong sense of accountability for your work
  • Experience programming in a modern language such as Python, Scala, Java, Node.js, Go

Applications close October 15, 2021. Applications are reviewed and interviews are scheduled on a rolling basis, so apply early!

Design, test, and integrate multiple high-density printed circuit boards. Drive designs through manufacturing process from integration of DFx feedback to mass production. Applicable skills include experience with both schematic capture and layout; power electronics; test and certification; and microcontroller firmware development.

As a Full Stack Engineering Intern at Brilliant, you’ll design and develop software for our Brilliant suite of smart home products. The work will span our front end UI to backend embedded software, including our third-party integration platform and server infrastructure. Our engineering team’s mission is to build a culture and environment of engineers that can tackle a multitude of problems in any area of our codebase. In this role, you will be working on a small, fast moving team on a sophisticated and modern software stack.

Responsibilities

  • Build, test, and maintain features on our Brilliant smart home products
  • Work with the rest of the engineering team to maintain a high level of code quality, performance, and reliability
  • Collaborate with product managers, designers, and technical leads to define product functionality and UI
  • Learn about multiple technologies ranging from user facing software to backend infrastructure and understand how these components work together to create the Brilliant Control

Qualifications

  • Pursuing a degree in Computer Science or related technical field, graduating in 2021 or 2022
  • Experience with Python or C++

As a Mobile Intern at Brilliant, you will work across both of our existing iOS and Android applications, building out the functionality and UI that form a key pillar of Brilliant’s vision of a unified smart home.

Responsibilities

  • Build, test, and maintain features in both our iOS (Swift) and Android (Kotlin) applications
  • Work with the rest of the mobile engineering team to maintain a high level of code quality, performance, and reliability
  • Collaborate with product managers, designers, and the rest of the engineering team to define product functionality and UI

Qualifications

  • Pursuing a degree in Computer Science or related technical field, graduating in 2021 or 2022
  • Excited about building native mobile applications
  • Desire to learn and grow fast

Preferred Qualifications

  • Proficiency in Swift OR Kotlin (at least one, both a plus)
  • Experience with building mobile applications (iOS OR Android, both a plus)
  • Experience with mobile development environments (XCode OR Android Studio, both a plus)

TapTab is a cutting-edge mobile application that is inventing the future of the dining experience, and we’re looking for great people who are excited about that future.

We are currently seeking a Backend Engineering Interns to join our development team. Our fall internship program runs from September 7 - December 3, 2021. As a Backend Engineering Intern, you will work on backend development tasks. Specific assignments will vary depending upon your interests and skills.

This is an excellent opportunity to participate in an exciting, emerging startup at an early stage; learn from a fun, friendly and highly-motivated team of developers; gain valuable work experience; and enhance your resume for future opportunities.

RESPONSIBILITIES

Your responsibilities will be to:

• Work with TapTab backend engineers on innovative web applications
• Research, test and contribute to the adoption of software architecture, programming languages and new technologies
• Write, test and document code, and ensure code quality, reliability and optimal performance

QUALIFICATIONS

• Recent Sofware Engineering Bootcamp graduate OR full-time undergraduate or graduate student in Computer Science or related field at an accredited college or university
• 3.0 GPA or higher
• Proficiency in and experience with backend end programming languages, specifically Node.js and Postgres SQL databases
• Interest in developing scalable, adaptive, high-performance apps
• Ability to write and test high-quality, readable, reliable and well-architected code
• Ability to define, understand, develop, test and iterate new product features
• Experience with markup languages
• Familiarity with Git version control
• Strong written and verbal communication skills

BONUS SKILLS & QUALITIES

• Deep interest in software development and knowledge of latest technological developments
• Knowledge of frontend or mobile development using React.js, Swift or Kotlin
• Interest in startups

The Backend Engineering Intern position is an unpaid role, and the intern is not considered an employee for wage purposes and shall not receive employee benefits, such as health or dental insurance, or pension or retirement credit. Participation in the internship does not guarantee the intern a job at the conclusion of the internship.

Applicants who receive college/university credit for internships are strongly encouraged to apply. And TapTab is happy to work with your educational institution to help you earn credit for your internship.

description:
If you want to be a rockstar by way of one of the hottest consumer companies this is that opportunity. When you tell people you helped build Tripd they will look at you with gazing intrigue. You will be that person who garners the attention in the room, should you want that. My outlook as CEO is building this company to allow you to thrive personally and in your career. Listed below is the role we need and skillset that you need to help us both get there.

As an intern at Tripd you will get the opportunity to soak knowledge directly from our founder and CEO who has an eclectic background from business apps development and sales for high profile enterprise clients to managing rappers (Thizz Ent), to founding/running various clothing lines from a factory in the mission district of SF. If you aspire to be an entrepreneur or business owner one day this will put you on the fast track to learning business strategy and how decisions affect the bottom line and growth of a business (your own app, retail, wholesale, whatever). Our founder and CEO is Silicon Valley born and raised with a deep rooted network and can help if you plan to move on to another opportunity after the internship. Internships are about learning and at Tripd you will learn about business and hear some interesting stories.

Summary:
As a full stack developer you will be delegated development tasks to further the ability and features of our current mobile app. Potential for full time employment and equity.

Skill needed:
-Experienced with React Native, Javascript, Typescript, Rest API
-Deploy new builds to Apple Store and Google Play through Expo.io
-Experience with Firebase, Facebook Integrations
-Experienced with deploying and maintaining hosted applications on AWS (EC2)
-Cross platform mobile development experience preferred
-Knowledge of UI/UX, data analytics is a plus

Requirements:

  • A full-stack mobile generalist with 1+ years experience
  • Write high quality, clean, scalable code, well documented
  • Deep familiarity with software engineering best practices
  • Able to communicate/articulate clearly in English, explain patiently and precisely if necessary -Understand why what you are working on will affect future builds/business decisions/target dates/other moving parts of the business
  • Provide meaningful updates on your work regularly -Experience building and deploying well-architected, maintainable, and testable infrastructure for our backend systems -Fix bugs and improve performance -Source code control with Github -Be able to manage your time, solve problems, be helpful

Ideal Candidate:
-Have a get stuff done attitude, while being a polite and generally pleasant person
-Not lazy, be proactive, understand how the tasks delegated to you will be helpful in developing the skillset you will need in the future. This isn't just for your resume, you will learn stuff that will give you a framework to work

Quantcast is hiring Software Engineering Interns to join our engineering teams in our San Francisco office.
As the real-time pulse of the Internet, Quantcast runs the world’s largest AI-driven insights and measurement platform directly quantifying over 100 million web destinations. Using machine learning to drive human learning, Quantcast provides brand marketers and publishers with meaningful audience insights, predictive targeting and measurement solutions across the customer journey.
As a part of the Software Engineering Internship program, you will lead a specialized project while having the mentorship of Engineers from different technical backgrounds. These Engineers have a real passion for technology, solving significant problems, and want to make a tangible impact.
You’ll have the opportunity to learn software engineering best practices and own projects from start to finish with teams that specialize in machine Learning, distributed storage systems, big data platforms, API development and data visualization.

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Our unique 10 to 12 weeks summer internship program provides you with a comprehensive introduction to the ad tech industry while being fully integrated into a team
  • You will have full project ownership and the autonomy to build impactful products. At the end of your internship, you will present your project to the entire engineering organization
  • We will pair you with a dedicated mentor on your team to ensure the success of your project. They will be your go-to person for any questions, suggestions, advice, and educational feedback
  • You will engage with executives and industry leaders through intern and company wide events. We believe in order to grow and be successful having access to all resources is key!
  • You will participate in fun and memorable events with fellow interns, mentors, and full-timers. Past events have included Cable Car Trolley Tours, volunteering, CAL Academy, scavenger hunts, and Giants games. While we do work hard we love to have fun!
  • We offer perks, which include intern housing stipend, snacks and drinks, catered lunches, dinners & weekly happy hours

Job Requirements

  • Excellent command of one or more programming languages: Java, C++ or Python
  • Deep understanding of algorithms and data structures
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Pursuing a BS, MS or PhD degree in Computer Science or related field
  • Graduation date between Dec 2020 and June 2022

Quantcast is an advertising technology company and the creator of an innovative intelligent audience platform that empowers brands, agencies and publishers to know and grow their audiences online. Our solutions are leveling the playing field for our customers when it comes to effectively reaching audiences online and helping them power a thriving free and open internet for everyone. Founded in 2006 and headquartered in San Francisco, Quantcast has employees in 20 offices across 10 countries.

We are committed to building an inclusive and diverse environment where everyone can be their authentic self. We work to ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

Recognizing the importance of flexible work environments, Quantcast is implementing a hybrid work model which will take effect October 18, 2021. The model gives employees the opportunity to work from home two days a week and work in the office for team collaboration three days a week. Employees can also work remotely for two weeks each year or apply for our fully-remote work program. Additionally, all U.S. employees working from a Quantcast office or who meet clients are required to be vaccinated against COVID-19. Outside of the U.S., vaccination guidelines are dependent on location.

Remora is an early-stage climate tech startup backed by Union Square Ventures and Lowercarbon Capital. We’re building a device that captures the carbon emissions from a semi-truck. Our founders include a former EPA scientist who pioneered mobile carbon capture during her PhD and a former diesel mechanic turned engineer who built electric semi-trucks for some of the world’s largest automotive companies.

We’re hiring several interns to support our engineering team, with responsibilities to include:

  • Running adsorption-desorption experiments
  • Collecting and testing captured carbon dioxide
  • Synthesizing and characterizing next-generation carbon capture materials
  • Building adsorption chambers for dynamic testing
  • Ad hoc tasks to support the science and technology teams

Requirements:

  • Research or work experience
  • Quick learner with a strong desire to tackle the climate crisis

Climate change disproportionately impacts communities of color, so we’re looking for candidates deeply committed to reducing emissions and to racial justice. We especially encourage people of color, women, and members of other communities underrepresented in startups to apply.

Logistics:

  • Location: Ann Arbor or Livonia, MI
  • Start date: ASAP (September)
  • Compensation: $20/hr for undergrads, $26/hr for graduate students
  • Commitment: 10-20 hours/week

Apply on our website: https://www.remoracarbon.com/jobs

About Epoch

Epoch is an employee engagement platform. Epoch automates workflows and analyzes all internal initiatives and events for companies like Reddit, Instacart and Asana.

Our platform is integral for workplace experience and employee program teams’ to automate internal communications, tracking engagement and integrate with employees’ existing tools.

We are backed by investors and founders, namely Precursor, Maschmeyer Group Ventures, Gelt VC, Katelin Holloway (prev. CPO of Reddit, Partner at Initialized), Caviar (acq. Square) founders and incredible angels. Epoch has recently closed $1M pre-seed and looking for driven, creative, and passionate individuals to join in our mission.

About the Team

We’re a team of 8. We are intentional with each hire as each new member is an immediate, impactful contributor to the product and culture as we grow.

Our company is fully remote for now (read: COVID). We have an office in Kitchener-Waterloo, and work across that location, Vancouver and San Francisco. Our hours are flexible and work best in PT and ET time zones.

Role:

You’ll build internal tools, dashboards, and queries that help with the reporting/analysis of how customers use Epoch.

This would include the following:

• Developing internal dashboards
• Creating useful SQL and GraphQL queries
• Helping to improve/refine Mode reports
• Assisting the Engineering Team in improving customer facing dashboards
Ideal Experience:
• Relational databases (SQL)
• Javascript (React)
• Python

About the role:

As a Sales Engineering Intern at Samsara, you’d be part of a diverse group of technically minded folks working together to bring our unique connected operations technology to customers. Our Global SE Team works with prospects and customers on solutions for logistics/supply chain management, fleet maintenance strategies, global asset management, machine control systems/diagnostics, system integration, and regulatory compliance. An SE Intern at Samsara would be interested in developing a thorough understanding of IoT hardware and sensors, hands-on installation/deployment scenarios, carrier networks, cloud infrastructure, third-party system integrations (via our open API), and how to apply that knowledge when designing solutions for prospects and customers. An SE intern also plays a key role in scaling the internal SE Operation as a whole.

In this role, you will:

  • Configure web-based dashboards and customize live product demonstrations so that prospects can trial our platform and see their specific use cases in action.
  • Write and deploy scripts in Python to ensure a seamless integration of Samsara’s platform into prospective customer’s existing software stack and tailor report formats from a broad set of data we gather about their vehicles, equipment, drivers, and technicians.
  • Explain and communicate technical documentation about vehicle telematics, equipment monitoring, compliance with transportation law and regulation, route tracking algorithms, and video-based safety that utilizes artificial intelligence and computer vision.
  • Produce and manage digital content to assist with product learning, product adoption, hardware installation, and software configuration to ensure internal teams are equipped with the tools needed to test, trial, and implement creative workarounds and new solutions.
  • Update and manage internal hardware and software lab infrastructure, both in office and remote kits. Coordinate and participate in new IoT gateway, dashboard camera, and accessory sensor testing activities.
  • Contribute to product development by identifying and refining examples of challenges that specific types of businesses face that Samsara can help solve.
  • Provide front-line technical feedback to internal development teams.
  • Coordinate cross functional communication to identify proper security documentation for different verticals and industries and execute RFP responses.

An ideal candidate would:

  • Complete a Bachelor’s in Computer Science, Electric and Electronic Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, or a related technical field between Fall/Winter 2022 - Fall/Winter 2023
  • Have a customer-first mindset and a passion for working with people to design and build scalable solutions involving both hardware and software components
  • Be as interested in cutting and splicing wires in various machinery as you are in scripting software solutions
  • Have an interest in sales strategy and competition, conveying ROI to stakeholders, and presenting the right technical solution based on unique customer environments
  • Enjoy understanding our users and what would make their day-to-day processes easier to manage
  • Have a solid history of tinkering with hardware gadgets, sensors, networks, and vehicles. Be able to highlight several applications you’ve designed in the past.

About the Role

We are looking for talented engineers to join our backend infrastructure and full-stack teams! These Summer 2022 roles will be based in our San Francisco and Atlanta offices.

Backend infrastructure engineers design and develop the infrastructure that powers Samsara’s IoT platform. You will work on scaling our data ingestion and storage systems to support more and more connected devices, and work with engineers throughout the company to make new types of data analysis possible.

Full-stack engineers design and develop features across a broad surface area with tangible impact on active and future customers. The features you build will provide actionable insights for our customers' operations. The engineering challenges you will tackle may include architecting data structures for mass data collection or presenting data analytics in intuitive and performant ways on web and mobile

We use Golang for our firmware and backend, Typescript and React for our web client, GraphQL to fetch data from our backend, and React Native for our mobile app. Direct experience with these technologies is not required.

An ideal candidate would:

  • Complete a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science or a related technical field between Fall/Winter 2022 - Summer 2023
  • Have built or worked on production applications
  • Enjoy understanding our users and what would make their day to day processes easier to manage
  • Love shipping features that are immediately used by our customers
  • Seek to iterate on new products based on customer feedback
  • Be available for 10-13 weeks in San Francisco or Atlanta starting in May/ June

Aviatrix, is a well-funded, late-stage (pre-ipo), hyper-growth enterprise-software company based in the heart of Silicon Valley (Santa Clara, CA); and is pioneering the way enterprises digitally transition to cloud, as this is becoming essential for every organization. More than 500 customers worldwide trust and leverage Aviatrix, and our proven multi-cloud network reference architecture to design, deploy and operate a repeatable network and security architecture that’s consistent across any public cloud. We have a top-tier, experienced team, combined with a collaborative culture built on proven success, trust, execution, and respect. We’re focused on getting things done!

We’re a cloud network platform that delivers advanced networking, security, operational visibility, and control required by all enterprises, coupled with the simplicity, automation, and agility of cloud. Coursera was launched in 2012 by two Stanford Computer Science professors, Andrew Ng and Daphne Koller, with a mission to provide universal access to world-class learning. It is now one of the largest online learning platforms in the world, with 87 million registered learners as of June 30, 2021. Coursera partners with over 200 leading university and industry partners to offer a broad catalog of content and credentials, including Guided Projects, courses, Specializations, certificates, and bachelor’s and master’s degrees. Institutions around the world use Coursera to upskill and reskill their employees, citizens, and students in many high-demand fields, including data science, technology, and business. Coursera became a B Corp in February 2021.

Coursera’s Engineering teams are responsible for maintaining a scalable and reliable platform. Engineering works to build interactive products for the worldwide learner community. As an engineer at Coursera, you will be empowered to build well-engineered products that shape new platform features and advance our technical infrastructure. You will be encouraged to build reliable, scalable, testable, and efficient systems.

This internship will run from January 3 to April 22. During the 16 weeks internship, you'll be embedded as a member of a small Engineering team and paired with a mentor on your team. You will have the guidance, environment, and the responsibility of deploying your projects to production. You will work on real projects, features, and updates that will affect millions of learners worldwide!

Check out life at Coursera on The Muse!

Basic Qualifications:

  • Currently pursuing a B.A./B.S. Degree or higher in Computer Science, or related technical field
  • Must be currently enrolled in a full time degree program and returning to the program after the completion of the internship

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Strong competencies in data structures, algorithms and software design
  • Demonstrated software engineer experience via an internship, work experience, school projects or coding competitions.
  • Self-motivated, smart, hands-on, relentlessly focused on impact, and able to operate under a great deal of independence

Coursera is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer and considers all qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, marital status, national origin, protected veteran status, disability, or any other legally protected class.

If you are an individual with a disability and require a reasonable accommodation to complete any part of the application process, please contact us at accommodations@coursera.org.

Please review our CCPA Applicant Notice here.

Databases are the beating heart of every business in the world.

Cockroach Labs is the team behind CockroachDB, an open source, distributed SQL database. We strive to build infrastructure that keeps pace with the world, so developers can focus on what matters most: building the best products. Come and join us on our mission to Make Data Easy. Are you ready to aim high and build to last?

The Role

We are looking for extraordinary Backend, Full-stack, and Frontend Engineering Interns to join our team!

  • Design, code, and test the web frontend for CockroachCloud or the backend for our distributed, open source database, CockroachDB. You will bring your expertise to the table to provide the best user experience to our users, partners, and customers.
  • You will collaborate with web designers, product managers, and customers to create user friendly experience to deploy, manage, monitor CockroachDB. A huge bonus is that even after your experience at Cockroach Labs ends, your code will live on in our open source GitHub repo, CockroachDB. Come help us on our mission to enable every developer to build world-changing applications! ### The Expectations

In your first 30 days, you will become an integrated member of our engineering team. During this time, you will work on a starter project that allows you to gain confidence in navigating the code base and gain familiarity with our engineering environment. We believe that it's important for you to take this first month to become familiar with our technology and our company.

For the next 3 months, you will contribute to our codebase for CockroachDB, CockroachCloud, or our developer infrastructure. After wrapping up your starter project, you will work with your manager to focus your efforts on a project that aligns with your interests and the product roadmap.

You

  • You are pursuing or have recently completed studies in Computer Science or a related technical field, graduating between December 2022 and May 2024.
  • You have had exposure to coursework on subjects like distributed systems, concurrency control, data replication, file systems, or SQL processing.
  • Comfort using programming languages like Javascript, React, Redux, Go, C/C++, Java, and Python/Django. We use React.js, Redux, and Typescript on the client side and use Go on the server side. If you don't know any of these languages, you'll learn them while you're here.
  • You love building relationships with your colleagues. You enjoy being part of the code review process and partnering with your teammates on challenging problems.
  • You have past experience working on production-level code.
  • You are genuinely interested in Cockroach Labs' mission and are excited to use CockroachDB in your projects.

Our interview process consists largely of programming in a real environment, and we'll be evaluating you on the skills listed above.

Cockroach Labs is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer building a diverse and inclusive workforce. If you need additional accommodations to feel comfortable during your interview process, please email us at accessibility@cockroachlabs.com.

The Basics:

At Tanium, our Technical Solutions Engineer (TSE) Interns have the opportunity to learn valuable, real-world experience from the world’s leading enterprise pre-sales technical organization. Operating in a highly collaborative team environment with other TSEs,TAMs, engineers, and account managers, interns will contribute to our team’s success by shadowing and assisting TSEs with discovering and addressing customer issues, product positioning and demonstrations, Proof of concepts and overall solving customer business problems using Tanium technology. An intern can look forward to applying their best technical chops and their presentation and communications dexterity to enterprise environments while also building new skills, ranging from sales to scripting.

What you’ll do:

  • Provide support for the TSE role and areas of relevance to customer initiatives
  • Content development to solve customer challenges
  • Demo Tanium to partners and potential customers
  • Building use cases for Tanium modules
  • Proof-of-concept support
  • Partner enablement and pre-sales support
  • Process improvement
  • Training
  • Best practice building and capturing inspiring customer interactions from around the world

We’re looking for someone who is:

  • Authorized to work in the US
  • Full-time student currently enrolled in a college or university with a high GPA
