About Tanium:

At Tanium, we offer a proven platform for endpoint visibility and control that transforms how the world's largest and most sophisticated organizations manage and secure their computing devices with unparalleled speed and agility. There’s a reason why more than half of the Fortune 100, top retailers and financial institutions, and all branches of the US Armed Forces rely on Tanium.

Our unstoppable spirit, drive to do the right thing and win as a team attitude has earned us the rank of 7th on the Forbes list of “Top 100 Private Companies in Cloud Computing” for 2019 and 10th on FORTUNE’s list of the “100 Best Medium Workplaces.”

On a mission. Together.

At Tanium, we are stewards of a culture that emphasizes the importance of collaboration, respect, and diversity. In our pursuit of revolutionizing the way some of the largest enterprises and governments in the world solve their most difficult IT challenges, we are strengthened by our unique perspectives and by our collective actions.

We are an organization with stakeholders around the world and it’s imperative that the diversity of our customers and communities is reflected internally in our team members. We strive to create a diverse and inclusive environment where everyone feels they have opportunities to succeed and grow because we know that only together can we do great things.

The Basics:

At Tanium, our Technical Solutions Engineer (TSE) Interns have the opportunity to learn valuable, real-world experience from the world’s leading enterprise pre-sales technical organization. Operating in a highly collaborative team environment with other TSEs,TAMs, engineers, and account managers, interns will contribute to our team’s success by shadowing and assisting TSEs with discovering and addressing customer issues, product positioning and demonstrations, Proof of concepts and overall solving customer business problems using Tanium technology. An intern can look forward to applying their best technical chops and their presentation and communications dexterity to enterprise environments while also building new skills, ranging from sales to scripting.

What you’ll do:

  • Provide support for the TSE role and areas of relevance to customer initiatives
  • Content development to solve customer challenges
  • Demo Tanium to partners and potential customers
  • Building use cases for Tanium modules
  • Proof-of-concept support
  • Partner enablement and pre-sales support
  • Process improvement
  • Training
  • Best practice building and capturing inspiring customer interactions from around the world

On a mission. Together.

At Tanium, we are stewards of a culture that emphasizes the importance of collaboration, respect, and diversity. In our pursuit of revolutionizing the way some of the largest enterprises and governments in the world solve their most difficult IT challenges, we are strengthened by our unique perspectives and by our collective actions.

We are an organization with stakeholders around the world and it’s imperative that the diversity of our customers and communities is reflected internally in our team members. We strive to create a diverse and inclusive environment where everyone feels they have opportunities to succeed and grow because we know that only together can we do great things.

Who we are

Social media has the ability to touch hearts, open minds, and influence what we buy, eat, and do. But today, marketing a product on platforms such as TikTok, Instagram, and Youtube is done by “gut feel” and its effectiveness is not adequately measured and optimized. That’s why Prune.ai exists: to help brands and influencers grow their business on social media by leveraging the power of data and algorithms. As a market leader in machine learning applied to influencer marketing, we get people excited to grow their earnings and return on marketing spend, all while saving 10x the time. Our team is a diverse crew that has one thing in common: our love for innovative thinking. If you’re passionate about transforming the future of social media marketing with data and algorithms, you’re just our type.

Job Description

During your internship at Prune, you will get the chance to tackle challenging problems including iterate quickly on a consumer-facing app; make architecture decisions with lasting impact; work with scientists to implement the latest ML algorithms in image recognition, NLP, and recommendation engines.

Qualification

  • Currently enrolled as a full-time junior or senior student in Computer Science or related field.
  • Previous internship experience or completed projects and coursework using CS fundamentals.
  • Experience with back end frameworks like Django or Python
  • Proven ability to communicate complex concepts clearly and simply

This is a paid internship role. You must be able to commit a minimum of 15-20 hours per week and a min of 3 months

position: Games For Change - Game Development Internship
description:
The Verse Is An Engine For The Development Of Games That Impact Health And Wellbeing.

Interested in Gaming, Games For Change, Games For Health? We are looking for you! The Verse is building experiences and games that gamify mindfulness, contemplation, and prosociality. We are building games that are entertaining and fun to play, and have a positive impact on your health and wellbeing. We are building tool sets that measure the impact of our game mechanics on wellbeing, mental health, and consciousness.

*We are an early stage startup with lots of gaming hats to wear. *

  • Game Design Engineering
  • Unity or Unreal programmer: Intern able to code/program. Contribute to existing projects and work with The Verse team to create new games and game mechanics. We are always open to new ideas!
  • Story Telling.
  • Graphic Design.
  • Art Direction.
  • Digtal Art & Animation.
  • Artists.
  • Philosophers.

*Current Projects. *

  • Games: WalkXR, BardoVR, TaB'd Raven Simulation.
  • Game Mechanics: Attention Mechanics, Breath Mechanics, Binaural Beat/Color Frequency Mechanics, and Pre & Post Measurement Mechanics.

We are looking for candidates that are interested in Transformative Technology, Virtual Reality/Augmented Reality/Extened Reality (VR/AR/XR), game design/development, story telling, animation, graphic design, UX/UI, health and wellbeing, data analytics/big data, games for change, positive psychology, neuroscience, Buddhism, psychedelics, or growth hacking.

What will you get working with The Verse?

  • Opportunity: Experience working with emerging VR and VR gaming technologies.
  • Visionary Product: Be part of the team that is building an awe-inspiring gamified tool that changes lives.
  • Access: The Verse is working with a visionary group of transformative technology thinkers, innovators, entrepreneurs, and artists who want to change the world.
  • Training: Opportunity to work on a diverse range of projects (VR, data analytics, product development, biz development, and social media/marketing).
  • References/Recommendation

Please include your resume, and tell us what you think about building a metaverse! If you do not hear from us, please be patient – we are growing rapidly. Info about our projects @ https://bit.ly/3BaG5Vd. Contact info@w3ll.xyz for more info and/or with any questions!

Thanks.

Ben Simon-Thomas
Co-Founder

The Verse team:

  • Ben Simon-Thomas - Executive Producer. Buddhist-leaning entrepreneur and ecosystem developer. Founded startups in the 3D space (SoundFit: 3D Scanning & ODMS: parts-on-demand), social commerce (GroupGain), worked in health-care startups and life style modification businesses (PMRI). MA in Buddhist psychology, degrees in Religious Philosophy and Language.
  • Anshul Pendse - Experience Design. Anshul is a world-builder, experience designer and creative technologist. With a background in feature film VFX, computer animation, interactive media and game design, Anshul builds immersive, multi-sensory virtual worlds that elicit the sense of heightened awareness, mindfulness and altered states of consciousness.

More About The Verse:
The Verse is a network of communities that explore transformation and growth. Guided by our "verse building in the open" mantra, we cultivate an ecology of practices to reimagine a shift in consciousness. We have three areas of focus: art, gaming,and education.

  • Art - collecting, crowdsourcing, curating art around transformational themes (awe, prosociality - aka “tend and befriend”, perspective taking, empathy)
  • Positive Gaming - building game mechanics that gamify mindfulness, contemplation, and prosociality. Building tool sets that measure the impact of our game mechanics on wellbeing, mental health, and consciousness.
  • Education - an emergent model of learning and action based around the central themes of systems, play and design. [Gaming Literacy] Our structure enables The Verse to organize around smaller, focused nodes of interest that incubate experimental initiatives, while the wider network develops and organizes activities that have a broader scope.

The Verse Is An Engine For The Development Of Digital Experiences That Shift Health & Wellbeing.
Interested in gaming and games for change, games for wellbeing/health, digital therapeutics, positive psychology, the power of art to heal and transform? Do you want to build a “metaverse”? We are looking for you! TheVerse is building digital experiences and games that improve wellbeing. We build game mechanics around mindfulness, meditation-based techniques (calm focus, equanimity, compassion), prosociality, empathy taking, and perspectivising. We believe that games have great potential to improve our wellbeing/health practices.

*The Verse seeks candidates with an interest in the following: *

  • Psychology of Wellbeing.
  • Prosociality (tend and befriend).
  • UX/UI and HCI (Human Centric Innovation)
  • Digital Therapeutics design/development.
  • Behavioral health nudges.
  • Gamification of wellbeing interventions.

Projects Include:

  • Game design/development.
  • UX/UI.
  • User Research.
  • Pre and Post game measurement.
  • Data collection/data analysis.

The Verse is a network that explores transformation and growth. Guided by our "verse building in the open" mantra, we cultivate an ecology of practices to reimagine a shift in consciousness. We have three areas of focus: art, gaming,and education.

  • Art - collecting, crowdsourcing, curating art around transformational themes (awe, prosociality - aka “tend and befriend”, perspective taking, empathy, consciousness, transformation, psychedelics)
  • Positive Gaming - building game mechanics that gamify mindfulness, contemplation, and prosociality. Building tool sets that measure the impact of our game mechanics on wellbeing, mental health, and consciousness. Some of our games @ https://bit.ly/3yaw3kQ.
  • Education - an emergent model of learning and action based around the central themes of systems, play and design. [Gaming Literacy] Our distributed structure enables The Verse to organize around smaller, focused nodes of interest that incubate experimental initiatives, while the wider network develops and organizes activities that have a broader scope.

We are looking for candidates that are interested in gaming, games for change/health/wellbeing/, gamification, Transformative Technology, XR (Virtual Reality/Augmented Reality), game design/development, health and wellbeing, data analytics/big data, games for change, positive psychology, neuroscience, Buddhism, psychedelics, or growth hacking.

What will you get working with TheVerse?

  • Opportunity: Experience building impact games. Be part of building a MetaVerse.
  • Visionary Product: Be part of the team that is building an awe-inspiring gamified tool that changes lives.
  • Access: TheVerse is working with a visionary group of transformative technology thinkers, innovators, entrepreneurs, gamers, neuroscientists, clinicals, academics, and artists who want to change the world.
  • Training: Opportunity to work on a diverse range of projects (game dev, data analytics, product development, biz development, and community building).
  • References/Recommendation

Please include your resume, and tell us what you think is interesting about The Verse! If you do not hear from us, please be patient – we are growing rapidly. Please include your resume, and tell us what you think is interesting about The Verse! If you do not hear from us, please be patient – we are growing rapidly. Info about our projects @ https://bit.ly/3BaG5Vd.

Contact info@w3ll.xyz for more info and/or with any questions! We are always interested in connecting with the right people..

Thanks.
Ben Simon-Thomas
Co-Founder

TheVerse team is 20+ entrepreneurs, artists, and game developers with experiences and expertise (MAs & PhDs) in gaming, world building, metaverses, build in the open, community development, health & wellbeing.

  • Ben Simon-Thomas - Founder/CEO. Buddhist-leaning entrepreneur and ecosystem developer. Founded startups in the 3D space (SoundFit: 3D Scanning & ODMS: parts-on-demand), social commerce (GroupGain), worked in health-care startups and life style modification businesses (PMRI). MA in Buddhist psychology, degrees in Religious Philosophy and Language.
  • Anshul Pendse - Experience Design/PhD. Anshul is a world-builder, experience designer and creative technologist. About the Role:

We are looking for a Software Development Intern who will assist us with the design, development, and installation of software solutions. Your duties will include development, writing code, and documenting functionality. You should be able to build high-quality, innovative and fully performing software in compliance with coding standards and technical design.

About Sezzle:

Sezzle is a cutting-edge fintech company whose long-standing mission is to financially empower the next generation. Only one in three millennials own a credit card, and the vast majority of millennials possess a subprime credit score or no score at all. To address these problems, Sezzle has built a payment platform that increases purchasing power for consumers by offering interest-free installment plans at online stores. This increase in purchasing power for consumers leads to increased sales and basket sizes for the numerous eCommerce merchants that currently work with Sezzle.

As the first and only B-Corp in the payments space, Sezzle’s goal is to help everyone pursue financial freedom, and to invest in social good and ethical initiatives that shape a better world.

At Sezzle, we’re committed to putting purpose alongside profitability. We work hard to maintain rigorous standards of social and environmental performance, accountability, and transparency to build a better world. The employees at Sezzle lean into significant societal and cultural shifts, ensuring internal and external focus on positive impacts that benefit our community.

Responsibilities:

  • Organize software development lifecycle
  • Prepare specifications and determine operational feasibility
  • Write well-designed, testable, and efficient code
  • Organize, document and maintain software functionality
  • Integrate software components into a fully functional software system
  • Evaluate and deploy software tools, processes, and metrics
  • Ensure compliance with project plans and industry standards

Ideal Skills & Experience:

  • Significant experience in developing web applications
  • Knowledge of Relational Databases, SQL and ORM technologies
  • Experience in designing interactive applications with test-driven development
  • Experience with Python, Go, React, and AWS
  • Close familiarity with software engineering tools, software development methodology, and release processes
  • Working towards a BS degree in Computer Science or Engineering

Minimum Requirements:

  • Pursuing a bachelor’s degree with at least 2 years of coursework completed (Junior)
  • Excited about the opportunity to work and grow with an early stage startup
  • Preferred GPA of 3.5 or higher on a 4.0 scale
  • Ability to multitask
  • Ability to present/communicate across different teams
  • Organized

About You:

  • A+ character. We are team-first here at Sezzle.
  • A hard-working mentality. It’s early and there is still a lot to build.
  • An excellent communicator.
  • Ownership. You aren’t afraid to take on new responsibilities and you act like an owner in everything you do.
  • A fun attitude. Life’s too short. We can have fun while we work hard on cool things.

About the Role:

As a Credit Analyst Intern, you will work to ensure that new merchant applications are fully investigated to accurately project the potential monetary risk the accounts pose to Sezzle and take proactive steps to mitigate that risk. You will ideally be able to start as soon as possible and work at least 20 hours a week throughout the school year.

Our Company

Sezzle is a cutting-edge fintech company whose mission is to financially empower young consumers. Only one in three millennials own a credit card, and the vast majority of millennials possess a subprime credit score or no score at all. To address these problems, Sezzle has built a payment platform that increases purchasing power for consumers by offering interest-free installment plans at online stores. This increase in purchasing power for consumers leads to increased sales and basket sizes for the hundreds of eCommerce merchants that currently work with Sezzle.

As the first and only B-Corp in the payments space, Sezzle’s goal is to help everyone pursue financial freedom, and to invest in social good and ethical initiatives that shape a better world.

At Sezzle, we’re committed to putting purpose alongside profitability. We work hard to maintain rigorous standards of social and environmental performance, accountability, and transparency to build a better world. The employees at Sezzle lean into significant societal and cultural shifts, ensuring internal and external focus on positive impacts that benefit our community.

  • Define, execute and document processes and reports for all merchant credit application functions.
  • Automate merchant decision processes in order to proactively mitigate merchant account losses.
  • Work closely with Merchant Success and Support teams to resolve merchant risk issues and provide guidance on overall risk tolerance and policy.
  • Challenge the status quo by working collaboratively as well as independently on projects focused on improving internal methods, policies, and internal tools

  • Detective sense. You have natural intuition when something is wrong and are able to identify the issue

  • Preferred GPA of 3.5 or higher on a 4.0 scale

  • A fun attitude. Life’s too short. We can have fun while we work hard on cool things.

description:
Hardware Electronics Development Engineer

SNSR Fusion Technologies as a Company
At SNSR Fusion Technologies, our mission is to address the safety concerns of the communities and providing affordable and accessible solutions for mobility and transportation: this is done with goals of Vision Zero as targets: “eliminate all traffic fatalities and severe injuries, while increasing safe, healthy, equitable mobility for all.” Currently, the most progressive safety and technological advancements seem to be exclusively accessible to passenger vehicles directly through the manufacturers and/or OEMs and are often not affordable or accessible for populations with lower socioeconomic status.

With the advancement of AI and Machine Learning technology over the past decade, the evolution of optics and photonics as sensing components, such as LiDAR, lasers, and cameras for computer vision have accelerated the field of edge sensing and detection; now this technology and these components are readily available and accessible for SMEs and startup firms. The innovative safety and technological advances provided by SNSR Fusion include the use of these components, integrated with specific sensor fusion algorithms, for mobility and transportation market solutions.

Position Overview
As a Hardware Electronics Development Engineer, you will take the sensing and actuation goals of the various SNSR Fusion products and integrate them into usable and durable packages for customer use. This includes utilization of remote processing tools Arduinos, Raspberry Pis, and NVIDIA Jetson products, along with various sensor types and actuators, for specific integrated safety devices, in vehicles.

This position requires a strong understanding microcontroller firmware creation and wiring, along with usage of multiple sensors and actuators. Additionally, strong hardware electronics diagnostic and troubleshooting skills are preferred. Above all, your desire to learn and struggle with new concepts, while embracing teamwork in a fast-paced environment, will set you apart.

Specific Skills

  • Comfortable coding in C-based languages, Python, (Javascript and XML are plusses), Matlab/Simulink
  • Has project experience using an Arduino, Raspberry Pi, and associated hardware electronics (experience with NVIDIA processing hardware is a plus… Jetson Nano, TX-2, PX-2, Xavier, GTX 1080, 1081, RTX 2080, 3080, etc.)
  • Has project experience scripting with various types of sensors and actuators, especially driving actuators based on input sensor data with use on an Arduino, Raspberry Pi, NVIDIA Jetson products, or another type of embedded controller
  • Has some project experience with using cameras, radar, lidar and ultrasonic sensors as in input devices for automotive applications
  • Has applied project experience scripting with electric motors, motor drivers, tracking motor output, tuning motor output, and understanding basic requirements for motor hardware specifications and purchasing
  • Has experience plotting sensor input data, and actuator output data in real time, from embedded software processing units
  • Comfortable with electronic wiring, soldering, and wiring diagrams
  • Has experience and is comfortable troubleshooting hardware electronic problems as well as debugging firmware scripts to access sensor data or to activate actuators
  • Knows various methodologies to attain and process sensor data, as well as monitor actuator motion, in real time
  • Can create reports that summarize results, processes, key points of understanding, and difficulties involved with designing, and implementing a hardware electronics project

location.city: Boston • Oslo • San Francisco Bay Area • Remote

description:
You: An empathetic, I'll-try-anything-once, eager-to-learn, data-geek (and hopefully city-lover), who is looking to get a taste of the startup rollercoaster, ready to assist us in our research and development efforts that will help citymakers harness the power of data to create more just, thriving place, and want to love life while working with a dynamic group of just plain-good people working to make the world (at least slightly) better!

Us: A lean-startup-devotee, data-geeky, digitally-nomadic, passionate group of city-lovers with a mission to (use data to) make places more livable, equitable, and sustainable, and thereby make people happier, healthier, and thrive! More here: www.stateofplace.co

Where you come in: Our Founder & CEO, Dr. Mariela Alfonzo has been a thought-leader and innovator in the urban design & behavior research, practice, and academic space for over 20 years. Throughout those years, she's developed unique and cross-cutting research methods, methodology, data acquisition tools, and algorithms and has run extensive statistical analyses to understand the trandisciplinary nature of what makes cities tick, how that in turn impacts us, and ultimately, how that translates into value - including health, social, environmental and economic value. She's striven to use data-driven and evidence-based approaches to both advocate for better urban design AND increase the effectiveness, cost-efficiency, and inclusiveness of the urban design and development process. Throughout it all, we've amassed a LOT of data - that as a small startup - we just haven't had the time to further mine and utilize to answer even more pressing and/or interesting questions. So we are looking for a data science intern who is ready to jump into the deep end with us, from bearing through the mundane aspects of data science to researching and implementing some of the most exhilirating and cutting edge data science techniques, specifically:

  • Explore hidden patterns in the State of Place data
  • Enhance the visualization of our geospatial and built environment data
  • Mine multiple datasets to help better understand how the built environment impacts value & equity
  • Assist in creating/refining statistical/regression/ml models for better citymaking decisions

Primary Job Requirements:

  • Proficiency in one or more of the following languages: Python, R, Octave, or any mathematical language.
  • Experience using statistical software such as SPSS, Tableau, PowerBI, Excel, or similar tools.
  • Proficiency with Geospatial data, ArcGIS, QGIS, Geopandas, Shapely or similar library.
  • Has familiarity and worked with different statistical and/or machine learning models.
  • Detail oriented, curious, self-motivated

What you get: This is an unpaid internship, but clearly, you'll get a ton of on-the-job training (you'd be mentored by our Founder/CEO and Machine Learning Scientist), enjoy flexible working hours, and gain invaluable experience working with an innovative, fast-paced startup.

Duration: 10-40 hours per week; min. 4 month commitment

Location: Remote (work anywhere in North America, Europe, or East Asia with internet access)

Join us in disrupting the urban planning and real estate industries - replacing the top-down, opinion-based, expert-driven approach accessible to a few with a data-driven, evidence-based one, accessible to the many - in order to help create more livable, equitable, and sustainable places people deserve.

*When applying, please submit your cover letter (or equivalent note) along with your resume and application. Applicants who do not submit a substantial note/cover letter will not be considered. This is because we want to understand what interests you about State of Place and this position, why you think you'd be a great fit, and what skillsets you have/want to develop.)

If you have any questions, shoot them over to careers@stateofplace.co.

Keep on hustling!
Mariela, Founder/CEO State of Place

The Skinny: State of Place is an AI-driven, urban design data and predictive analytics software. We have developed machine learning models to extract 150+ datapoints about urban design (e.g., sidewalks, trees, benches, outdoor dining) from digital street-level images and open source data. Our proprietary algorithms aggregate this data into the State of Place Index, which measures an area's quality of place, and is broken down into ten sub-indices that measure aspects of urban design empirically tied to people's choices to live, work, or play in some locations over others. Our software allows users to visualize this information graphically and geospatially to identify areas of need. Our forecasting models have tied the Index to social, economic, health, and environmental value, which our AI-models translate into urban design recommendations most likely to lead to desired impacts. And our scenario tool allows users to see how changes to the built environment impact the Index, and also, uniquely, calculate the return on investment of making those changes. No existing tools capture this kind of micro-scale urban design data at scale. Further, most analytics tools only capture data on existing performance; we generate specific, actionable recommendations for how to create more livable, equitable, and sustainable places, while maximizing value across the quadruple bottom line.

Last Spring, in the midst of Covid, we hit a significant technological milestone for the company - we automated our data collection process using visual machine learning, allowing us to extract urban design data from digital stree-level imagery! This has some exciting implications for all aspects of State of Place, from the enhaned solutions we can now offer our customers, to the kinds of projects we can take on, to our revenue model, to our sales strategy, and yes, to our product development and R&D.

State of Place History: State of Place can be traced back to 2003, when our Founder/CEO, Mariela, accidentally became a data-geek while creating a tool to objectively measure the built environment characteristics that impact the way people feel about their cities. She soon embraced this new-found title, and began a consulting company, - Urban Imprint - realizing that quantifying what made for good urban design - and calculating its tangible value - was actually the key to convincing people to make cities better (and thereby improve people's lives). Fast forward 13 years later, five years after first offering State of Place as a consulting product, we were awarded a grant from the National Science Foundation's Small Business Innovation Research program that funded the MVP (first saleable version) of our software. Today, we have worked with nearly 40 cities and developers in the US, Europe, and Asia, and counting.

Check out our website to learn a bit more about State of Place!

We are looking for a Backend Software Engineer (contractor) to help us complete our website. You will work directly with our Lead Software Developer. We are a team of informed dreamers. We work hard, support each other, and explore the possibilities. You will learn and hone applicable skills under the direction of a more senior engineer to build a well-rounded skillset.

WHO WE ARE

We are a virtual reality language learning platform called Gabb Global. www.gabbglobal.com We are looking for a front end developer intern that can help us create language learning experiences for students across the country. Though this internship is unpaid, once we get funding you will be offered a full time. We are a team of 13. We want to launch our app in March, and we are doing pilots at UC Davis right now. Our mission at Gabb Global is to develop the best education in the world and make it universally available. With over 500 pilot users, we strive to become the most popular language-learning application in the world. But we have got more left to do — and that is where you come in! You will help create and define cohesive, high-visibility branding projects tied to increasing brand awareness and equity. We are a multilingual, diverse group of people who work in small, cross-functional teams to create the world's first gamification and virtual reality language learning app. From composing landing pages to collaborating closely with our marketing team on innovative projects, you will have the opportunity to work on brand projects and marketing campaigns that push Gabb's mission forward, help us become an iconic brand, and transform the future of education. You’ll work with our front and back end team to tackle unique Gabb Global's technical challenges ! You will work with a fun and diverse team to build intelligent software used by hundreds of students in California.

WHAT YOU'LL DO

  • Model and texture characters and environments for multiple styles of play
  • Collaborate with designer and engineers to create the look and feel of our products
  • Define how environmental elements interact with users and function within the world
  • Give and receive constructive and creative feedback across art disciplines

WHO YOU ARE

As a 3D artist, you can model anything and everything. You are in school or starting a career in product design. Since we're still growing, we need someone who can make the world, character, textures, and light and animate the whole scene! You might wear many hats, but at the end of the day, you're a doer, like us. You've spent some hours honing your artistic skills - degrees are pleasant, but portfolios speak volumes. You're at your best when working with others. You're not afraid to speak up, take critique, or push for and take ownership of something you passionately believe in. You're someone who wants to take creative risks and enjoys solving problems. You're a passionate gamer yourself and understand how the aesthetic and fiction of a game can be just as impactful as the core game loop, and you enjoy playing games when you can

WHAT'S REQUIRED

  • 3+ years of 3D modeling (low poly, high poly, standard map extraction)
  • You have professional experience in a game engine like Unreal, Unity, or Lumberyard
  • Expert at Maya, 3D Studio Max, Blender, or similar 3d program
  • Strong organic and hard surface modeling/texturing skills
  • Ability to create efficient in-game geometry & textures with clean topology
  • Ability to transform concept art or reference photos into a high-quality 3D model
  • Experience texturing in Substance Painter/Designer or similar programs
  • Experience creating PBR materials
  • Desire to improve and grow yourself and continually hone your skills
  • Ability to own a project from beginning to end
  • Proficient in Agile/Scrum development

SKILLS

  • Knowledge of 3D: history, tools, methodology…
  • Perfect knowledge of design methodology
  • Ability to coordinate teams
  • To do research on the context and the users' needs (interviews, questionnaires, observation, etc.), identify the behaviors, and formalize the analysis results in the shape of personas.
  • To definer the target experience and the interactions to highlight
  • To formalize the experience(s) to implement
  • To elaborate the specifications
  • To define the stakeholders of the implementation

description:
Company Description
**
Whether on the go, in the subway or at home on the sofa, Gabb supports those who enjoy learning at work and school. Since its founding in 2017, the company is growing. In total, Gabb Global offers three learning languages, English, Spanish, and German. Professional courses will be readily available via the Gabb Global website as well as on your smartphone or tablet by the end of this year. Gabb is for businesses, schools, and individual language learners. Their learning needs, life experiences, and reference points become more varied and colorful by the day, ensuring users see themselves reflected —not just in our product but also in the world, allowing them to imagine with us. That means reflecting the dynamism and diversity of our users, as much as possible, in the production of Gabb. We currently have fifteen people from more than six nationalities working in New York, Los Angeles, and D.C., challenging and learning from each other at every step. A culture of difference and dignity is critical to connecting with more users in every hemisphere. As we complete our pilots at universities, we need someone to create fun immersive social media content to provide a refreshing language learning experience to our customers for our launch in 2021. We are looking for a talented Social media intern to join our team, and create and maintain a robust online presence for Gabb Global. Your role is to implement online marketing strategies through social media accounts. As a Social media coordinator, you will develop original content and suggest creative ways to attract more customers and promote our brand. We are looking for a game development/design intern to help us build amazing games for students K5-3rd grade.

Who we are

Gabb Global is devoted to creating a comfortable and cutting-edge method of language learning. Gamification, technology, and innovation are paramount to engaging today's learners and enabling sufficient content mastery. My start up, Gabb, takes the foundations of neuroscience, a language curriculum tailored to user interests/purpose, and filter foreign language through real-world learning scenarios, and powerful learning dynamic of gamification (aka what makes games fun!): escape, collection, discovery, pattern recognition, and other risk/reward activities. We masterfully integrated elements of gamification to engage, inspire, and improve user’s conversation, writing, speaking, and listening skills. Our we focus on gamification as a design sensibility.We are looking for a talented Game developer to turn a game idea into code on a fast moving environment. You will be involved in various aspects of game’s creation from concept to finished product including coding, programming, audio, design, production and visual arts. As a Gabb Global Gaming Development Intern, you are helping us constantly break new ground with graphically rich mobile games, fun new genres of mobile entertainment, and innovative technologies.

Responsibilities

Implement game functionality as per communicated design
Translate design specification into functional game
Communicate with other team members to establish effective pipeline and integrate media assets
Design, build, and maintain efficient, reusable, and reliable code
Ensure the best possible performance, quality, and responsiveness of applications
Identify bottlenecks and bugs, and devise solutions to address and mitigate these problems
Help maintain code quality, organization, and automatization

Skills

Excellent knowledge of Unity, including experience with scripting, textures, animation, GUI styles, and user session management
Familiarity with level design and planning
Experience with game physics and particle systems
Experience with mobile and console game development
Experience optimizing memory and space usage for support of older hardware
Experience with 3D is a plus
Prior experience with a well-known mobile title or AAA titles are a significant asset

Whether on the go, in the subway or at home on the sofa, Gabb supports those who enjoy learn-ing at work and school. Since its founding in 2017, the company is growing. In total, Gabb Global offers three learning languages, English, Spanish and German. Professional courses will be readily available via the Gabb Global website as well as on your smartphone or tablet by the end of this year. Gabb is for businesses, schools, and individual language learners. Their learningneeds, life experiences, and reference points become more varied and colorful by the day, ensur-ing users see themselves reflected —not just in our product— but in the world, allowing them to imagine with us. That means reflecting the dynamism and diversity of our users, as much as pos-sible, in the production of Gabb. We currently have fifteen people from more than six nationali-ties working in New York, Los Angeles, and DC, challenging and learning from each other at every step. A culture of difference and dignity is critical to connecting with more users in every hemisphere. As we complete our pilots at universities, we need someone to help make the neces-sary changes to provide a refreshing language learning experience to our customers for our launch in 2021.

You have:

·Experience building scalable applications using modern languages like Python, Ruby or Node.JS,
·Experience with at least one component-based frontend framework like React, as well as HTML, CSS
·Basic understanding of application security including authentication protocols like OAuth2
·Testing experience on different levels: unit, integration, contract, and E2E
·Knowledge of SQL and/or NoSQL databases
·Understanding of system health and performance metrics, as well as ability to perform browser debugging
·Experience with distributed, multi-tenant, could-based systems
·Understanding of lean and agile practices
·Willingness to cooperate with the product and business stakeholders building together a trust working environment
·Efficient communication and interpersonal skills
·Love for an open, inclusive culture that supports learning and encourages collaboration
·Fluency in written and spoken English

Responsibilities

·Create authentication login
·Build, maintain, and take ownership of a rich ecosystem of applications and services
·Be part of feature teams and build end-to-end customer features
·Ensure that the systems you own are healthy, resilient, and perform well
·Collaborate cross-functionally on feature design, architectural decisions, and assessing technical debt
·Work with cutting-edge tools and services like Terraform to shape our AWS infrastruc-ture or DataDog to visualize our metrics
·Shape our coding guidelines and quality standards

Why Gabb?
·Work within a high-performing team at Gabb.
·A steep learning curve – personally and professionally.

TO APPLY

Description
We’re looking for collaborative and committed volunteer developers to join our remote tech team. This is an exciting opportunity to work on our flagship product: the AsylumConnect Catalog (the world's first tech resource platform designed for those fleeing persecution due to sexual orientation or gender identity). This is an essential position and a fantastic volunteer opportunity for anyone looking to use their strong knowledge of web and mobile application development for social good.

Time Commitment: This is an unpaid (volunteer) and remote position. We are looking for volunteers who are able to devote 10-15 hours per week to AsylumConnect.

Responsibilities

  • Report directly to our Tech Lead.
  • Contribute to our Catalog web and mobile application development.
  • Collaborate with our volunteer UX designers to develop and deploy new features, and ensure a positive user experience.
  • Write code to maintain server-side logic, manage the application database, and add new features.
  • Ensure the Catalog is mobile-friendly and cross-browser compatible.
  • Plan for future changes to our Catalog website, web application and mobile applications (iOS and Android).
  • Work to efficiently fix any technical bugs as they arise.

AsylumConnect’s Tech Stack:

  • JavaScript
  • React
  • Heroku
  • MongoDB
  • Express.js / Node

Qualifications

  • 2+ years experience with web and/or mobile application development.

  • JavaScript
  • React
  • Heroku

  • Express.js / Node
  • You are comfortable using online communication tools (e.g. Slack, Asana, G Suite, Zoom).

Internship Positions (FALL 2021 ONLY)

Behaivior Contact: (hello@behaivior.com)

We hire interns on a rolling basis in all areas. We have filled immediate openings and are currently reviewing applicants for fall 2021 and beyond. Please don't hesitate to reach out with inquiries and resumes. We are open to interested US-based people of any age, students, student groups, people switching careers and looking to gain new skills, etc. Interns have the potential to be hired onto the team afterwards. Time requirements are flexible, usually we prefer a minimum of around 15 hours per week, and can be project-based or remote.

Applicants interested in or experienced in data science, machine learning, or software development are highly encouraged to apply.

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and strongly encourage women, gender-diverse, LGBTQIA+ folx, people of color, and any other minorities to apply.

description:
Giftpack Inc.
👉🏻 About Giftpack ( https://giftpack.ai/about )
Product: https://giftpack.ai | https://giftpack.io

We are a paramount AI gifting solution for business ROI.

Hiring Giftern 2021

Your love startup culture and want to experience more.
You've got the clever recipes to make things simple.
You make friends just for fun because you love it so much.
You've spent countless sleepless nights honing your skills.
And You're Ready to work on a project that challenges you.

Giftpack grows business with the only gifting platform that provides real personalization at scale in ABM, Sales, Customer Success, and Employee Rewards.

On the consumer side, we are a global on-demand gifting service that can make people send gifts across cities and countries in just 3 hours with unforgettable gifting experiences. We create a vision for people to treat without geo gap, language and culture barriers in seconds with strong Ai, tons of thousands of brand partners and delivery packers around the world.

You'll join a team of top-notch people and help build incredible products to make it successful. You will be pushed to your project planning limits on partnership and share economy management. Our state of next-generation on gifting needs you to perfect it.

At Giftpack, you'll have friends, have the purpose, make a difference, and get excited about the challenge you face every single day. And at a company that has achieved huge growth for the last 2 years, you'll be comfortable, happy, challenge, and important for sure.

We also Require

In the global startup company like us, we need you to have so much passion for the things that we are building. We love professional people but we need more agreements on our vision to push the company forward.   If you've ever worked with a team of top-notch people you know how good it feels. There is comradery, everyone jokes around, it's awesome. We've found that to make sure we are bringing in the right guys for our team, it's best if we ask all applicants to take a short test. We will send this to you after we get your application. The best candidates find this test enjoyable. They also appreciate the vetting process. If we didn't do this we'd risk sending our guys into battle with noobs, (which is bad enough in Call of Duty and worse in real life).

This is a Job

The reason why we are able to offer great benefits and relaxed culture is that the people we have got their stuff done. We work hard here. Your team will expect a lot out of you and they expect a lot out of themselves. This job is for the "work hard, play hard", type of people, not the "I'm lazy and still want cool benefits" type. You'll have a lot to get done, always. If you are the type who will try to exploit our freedoms and benefits then you won't last long here, so don't apply. If you like to work hard, have fun, grow, get better, and enjoy your time with a good team then this is the place for you.

Cultures

Here are some articles we wrote to convey the work life at Giftpack. Feel free to take a look before submitting your application.

Giftern 2020: Pros and Cons of the #WFH Trend
https://medium.com/giftpack/giftern-2020-pros-and-cons-of-the-wfh-trend-3133e8a4cc13

Giftern 2020 : What Are the Responsibilities of a Digital Marketer?
https://medium.com/giftpack/giftern-2020-what-are-the-responsibilities-of-a-digital-marketer-a396514cd83e

Giftpack Digital Marketing Internship 2020 Summer — Giftern Interview Journey
https://medium.com/giftpack/giftpack-digital-marketing-2020-summer-giftern-interview-journey-c03374efb80b

Giftpack HR — The Culture and Framework of Remote Working
https://medium.com/giftpack/giftpack-hr-the-culture-and-framework-of-remote-working-61701d58419

Giftpack HR — Gifterns
https://medium.com/giftpack/giftpack-hr-giftern-dcf9c228c3c8

Salary

The salary you are going to get depends on your position and our current financial status. Uncertainty is how we embrace the world.

We now offer our Giftern program 2021 with the opening positions:

Business Developer Giftern
Operation Giftern
UI / UX Designer Giftern
Frontend Engineer Giftern
Backend Engineer Giftern
Data Engineer Giftern
Content Marketer Giftern

Application

Please make sure you apply on https://giftpack.typeform.com/to/k9a3fPiX.
We will get back to you no later than 7 business days.

Have experience with Angular 7 as the front end and Node.js in the backend.
Independent developer who can learn on their own and work in a team setting.
Remote friendly.
Must be in their final year of their Bachelor's or post undergrad at minimum.

-Have passion towards solving large problems in the healthcare industry. -- -Proficient in Python where you can build preventative models using medical data and the API's.
-An independent developer that can work in a team setting and be able to get over obstacles without micro supervision.
-Have some experience in the healthcare industry by working with EHR systems would be a plus!
-Experience with Pytorch
-Experience building nueral networks
-Have some experience with large datasets
-Passion for startups and healthcare!

Required to be working on or have their Master's in CS or Data Science.

-Programmer in Nodejs.
-Has knowledge/experience with Angular framework.
-Would be open to learning about new technologies and cloud platforms such as AWS.
-Healthcare experience a plus
-Must be driven, hardworking, and love to solve challenges!

  • Familiar with Agile framework.

COMPANY DESCRIPTION

Epoch Games is a volunteer based, all-online, global game development team (we have no centrally-located headquarters). Most of the original founding members were modders developing the total conversion Middle Earth Roleplaying Project (MERP) mod for the Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim:
http://www.moddb.com/mods/merp-middle-earth-roleplaying-project

Currently Epoch Games is developing Lays of Althas: Sundered Order (LoA:SO). LoA:SO is an in-development indie open-world RPG set in an original fantasy world. The game is being developed using Epic Games' Unreal Engine 4 (UE4):
https://www.unrealengine.com/

For more information about the game, please check out our IndieDb page:
http://www.indiedb.com/games/the-lays-of-althas-sundered-order

NOTE: Although Epoch Games does have a formal office at the listed address, we have a fully-online team at this time. Communication is mostly done via Slack (an instant messaging application) and Trello (an online project collaboration tool).

JOB DESCRIPTION

In this volunteer position you will be working closely with other members of the Coding department to develop C++ code and/or Blueprint scripts for the Lays of Althas: Sundered Order (LoA:SO). Keep in mind that we are using Epic Game’s Unreal Engine 4 (UE4) to develop the game, and knowledge of how C++ code and/or Blueprint scripts interacts with UE4 is required. Knowledge of both C++ programming and Blueprint scripting in UE4 is recommended, but knowledge of one of the two is required.

Communication is key to a smooth and efficient pipeline, you must be able to communicate clearly and effectively with other team-members and not be afraid to ask should any problems arise. We are an English-speaking team, so English fluency is a must.

If you are comfortable with teaching, you may be called upon to aid the more junior members of the team in any relevant area.

Other duties include: attending Slack meetings (Slack is an instant messaging we communicate with); completing monthly reports; and following team policies.

QUALIFICATIONS

Minimum Skill Requirements:

  • Either C++ programming experience in Unreal Engine 4 and/or strong Blueprint scripting experience in Unreal Engine 4
  • Providing clear and legible code
  • Online communication, team-collaboration skills, and English fluency
  • A passion for coding and a dedication to creating AAA quality games

Recommended Skill Requirements:

  • Knowledge of both C++ programming and Blueprint scripting in Unreal Engine
  • Git Version Control experience
  • AI programming/scripting
  • At least 1 Unreal Engine project (using C++ code and/or Blueprint scripts) prepared to show prior to the interview. If none, we can provide an assignment before or at the interview.

Minimum Hardware Requirements:

  • The ability to run Unreal Engine 4 (https://www.unrealengine.com/register).
  • The ability to run a C++ IDE. Visual Studio Community Edition (https://visualstudio.microsoft.com/downloads/) with the Unreal Engine package is recommended.
  • The disk space and Internet Speeds to download (pull) several GB of game files, as well as upload (push) files to an online version control repository.

COMPANY DESCRIPTION

Epoch Games is a volunteer based, all-online, global game development team (we have no centrally-located headquarters). Most of the original founding members were modders developing the total conversion Middle Earth Roleplaying Project (MERP) mod for the Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim:
http://www.moddb.com/mods/merp-middle-earth-roleplaying-project

Currently Epoch Games is developing Lays of Althas: Sundered Order (LoA:SO). LoA:SO is an in-development indie open-world RPG set in an original fantasy world. The game is being developed using Epic Games' Unreal Engine 4 (UE4):
https://www.unrealengine.com/

For more information about the game, please check out our IndieDb page:
http://www.indiedb.com/games/the-lays-of-althas-sundered-order

NOTE: Although Epoch Games does have a formal office at the listed address, we have a fully-online team at this time. Communication is mostly done via Slack (an instant messaging application) and Trello (an online project collaboration tool).

JOB DESCRIPTION

In this volunteer position you will be assisting to manage and coordinate the C++ Programmers and Blueprint Scripters at Epoch Games. You will be working alongside our Lead Unreal Engine C++ Programmer (who oversees the Coding Department, which include C++ Programmers and Blueprint Scripters). You must be able to spare a fair amount of hours to be online to communicate with the Coding Team on a regular basis. Keep in mind that The Lays of Althas: Sundered Order (LoA:SO) is being developed in Epic Game’s Unreal Engine 4 (UE4); strong knowledge of C++ Programming (and how C++ code interacts with UE4) and/or Unreal Engine Blueprint Scripting knowledge is required.

The ability to communicate and organize other Coders is another key skill required in this position. It is key to a smooth and efficient pipeline, you must be able to communicate clearly and effectively with other team-members outside of the department, such as our Artists, Animators, Riggers, Level Designers and Writers. We are an English-speaking team, so English fluency is a must.

Other duties include: attending Slack meetings (Slack is an instant messaging we communicate with), reporting the progress of the Programming team on a weekly basis and following team policies.

QUALIFICATIONS

Minimum Skill Requirements:

  • Either C++ programming experience in Unreal Engine 4 and/or strong Blueprint scripting experience in Unreal Engine
  • Providing clear and legible code
  • The ability to review other C++ Programmers' code and/or Blueprint Scripters' scripts
  • Managing and organizing other Coders, and a fair amount of spare-time in order to manage and communicate with them.
  • Online communication, team-collaboration skills, and English fluency
  • A passion for coding and a dedication to creating AAA quality games

Recommended Skill Requirements:

  • At least 1 Unreal Engine project (using C++ code and/or Blueprint scripts) prepared to show prior to the interview. If none, we can provide an assignment before or at the interview.

Minimum Hardware Requirements:

  • The ability to run Unreal Engine 4 (https://www.unrealengine.com/register).
  • The ability to run a C++ IDE. Visual Studio Community Edition (https://visualstudio.microsoft.com/downloads/) with the Unreal Engine package is recommended.
  • The disk space and Internet Speeds to download (pull) several GB of game files, as well as upload (push) files to an online version control repository.

We are pre-revenue, so there is no salary at the moment

Who Are We?

Sanomind is building an audio creator platform for licensed mental health professionals. Think, Patreon/Headspace for therapists.

We are an open platform where any licensed mental health professional can create and publish audio content.

We respect the seriousness of mental health, but we want to make it as cool as going to the gym to work on your physical body.

We're not just another mental health startup, company or directory.

Still with us? Keep reading : )

What's important to us?

We care deeply about the people who are lost and looking for answers. The people who can't afford therapy, but need a little guidance.

We care about our partners; the licensed mental health professionals on our platform and the future members.

We're looking for someone that is passionate about using technology for good. You like going in the opposite direction. You don't follow the crowd or what's "in." You start trends and create new lanes. You have ideas and more importantly, you execute on those ideas.

And of course, you are passionate about mental health and wellness.

Your Mission

In this mission, you will be an important part of the engineering team. You will be responsible for everything frontend working alongside the CTO.

You will:

  • Develop new user-facing features and enhance current ones
  • Build reusable components and front-end libraries for future use
  • Translate designs and wireframes into high-quality code
  • Optimize for maximum performance

Qualifications:

  • Modern HTML and CSS
  • React Native
  • JavaScript (ES6)
  • Functional knowledge of Github
  • AWS
  • Experience with issue tracking systems

Nice to haves:

  • An eye for design and UX
  • Strong sense of good engineering and architecture

description:
Job Description

Resolve is a social media app (in development) where users can put up monetary incentives called "bounties" to get things done online. On Resolve you will be able to turn your dollars directly into the actions of others. Resolve supports free market competitive forces for efficiency, but is run with the intent of improving the world and the people in it. Our company culture is one that celebrates productivity for the sake of positivity. If you would like to work for Resolve you will need to see the value in both!

As an intern, you will have a significant and meaningful role in the development of the prototype Resolve Web application. You will be working side-by-side with the Founders of the company, contractors, and interns to help build the beta version of the app. There is an opportunity for full-time employment (with equity compensation) if you prove to be a valuable team member.

What will you be doing?

1. Working closely within your team of interns while taking guidance from the Co-Founders.

2. Turning mock-ups and text descriptions of pages/features into functioning code on a web app.

3. Developing an algorithm to rank posts in a user's feed based on which users they are following and which topics they are interested in.

4. Learning on-the-job to do tasks you may not have experience with. The app will be made from the ground up and while working at a startup, you must wear many hats.

You don't have to be skilled in all of the above, since we will be recruiting team members with complementary skills. If you believe in Resolve and are willing to work hard we encourage you to apply. If you are interested in working for Resolve you may fill out the online application form here: goo.gl/forms/D1jRsgiFxPPYMLGm2

Developer's Website: resolvedevs.com

Bitome is a four-year-old, Boston-based life science instrument company commercializing compact and portable chemical analysis tools used in magnetic resonance spectroscopy. Bitome’s first product is a continuous metabolic monitoring solution for synthetic biology and biomanufacturing. Using microsystem technology compatible with scaled manufacturing processes, Bitome delivers a game-changing life science research tool for a fraction of the cost of existing products.

Bitome is hiring an intern to help with designing, building, testing, and fabricating of mechanical parts for fluidic handling and automation of our bioreactors.

You will be responsible for:
• Designing and building of mechanical components for peristaltic pumps, valves, fluidic automation
• Mechanical design of bioreactors, motors, stirrers
• Mechanical design of fluidic and gas ports and connectors
• Communicate results with team members

Requirements for the position are:
• CAD modeling using Autodesk Fusion 360 / Solidworks
• Experience with rapid prototyping and mechanical assembly
• Experience with peristaltic pumps, valves and fluidic handling automation

Come join our team’s quest to democratize molecular spectroscopy and along the way we may just change the world.

About bird&be

The current fertility experience is broken, and we want your help fixing it. We offer personalized fertility kits, designed to help our customer's optimize their outcomes, no matter the stage of their journey. With rising infertility rates, our kits will help educate our customers on their fertility health early, and help them take action with personalized supplements and prescription medication that is scientifically proven to impact outcomes. All delivered together in a beautiful box right to their doorstep.

We are a very early stage startup, and are building a brilliant team that is excited to help solve this complex problem.

The Opportunity

As a Software Developer Intern, you’ll be working on the frontend/backend or both, of our web application and eCommerce store. You'll be working very closely with the senior developer, and our designers on a day-to-day basis.

Over the course of the internship, you will have the opportunity to do and learn various things such as :

  • Deploying changes to production on a regular basis
  • Building out new components and features in React
  • Polishing our store presence on BigCommerce via native Javascript, HTML and SCSS
  • Performing code reviews, bug fixes, and writing tests
  • Building out new logic for our recommendations algorithms in NextJS
  • Learning tips and tricks needed to make an online store successful through SEO Optimization, Performance Monitoring, and Error Reporting

Is this the right fit?

  • Currently enrolled in a post-secondary program and looking for an 4 or 8 month internship for the Fall 2021 Term or starting the Winter 2022 Term.
  • Must be eligible to work in Canada (no sponsorships)
  • You want to be part of a small, very early stage startup that is having a massive impact on people's lives. You are self motivated, love to collaborate, and resourceful.
  • We are dealing with a very emotional (and sometimes traumatic) subject matter for our customers, so your empathy must run high.
  • You’re looking to take responsibility and ownership of a product, that you’ll have a big impact on from the onset
  • You’re comfortable working with minimal oversight and direct management

The Skillset

  • Experience with HTML, CSS is required
  • Familiarity with JavaScript is preferred
  • Experience with React/Next.JS is a nice to have
  • 1 or more completed internships is preferred

The Current Tech Stack

  • Amazon Web Services (AWS)
  • BigCommerce (E-Commerce Platform)
  • NextJS
  • React
  • SCSS
  • Github Actions
  • Vercel

The Interview Process

  • Virtual Chat with our Senior Developer
  • Take home Challenge OR an Existing Project Review
  • Challenge/Project Review with the Developer
  • Meeting with COO &; CEO
  • Offer

Any Questions?

Have more questions? Feel free to reach us at jobs@birdandbe.com.

The Bird&Be Story

We've walked this fertility journey too.

We've experienced first hand how frustrating the fertility journey can be, and there are a lot of things we wish we knew sooner. For starters, it’s not that easy, but also, there are lots of things you can do to optimize your body for success.

We offer fertility-supporting products and services to help you do just that, without leaving your home and no matter what stage of the journey you’re in.

All of this will be done under a brand umbrella that resonates with our customer base. We see a future that is different than the current "family planning" aisles filled with blue and white boxes, plastered with photos of white babies on them. Our brand will reflect the modern millennial. Less First Response, more Glossier and Knix.

Bird&Be is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations and will work with you to meet your needs. If you are a person with a disability and require assistance during the application process, please don’t hesitate to reach out! We celebrate our inclusive work environment and welcome members of all backgrounds and perspectives.

Transformative Tech is currently recruiting team members to join our research team led by Nichol Bradford (https://www.linkedin.com/in/nicholbradford/), co-founder, and publisher of Transformative Technology. This research team seeks to gather people who are passionate about redefining human wellbeing through technology. As a part of this team, interns will each be given their own project to deep dive into how technology (i.e. Artificial Intelligence, AR/VR, BioTech, etc.) is currently being used or could be used towards accelerating human wellbeing (i.e. mental, social, physical, emotional, human performance) in the future.

This position will be most valuable and meaningful for individuals looking to become a founder, investor, or researcher in the field of Wellbeing Tech. This opportunity will allow you to follow your own curiosity and meaningfully contribute to the mission of transforming global wellbeing by shaping our research focus.

Each team member will focus on deep diving into one topic that is among the next frontiers of the mission to accelerate human wellbeing through:

  • Interviewing founders, researchers, and investors in the Wellbeing Technology space
  • Tracking notable founders investors, scientists, and companies in Transformative Tech
  • Analyzing research reports and scientific papers to identify and summarize trends and opportunities
  • Analyzing the gaps in the current focus area and opportunities for the future

Examples of the type of companies you will get to interact with include:
*NeuroTech companies such as Muse (immersive meditation device utilizing neurofeedback), Intheon (world's first neurotechnology middleware platform), and others. *

  • Muse is an immersive meditation device that utilizes EEG ot provide real-time feedback on your mental activity, heart rate, breathing, and body movements to help you build a consistent meditation practice. *BioTech companies such as Oura (personal health tracking device), Epicore Biosystems (proprietary sweat microfluidic sensing platform) *
  • Oura is one of the top personalized health-tracking devices that helps users track their capacity to perform, sleep quality and activity levels. Social Robotics companies such as Moxie (revolutionary robot companion for children)
  • Moxie is a revolutionary robot companion for children that supports social, emotional, and cognitive development through play-based learning. Future of Work companies such as Skillprint, TRIPP, and Perfometric
  • TRIPP is the award-winning leader in XR wellness, offering clinically validated, measurable XR and mobile experiences designed for mind-body health.
  • Performatric is a real-time monitoring system to track and manage mental fatigue in a non-invasive and non-intrusive way. *And more companies utilizing examples of tech listed to improve human wellbeing, such as Artificial Intelligence, AR/VR, Digital Therapy, Healthy Spaces Tech, Wearables, and more.

What will you get working with Transformative Tech?

  • Opportunity: Experience in the transformative technology space.
  • Visionary Product: Be part of the team that is building technologies that will impact 1B in 10 years.
  • Access: Work with a visionary group of transformative technology thinkers, innovators, entrepreneurs, gamers, neuroscientists, clinicals, academics, and artists who want to change the world.
  • Community Workshops: Explore topics in the Transformative technology space with thought leades and visionaries.
  • Training: Opportunity to work on a diverse range of projects (game dev, data analytics, product development, biz development, and community building).
  • References/Recommendation

Strong candidates will demonstrate:

  • A motivation and ability to self-organize and self-manage projects .
  • Deep curiosity and passion for understanding how to improve human wellbeing.
  • Interest in the science of wellbeing.

Position logistics:

  • Position is unpaid. We support OPT/CPT and academic credit internships (if your school offers these programs).
  • Compensation available through the federal work­ study program for qualifying students.
  • Requires a minimum ~15 hrs per week (depending on role and responsibilities).
  • Full-­time and part-time internships available throughout the fall, spring, and summer periods. Requires a minimum commitment of 1-2 months (longer commitments - a plus!).
  • Work will be remote with video conference meetings.

The pandemic has not only brought to light but accelerated our global awareness of the need to address our wellbeing today. Additionally, moments of disruption like the one we are in right now highlight how we need a next generation of humans that can go beyond maintaining the status quo by rethinking what it is we need to focus on and how we can do so. This internship aims to help develop our next generation of individuals who can lead and reimagine our fundamental state of global wellbeing.

Please include your resume, and tell us what you like about the Transformative Tech initiave! If you do not hear from us, please be patient – we are growing rapidly. More info @ https://transformativetech.org/. Contact paola@ttacademy.co for more info and/or with any questions!

We look forward to hearing from you.

Ben Simon-Thomas - Transformative Tech - Berkeley Chapter Leader

Paola Téllez Muñoz - Transformative Tech - Project Lead and Recruiting Manager

description:
Rainier Capital is a venture studio that invests in disruptive frontier technologies. We primarily focus on companies using blockchain technology to enable new economies and create network effects. Our founders have previously invested in over 30 blockchain companies worldwide. The firm’s strategy includes venture, liquid, and incubation/studio. We are looking for talents that are hungry and passionate about cryptocurrencies, and blockchain technology investments. As opposed to joining a larger fund, our team will give you exposure for all perspectives of blockchain investments including early stage venture investments, activist approach investments and hedge fund strategy investments. You will be able to take the investment strategies learned and apply them in the most interesting emerging technology investments.

  1. Ideal Candidates We play in an intersection of tech, finance, and community. We are primarily looking for two types of candidates but open to others that fit the mold:

(1) Candidates that have a technical degree or related work experience (CS, Engineering, Math etc) and have a deep understanding of computer science, distributed systems, consensus algorithms, crypto-economics, smart contracts, networking, game theory and other relevant fields to blockchain technology. Ability to do strong technical analysis for early and late stage blockchain companies. Work experience in the financial markets a plus.

(2) Candidates from top tier institutions/companies in related industry. Ability to apply industry (ex: financial market) knowledge to crypto (ex: defi) space and deeply understand technical components.

  1. Other requirements
    (1) Excellent written and communication skills - explain complex concepts in simple terms to non-technical audiences;
    (2) Hustler that's passionate about crypto, ablility to travel and hustle for developer events, deal sourcing, building networks, etc
    (3) Startup mindset, acts proactively (without direction at times), eager to learn something new in crypto everyday
    (4) Builder that thinks in first principles

  2. Responsibilities
    (1) Sourcing early stage investment opportunities in emergent companies and protocols and due diligence of prospective investments. Screening projects by reading protocol specifications and evaluating the technical teams
    (2) Working closely with technical and non-technical teams building their crypto-economic model, smart contract security, and other questions that come up around protocols and software; Actively keeping track of portfolio companies progress and helping them solve problems;
    (3) Writing and publishing research reports for the firm;
    (4) Some operational assignments for the fund

This will be an unpaid internship with the opportunity to work with a startup and a young team of entreprenuers. Upon 3 months of the internship we will be looking to hire someone full time once we have made enough revenue to bring on a full team.

The Manual QA Tester is responsible for manual end-to-end testing of new features and functionality prior to release to production and works closely with our product and development teams to resolve bugs.
You strive to make your code modular, reusable, and clear for all who come after you. You want to be a part of a growing team that cares about code quality, emphasizes code ownership, and supports those practices through clear acommunication, regular application reviews and comprehensive automated testing.

Role:
• Analyze user stories and other requirements and participate in product backlog grooming sessions to ask questions and gain thorough understanding.
• Develop functional and integration test cases for user stories that ensure the functionality developed meets the requirements and acceptance criteria defined by stakeholders
• Record test plans and test results into airtable
• Conduct browser and mobile browser testing
• Open defects, track and confirm their resolution before closing
• Participate in all Agile-related team meetings, including planning events, daily Scrum/Kanban check-ins, product demonstrations, and retrospectives
• Effectively communicate issues with the user interface or usability of the site to stakeholders
• Develop documentation for manual tester procedures and best practices

You
• At least 3 years of experience as a manual tester of software applications, including front-end and back-end application testing
• Demonstrated understanding of the end-to-end QA process, especially within an Agile framework, from user story/requirements analysis, through test case development and execution
• Experience with cross-browser and cross-platform testing
• Excellent attention to detail, with an ability to multitask and meet deadlines
• Capable of working collaboratively in an agile, cross-functional team environment and effectively communicate ideas and opinions to the team
• Working knowledge of testing methodologies, industry tools and best practices, with strong analytical and troubleshooting skills

Vien Health is an inspired team with a mission to transform the health of everyone, everywhere through the best possible medicine. We are building a new operating system in healthcare - one that combats the biggest challenges in healthcare across Africa. Our work is inspired by our members’ journey and our actions are focused on impact and results. We excel in a dynamic, while appreciating what it means to be healthy and well.

We are looking for a full-time Backend Engineer to build elegant APIs and evolve our data models and systems architecture in a secure, HIPAA compliant environment. We are a revenue-generating, health-tech startup reinventing the primary care model.

You will develop and evolve the systems which power our business model. Making our billing, medical charting, scheduling, audio and video conferencing and other systems talk to each other. Our unique user data has to be kept secure and available at all times — the patient portal and our business insights depend upon it. We have a fully containerized and distributed infrastructure using MongoDB, Azure app services, deploys happen via Git and CI, and our larger stack that includes React / Redux.

Role

  • Develop and evolve third-party integrations and systems synchronization
  • Maintain and add to a service-oriented architecture
  • Ensure code-quality and availability of our backend infrastructure
  • Creating new API features to support consumer-facing products
  • Create routines and data models to support business analytics
  • Explore promising new technologies to further differentiate our care and product

You

  • 3+ years work experience as a software engineer
  • BS degree in Engineering, Computer Science or a related field. In lieu of a degree, relevant work experience and/or trade school is acceptable
  • Experience developing RESTful APIs in modern web frameworks MongoDB, CI tools, testing frameworks and other code quality tools are crucial
  • Azure/ AWS / cloud-centric development experience is required
  • Work with modern databases like PostgreSQL, MySQL, MongoDB
  • Our stack uses Node.js, so server-side JS experience is preferred
  • A strong background with scalable data systems is a huge plus

We are building a new operating system in healthcare - one that combats the biggest challenges in healthcare across Africa. We’re seeking a front-end software engineer to join our project team.

You will play a key part in developing the components of a scalable platform that will enable the ability of small practice providers to deliver care to their patients virtually. You are dependable, efficient and routinely deliver the right things having deeply understood the problem at hand. You write simple and readable code and are always looking to improve your own practices.

Role

  • Developing features with React/Redux for a browser-based SPA
  • Proven skill in responsive web design, social, and other digital platform experiences (jquery/javascript/html/html5/css/css3/scss/sass/less)
  • Creating reusable components for our in-house React component library
  • Writing unit tests for your work with sufficient code coverage (>= 80%)
  • Fixing bugs and helping to reduce tech debt
  • Regularly conducting code reviews on open pull requests
  • Experience with Azure DevOps (dev.azure.com or some other enterprise source control)

*Front-end stack *

  • Mono-repo using yarn workspaces
  • JavaScript (ES6+) / Node.js
  • React with Redux
  • CSS3 using Less, Styled Components, and Emotion Jest with Enzyme and React Test Utils
  • Webpack and Gulp
  • GitHub

You

  • Advanced proficiency in JavaScript (ES6+), with a working knowledge of Node.js.
  • General web development principles and best practices. You know how a browser works and in what order things are parsed and executed.
  • At least two years of experience developing React/Redux SPA backed by a JSON API.
  • You can take a design and turn it into semantic HTML and pixel-perfect, responsive CSS.
  • Unit testing of React Components.
  • Ability to provide insight into our current processes, architecture and UI/UX.
  • Familiarity with a module bundling system like Webpack or Rollup.

As an intern looking to level-up your skills and work on an impactful project, you will get a chance to work on an open source project that involves Typescript, NodeJS, React and other adjacent technologies.

The focus will be on helping you level-up and have something concrete to put on your resume. As a small group of developers, you will also get a mentor and a chance to see how other developers are dealing with their careers.

We will be creating a side-project generator and a gallery to display different side projects. The project has a pretty clear and well defined goal, but there is a lot of innovation that can be done.
