Cuberg is commercializing a next-generation lithium metal battery to power the rise of electric mobility. Our battery technology provides huge benefits in terms of energy density, power, and safety, all in a format that allows for rapid scaling. Be part of a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to transform the future of electric mobility.

We are currently seeking motivated Interns in the areas of materials science, engineering, data, and test. These positions require strong knowledge in chemistry, engineering, data, or science.

We are looking for candidates who have a passion for making an impact in our sustainable energy future and who will thrive in a rapidly evolving, close-knit, and dynamic early-stage startup environment. The ideal candidate will think independently, be unafraid to take on major responsibilities, and perform all tasks with diligence and care.

Join us in building the future of energy.

About

Cuberg is commercializing next-generation battery technology to power the future of electric mobility. The company was acquired in 2021 by Northvolt, a global supplier of sustainable, high-quality battery cells and systems. As Northvolt's Advanced Technology Center operating in Silicon Valley, Cuberg is developing and commercializing lithium metal batteries, building an innovation ecosystem around lithium-ion technology, and leveraging Northvolt's state-of-the-art manufacturing capabilities to rapidly scale up production of advanced batteries.

Responsibilities

  • Analyze experimental results to understand the impact of cell materials on cell performance
  • Assist scientists and engineers with material preparation, cell assembly, and testing
  • Prepare reports, present and share results with team members
  • Work closely with the battery modeling team members

Requirements

  • Currently pursuing a B.S., M.S. or Ph.D. degree in Computer Science, Mechanical Engineering, Chemical Engineering, Material Science, Electrical Engineering, Applied Math, Applied Physics, Chemistry, or related area
  • Fundamental knowledge of Li-ion cell electrochemistry and mechanisms
  • Strong background in mathematical modeling and data analysis
  • Excellent communication skills and team-oriented attitude
  • Comfortable with initiating and taking ownership of the projects
  • Advantageous Experience with Python and/or MATLAB
  • Experience in building and maintaining databases

Benefits

Paid time off, holidays

Cognite is looking for an Information Technology Intern to join our team in Austin, TX for our Fall Intern Program. The ideal candidate would have a passion for and knowledge of computers & technology, IT/OT, and digitalization. The candidate would also have a proven track record of completing projects efficiently, be detail-oriented, and possess the ability to think outside-the-box to support and fulfill the strategic objectives of a highly cross-functional organization. In your time with us, you will learn how a IT department operates, as well as day-to-day skills on how to support teams and projects. You will use your creativity to solve real problems and apply what you have learned at school directly to your internship, while building professional relationships that could lead to a career and lasting friendships.   • Install, configure, and support Office 365

  • Install and manage security software on desktops

  • Assist in the administration of Active Directory

  • Document day to day tasks, Runbooks, How-Tos, FAQs for employees and IT

Who You Are

  • This role is for students pursuing an undergrad/grad degree in a relevant field (Computer Science, Business, or Information Technology)
  • We look for technical competency (github, coding interview, hackerank), drive (self-training / projects) and people empathy (internal customer support experience).
  • Teamwork is an important part of the role. You collaborate well, and bring out the best in your colleagues as they do in you.
  • Grit and determination to "figure it out" when technology is disagreeable
  • Passion for building things that are used by others

What Makes Us Great

  • An opportunity to make an impact on the industrial future and be part of disruptive and groundbreaking global projects
  • High level of autonomy, ability to influence decisions and to learn from mistakes
  • Work along side a driven, engaging team with in-depth software expertise and industry experience
  • Opportunity to join Together@Cognite for social, community, and diversity initiatives
  • Focus on agility and speed, openness, togetherness, impact, and obligation to speak up
  • Join a team that truly lives their values and brings their whole selves to Cognite

Perks & Benefits

  • Learning & Development Massive Open Online Courses (MOOC)
  • FriYay Catered Lunch + Fully Stocked Fridges

About Cognite

Cognite is a global industrial AI Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) company supporting the full-scale digital transformation of heavy-asset industries around the world. Our key product, Cognite Data Fusion (CDF), empowers companies with contextualized OT/IT data to drive industrial applications that increase safety, sustainability, and efficiency, and drive revenue.

Headquartered in Oslo, Norway, Cognite has garnered the attention and partnership of some of the world's top industrial and tech companies, and the company’s success has been profiled in publications like Forbes, Bloomberg, Digital Energy Journal, and Houston Chronicle. Google awarded Cognite Google Cloud Technology Partner of the Year 2019 in Manufacturing and BuiltIn named Cognite 2021 Best Places to Work. We’ve won a lot of awards we’re quite proud of, and we’re backed by Accel and TCV, some of the world’s leading venture capital firms.

On a typical day you might...

  • Build (and learn to productionize!) ML models used by hundreds of thousands of users.

Dusty Robotics is accepting applications for our summer 2021 internship program. If you are enrolled as a student you are welcome to apply! This will potentially continue when school resumes as a nights/weekends or after school role. All positions will be located at our headquarters in Mountain View, CA. Local candidates are preferred, no relocation assistance is provided. Since things move quickly in a startup, we will be doing interviews and HIRING NEXT WEEK. If you wish to be considered, please send in your resume!

Who We Are

Dusty Robotics is an early-stage, venture-backed startup automating construction through advanced robotics. While today's buildings are built predominantly with manual labor, Dusty envisions a future in which skilled labor makes use of robotic automation to make the work safer, more efficient, and more precise. We want to create a future in which construction workers don't need to retire early because their bodies give out. In Dusty's future, the buildings where we live/work/play are built by teams of creative and problem-solving construction crews, who are directing robots to do the dull/dirty/dangerous work.

What you will do

As an intern with Dusty Robotics, and part of the Robot Pit Crew, you will be focused on Robot Readiness, prepping the robots for their jobs in the field after they return from a hard day's work. You will perform a number of tasks to ensure that robots are ready to go out into the field, which will vary from basic QA responsibilities to troubleshooting and solving logistics issues in getting our robots readied to go to customers. You will be an integral part of keeping our team organized, both digitally and physically, including organizing field supplies for easy access as well as keeping track of which robot is where.

Some of the focus backgrounds that would be key to our mission are in mechanical, electromechanical, mechatronics or robotics. Primary focus will be maintenance, test, troubleshooting, packing, and overall readiness of our field robots. You may even get to spend some time in the field with the robots!

Requirements

  • Proficient computer skills (AutoCAD experience helpful)
  • Superior verbal and written communication skills
  • Mechanical aptitude
  • High attention to detail and good organizational skills
  • Proven problem solver
  • Solid math skills (arithmetic and geometry)
  • Able to lift and carry 50-lb equipment on uneven ground
  • Driver's license with clean driving record

Our Code of Conduct

Dusty Robotics exists to serve a wide variety of customers from all walks of life. We believe that our mission is best served in an environment that is friendly, safe, accepting, and free of intimidation or harassment. We do not tolerate abusive behavior.

Strong, effective teams are composed of people with diverse backgrounds and experiences who can bring a variety of perspectives to their work. We actively encourage applications from a diverse pool, including those from historically under-represented groups such as women, people of color, people who identify LGBTQ, veterans, people with disabilities, and immigrants.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Where You’ll Work

Our office is located in an industrial warehouse in Mountain View, CA. We’re about a mile from the Caltrain station and a variety of restaurants along Castro Street.

This role is a part-time, temporary 20hr/week role (afternoons/evenings on weekdays). You will be working primarily in our Mountain View office, on a schedule that you and your manager mutually agree upon. You must have authorization to work in the US. No relocation assistance is provided. Preference is given to candidates who are local to the Bay Area.

About Dusty Robotics

Robot-powered tools for the modern construction workforce

Dusty Robotics is an early-stage, venture-backed startup automating construction through advanced robotics. While today's buildings are built predominantly with manual labor, Dusty envisions a future in which skilled labor makes use of robotic automation to make the work safer, more efficient, and more precise. We want to create a future in which construction workers don't need to retire early because their bodies give out. In Dusty's future, the buildings where we live/work/play are built by teams of creative and problem-solving construction crews, who are directing robots to do the dull/dirty/dangerous work.

WHO ARE WE?

Founded by educators and technologists passionate about improving education, Clever is on a mission to unlock new ways to learn for all students. Already used by more than 65% of U.S. K-12 schools, Clever brings all applications into one secure portal and provides single sign-on for everyone. With the leading network of digital learning providers, Clever makes school more engaging, personalized, and fun.

A DAY IN THE LIFE:

Interns at Clever work alongside full-time engineers, improving existing products and creating apps that live on top of Clever. Our very first intern wrote an iPhone app on the Clever platform that spread to over a thousand schools on the day it was released. Another intern wrote an app that let schools provision Google accounts, which now manages over 2 million student and teacher accounts. Every intern will join an engineering team, participate in team processes and activities, and have a dedicated mentor on their team to help them throughout the course of their time at Clever. Over the summer, they’ll work on a project (similar to those outlined above) to develop their technical and collaboration skills.

Clever engineers most commonly utilize technologies/tools like MongoDB, AWS, Typescript, React, and Go to develop our products.

This is exclusively a summer 2022 (May - August / June - September) opportunity.

WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR:

  • Must be graduating in or before June 2023. Why is this? Clever only offers internships to college students who will be graduating within 9 months of their internship’s completion because we view internships as a path to a full-time offer. The internship program lets us identify and mentor future engineers, while offering the intern a chance to see what it's like to be part of the Clever team. At the end of the internship, we hope to be able to build on a great summer by extending our interns an offer to come back and join our team full time!
  • Relevant coursework in programming, computer science, or any other relevant field.
  • Past projects demonstrating strong coding and collaboration skills.
  • A desire to grow as an engineer through collaboration, code reviews, and learning new languages/technologies.
  • Excellent communication skills
  • A desire to work in a diverse, highly collaborative team environment
  • Commitment to equity and belonging. At Clever, we believe the classrooms we serve and our company’s halls should be spaces that are diverse, equitable, and inclusive. That is why we are committed to building diverse teams, inviting every voice, and creating a safe space for everyone to be their authentic self. By fostering equity and belonging within our circles of influence, we unlock learning for ALL students.

CLEVER PERKS

  • Competitive weekly pay and housing stipend for the summer
  • Paid Time Off and unlimited sick time
  • Weekly intern seminars and a chance to learn from best-in-class engineers
  • Annual company retreat and weekly team events to connect with fun, bright coworkers

We are changing the way healthcare uses data. Currently, about 80% of healthcare data is underused because it is too messy and unstructured for humans to efficiently analyze. The healthcare industry needed an intelligent technology that could extract insights quickly and accurately. And that is where we came in. Apixio augments the ability to read, decipher, and understand patient information. This ultimately translates into better care delivery, lower costs, and streamlined processes.

The Role

  • Collaborate with product managers, designers, engineers and our data scientists

  • Curious and high energy!

About Apixio

Improving healthcare outcomes requires access to the right data at the right time. Apixio is advancing value-based care with data-driven intelligence and analytics. Our AI solutions for risk, quality, and clinical insights unlock actionable information from administrative data and unstructured clinical information. The results drive better clinical decision-making and a smarter approach to healthcare.

Our success is driven by a team of experienced, passionate, and fun engineers, data scientists, and business professionals working to solve complex problems with innovative AI technologies and techniques. Over the past year, we grew our client base by 20%, serving dozens of large health plans and provider groups nationwide. We're backed by top venture capital firms such as Bain Capital and SSM Partners, and led by a seasoned team of healthcare and technology experts.

What Apixio can offer you:

  • An amazing summer internship
  • Hands on experience in the latest technologies
  • Small company atmosphere and support
  • Strong resume experience for when you graduate
  • Being considered for a full-time, well paid position upon graduation
  • Meaningful work to improve the healthcare industry

​For details on how we protect your information when you apply, please see our Privacy Notice

What You’ll Do

As a computer vision intern at Leia, you will explore a project that marries cutting edge computer vision or deep learning with Leia’s light-field display technology. Under the mentorship of a senior computer vision engineer, some of the problems you might work on include:

  • Disparity estimation
  • Depth from single image
  • Stereo super-resolution
  • Inverse rendering
  • Multiview lighting effects
  • Photorealistic style transfer

What You’ll Have

  • Proficiency in Python
  • A good understanding of the fundamentals and best practices of deep learning
  • Familiarity with CNN architectures such as ResNet, VGG, UNet, Stacked Hourglass, MobileNet, pix2pix, and CycleGAN
  • Proficiency with a deep learning framework such as Pytorch, TensorFlow, Caffe, or Theano
  • Experience with Computer Vision algorithms and techniques
  • Experience with OpenCV

Nice to Haves

  • Proficiency with Java and/or C++.
  • Experience with data cleaning, analysis, and developing efficient, accurate data annotation schemes.
  • Experience with commercial software development processes: good software hygiene regarding code documentation, unit testing, bug tracking, and version control.
  • Highly motivated, team player with strong technical collaboration skills and desire to learn quickly and develop new skills.
  • The desire to be part of a fast-moving start-up and work in a collaborative environment with few rigid boundaries.
  • GPU programming experience.
  • Passion for photography or art.

Light up Life

At Leia we are working at the forefront of display technology — making screens come to life in richer, deeper, and more beautiful ways. We apply our proprietary nanotechnology to give any display the ability to produce lightfield, immersive “holographic” content — no glasses, no tracking, no fuss.

Come join a team that's ready to redefine the digital experiences of tomorrow!

What We Offer

In order to assemble top talent to help realize this mission Leia offers our employees:

  • Retirement Savings Plan 401(k)

#LI-EL1

Video editing is the final frontier of software tools moving to the cloud. Our work of making next-gen tools for today's creators is a challenging, but important endeavor. Join us at Kapwing on our mission to make content creation fast, accessible, and collaborative.

Everyone is a creator. The problem, however, is that today's tools get in the way of expressing our creativity fully. Especially when it comes to video, the gap between an idea and a video is wide enough that it's hard to even start.

Our mission at Kapwing is to make content creation easier and more accessible. Our main product, Kapwing Studio, is an online video editor that is both powerful and easy to use. Millions of creators every month choose Kapwing to tell their story and bring their ideas to life.

Our vision is to build a modern video editing platform that serves as the go-to tool for anyone creating video for Youtube, social media, or work. Being in the browser allows us to turn video editing, a traditionally heavyweight, time consuming workflow, into a joyful, collaborative, and fully-featured experience. We believe that we can use technology to augment the video editing and content creation experience, and we've already started on this path with a wide array of templates, applications of artificial intelligence, and new pipelines for exporting and video processing.

While software is the core of our product, being creative is the core of our work. Every team at Kapwing, from engineering to content to customer success, values trying new things, moving quickly, and helping creators in new ways. With remote work, remote learning, an economic downturn and the rise of social media as a political advocacy channel, video and media entrepreneurship have never been more relevant for the world. Join us on our journey to democratize creative tools and invent the future stack of video creation.

The Internship

We're hiring talented software engineering interns who have experience with web development for Spring or Summer 2022. Interns who join have the opportunity to ship features for millions of creators, work closely with leadership, make product decisions, and get experience with frontier web and cloud technologies. This role is a full-time software engineering internship based in San Francisco, reporting to our Engineering Manager.

Ideally, candidates should have experience with our technologies: React, Redux, python, Node, Typescript. Since we're such a small company, interns must be able to build new features independently and be proactive about their own learning.

Interns have the potential to convert to full-time. Full-time offers are considered at the end of the internship.

Requirements

  • Currently an undergrad majoring in Computer Science at a 4-year university
  • Has contributed to a live website or web application
  • Completed at least one production-level internship
  • Interested in creative tools, social media, and entrepreneurship
  • Experience with MERN stack
  • Comfortable with Javascript, React, and python
  • Proactive: Identifies problems and solutions
  • Must have work authorization in the USA without needing a visa in the next four years. At our size, we'd like to find people who could start full-time without needing visa sponsorship.

Responsibilities

  • Building and launching full-stack features (Javascript, NodeJs, Express + React front end and a python backend)
  • Improving and extending products with millions of users
  • Contributing to engineering best practices
  • Designing and shaping user-facing features

Our Values
Done is better than perfect: Trying new things quickly matters at Kapwing. We've always believed that the best way to learn is to try to put something out there, and then iterate and improve it over time.

Get better everyday: We strive for excellence and we value our craft of writing quality software. At work, we want to challenge ourselves to improve every day.

Have fun: We don't take ourselves too seriously here at Kapwing. We're a product that people use to make all sorts of silly memes.

Inclusion matters: We take pride in our diverse team and a safe and inclusive community at work. We're a female-founded, female-led company. We actively make sure our office (virtual or not) is a safe space for everyone.

Speak up: Kapwing is a place where different stories and opinions are valued. We want kind debates, because we know that they will lead us to the best product.

Think original: We love change - and we never want to get stuck in one way of doing things. We embrace what's relevant at any given time.

Benefits
Health: Kapwing offers competitive benefits for well-being, including health, vision, and dental insurance.

Time off: We keep reasonable hours, and when it's time to rest, we take that seriously. We offer unlimited paid vacation and ask our team to take minimum 2 weeks off each year.

Parental Leave: We offer paid time off for new parents to focus on the things that matter most.

Team events: During the pandemic, we've hosted weekly virtual team events and outdoor gatherings for everyone at Kapwing. We get together online for fun events like a flower arrangement workshop, tie dying, making candles, and more.

Company offsites: When the world is safe again, we're excited to have some fun company offsites. In the past, we've done ski trips and special dinners.

Equipment: We'll give you a new computer and help provide any other office equipment that you need to do your best work.

Hiring process
Our hiring process is designed for candidates to learn about our company just as much as it is for our team to learn about a candidate. Most candidates will start with a short, behavioral interview, and depending on the team, a sample project or work oriented interviews will be scheduled afterwards. Throughout our interview process, we strive to have empathy, communication, and professionalism.

Our Company
Kapwing is a Series-A stage startup backed by top investors including CRV, Kleiner Perkins, Shasta Ventures, and Village Global. You can learn more about our company and the faces on our team by visiting our careers page, reading our popular blog, or following us on Instagram.

The positions that are currently open at Kapwing are constantly being updated. We also know that the best candidates don't always fit into a role description. If you feel excited about joining us on our mission, please reach out to us with how we could be a good fit.

description:
Software Engineering Intern Job Description

Role Location: San Francisco, CA, San Jose, CA, Bellevue, WA, Toronto, ON Canada (virtual and in-person options available)

Position Description: We are looking for University students pursuing a Computer Science or related degree who are interested in a 2022 Summer Internship and that are passionate about building large-scale, mission-critical software in a fast-paced agile environment. The ideal candidate will share our passion and pride in the simple elegance and usability of our solution. Our interns will join an engineering team that strongly believes in automated testing, UX design and an iterative process to build high-quality next generation enterprise software.

We offer: High priority projects, great mentors, hackathons and Lunch-n-Learns with Okta leaders. Interns will have a choice of virtual or in-person internships.

We have opportunities across a wide range of areas within our organization.

Our team is innovative and flexible; with a weekly release cycle and individual ownership we expect great things from all of our engineers and reward them with stimulating new projects, emerging technologies and the chance to have significant impact in a company that is changing the cloud computing landscape forever. We have offices in San Francisco, CA, San Jose, CA and Bellevue, WA in the United States and Toronto, ON in Canada.

  • Participate in test-driven development, design and code reviews

Okta is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

💘 Our Mission

Shinkei Systems builds robotics that multiply the shelf-life of wild caught fish.

With only 1 in every 3 fish caught making it to a plate, the fishing industry has numerous waste problems to solve from both tails of the operational chain that could save billions.

Spun out from researchers at Carnegie Mellon School of Computer Science, Shinkei uses computer vision and robotics to redefine how we treat the animals we catch and eat. We are experienced moonshot prototypers and have exhibited design work internationally at top venues. Our board has professors from the top robotics schools in the world and experienced founders in the area.

We are looking for energetic folks to join our team who are excited to create technology that transforms the world at scale.

👀 The Opportunity

Ever wonder why we pay a premium for sushi?

Why confined, farmed fish are the standard in supermarkets?

How large legacy industries operationally tick?

Shinkei is looking for mechanical engineers for a paid opportunity over the summer to work on transforming society’s relationship with an animal that feeds billions of mouths annually. We’re on the lookout for people who love to get their hands dirty building working prototypes for moonshot ideas and who can take responsibility meeting deadlines over extended project timelines.

You won't be limited to clinking metal — we believe engineers should be involved in company strategy, product direction, and anything else you might be interested in.

What You Get To Do:

  • Design real robotics solutions to solve major humanitarian concerns
  • Utilize mechanical engineering tools by building a product end-to-end
  • Work autonomously in a fast-paced entrepreneurial environment from either New York or Philadelphia
  • Unrestricted access to a makerspace
  • Talk to real customers for user research on design
  • Set the foundation for our engineering culture
  • Travel to Maryland to try out traditional techniques aboard industrial boats
  • Have a hand in transforming our relationship with our food

What You Need:

  • An innovative mind with a practical bend and an interest in changing the way we consume our food
  • Pursuing bachelors or masters in Mechanical Engineering, Robotics, similar field or sufficient previous experience
  • Background (portfolio, side projects, coursework) in physical prototyping, gantry design and misc. mechanical engineering projects
  • Basic abilities with mechanical design tools (SolidWorks, FEA, drawings and documentation)
  • Capable of researching, designing and testing using rapid prototyping techniques
  • Experience with lab testing and fabrication equipment
  • Familiarity with common manufacturing processes a plus
  • Exposure and interest to robotics or embedded systems a strong plus

  • Assist with collecting and analyzing sales and marketing data to develop and adjust correlating marketing plans
  • Assist with automating data collection and content creation
  • Assist in the development and implementation of lead scoring and lead ranking strategies

What you'll bring...

  • Strong interest in engineering, computer science or statistics
  • Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree (in progress or recently completed)
  • Strong interest in data analytics, computer science, computational science, and other quantitative skills using SQL and Python
  • Must be self-driven, someone who has experience in multitasking and thrives in a fast-paced environment while maintaining a positive attitude
  • Creative and analytical mind with a strong results-oriented, metrics-driven approach to problem solving
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills
  • Bonus: Proficiency with data analytics or programming or experience with startups

Perks + Benefits

  • Competitive hourly rate (DOE)
  • Team bonding and Company events
  • Complimentary and discount stays at AvantStay properties
  • Dog-friendly office (whether you're remote or able to come into our office)

When you join AvantStay…
You’ll be doing work that matters alongside an experienced and dynamic team, transforming the way people travel and vacation. Your place within the colossal travel and real estate industries will leave you with a wealth of opportunities to feel both challenged to innovate and rewarded for your efforts. AvantStay is a place where you can craft your own path to greatness. Whether you think in code, words, pictures or numbers, find your future at AvantStay.

Equal Employment Opportunity...
We're proud to be an equal opportunity employer- and celebrate our employees' differences, including race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, and Veteran status. Different makes us better.

Want to make an impact this year? At Assured, you'll work with a team of extraordinarily passionate engineers working to reimagine the insurance industry.

🧱 Get in on a startup on truly the ground floor. Together, we'll shape the future of the company.
🏡 If you choose to join us in person in Palo Alto, housing is included!
💸 Highly competitive pay. If we love you, we'll pay whatever it takes.
🛫 Ever wanted to be a pilot? One free flying lesson from our co-founder.

Who we are...

Assured aims to disrupt the insurance industry by modernizing its most archaic component: claims. Currently, 300,000 claims adjusters spend their days talking on the phone and typing into unstructured text fields. We can do better—by combining logic, inference, and modern computer vision tools, we're able to both increase efficiency and improve customer satisfaction. By rearchitecting how the underlying information is ingested and stored, we're poised to impact the core of a trillion dollar industry.

We're two second time founders out of Stanford who care about transforming the world with software. We've built companies from enterprise software to aerospace, and couldn't be more excited about taking on the insurance industry.

There's so much to do. We can't wait for you to join us.

You'd love this role if...

🔥 You're passionate about reimagining archaic industries
🖖 You want to work on a small, close knit team of brilliant engineers consumed by a consequential and yet-unsolved problem
🐾 Being a trailblazer—in our architecture, in our approach, and in our team—is an inspiration, not a burden

You will...

🌱 Grow as an engineer with our help, working across the stack as you own features from ideation to production
🗣️ Interact with stakeholders ranging from end-users to insurance adjusters
💎 Use modern frontend frameworks like React and GraphQL to build single-page applications
🔎 Collaborate with the CEO and CTO to identify and prioritize the most impactful improvements to our product
😍 Implement delightful, functional user experiences

You may be a fit if you...

🔧 Build software to solve problems
💪 Have substantial, self-initiated projects that you're proud of
🚀 Want to dive into the world of startups

Bonus points...
✨ We're currently using Typescript, Node.js, React, and GraphQL, however that will evolve. The most important thing is that you're nimble, intelligent, and hard working.

Learn something every day building real products for real users

What you will learn:

  • How our product development process works from inception to deployment
  • How to write quality, performant, well-tested code in Python/Django and ES6/React
  • How to collaborate with other engineers over code review and discussion

What you will do:

There are no intern projects. We treat you like full-time engineers and get you onboarded as quickly as possible.

  • Ship code to users in your first week and every week after
  • Coordinate and collaborate with other engineers on projects small and large
  • Take ownership and lead your own project within 8 weeks

Examples of past intern work include:

  • Architecting the backend database schema and designing the REST API for our trading platform
  • Implementing the redesign and refactor of our entire investment search page in a reactive framework with front-end routing and browser history
  • Building a process for users to upload and unpack zip files and replicate the folder structure in our database

Benefits & opportunities:

  • Autonomy - Work autonomously to set your own timeline, architecture, and task breakdown
  • Mentorship - Meet with mentors one on one to develop technical and non-technical skills
  • 10% Time - Every other Monday, utilize your curiosity to develop your technical skills on personal projects
  • Snack - We're not unique here but we love our coffee and snacks and we've got you covered

What we are looking for:

  • Motivated individuals looking for industry experience and to develop their technical skills
  • People with a foundational understanding of software engineering
  • Curiosity for technologies, concepts, and practices
  • Individuals who enjoy collaborating with roles outside of engineering

What are our goals:

We think it should be just as easy to trade in private companies as it is in public companies. Many believe that startup employee equity is only worth something if the company IPOs or is acquired. However, with a robust, centralized, efficient market to trade in private companies, that equity becomes liquid and is valuable from the day it vests. We are building that market for stockholders and institutional investors, and we could use your help doing it.

Other Details

  • Given the uncertain circumstances around the pandemic, we are only accepting candidates residing in the Bay Area.

Learn more about us at https://www.zanbato.com or https://www.facebook.com/zanbatoinc/

Health care is all about conversations, with over 2B spoken conversations each year between patients and their care teams in just the United States. However, people forget up to 80% of those conversations, leading to worse patient outcomes. And doctors are burning out writing notes in their EMRs instead of focusing on their patients. That’s where Abridge comes in — our audio-based standalone and integrated solutions record and summarize medical conversations, anywhere care happens.

We are looking for research interns to working on exciting NLP challenges using our large annotated proprietary healthcare datasets. You will be able to create/customize your internship research statement and collaborate with our in-house Machine Learning research team. At the end of the internship, you will also have the opportunity to publish your work at top tier conferences such as NeurIPS, ICML, ICLR, NAACL, and ACL.

The goal of the internship is to advance the state-of-the-art in one or many of the following research areas:

  • Dialog Understanding
  • Sequence-to-Sequence Modeling
  • Clinical Natural Language Processing
  • Information Extraction
  • Machine Learning using Ontologies or Knowledge graphs

Required Qualification:

  • Must be accepted to or currently enrolled in an MS or Ph.D. program in Computer Science or a related field
  • Must have at least one NLP machine learning paper submitted or published
  • Experience in utilizing theoretical and empirical research to solve problems
  • Ability to communicate complex research ideas in a clear, precise, and actionable manner

*Research internships are offered year-round with flexible durations

Compensation

  • $80,000-$100,000 per year

Life at Abridge

At Abridge, we’re driven by our mission to bring understanding and follow-through to every medical conversation. Our culture is founded on doing things the “inverse” way in a legacy system—focusing on patients, instead of the system; focusing on outcomes, instead of billing; and focusing on the end-user experience, instead of a hospital administrator's mandate.

Abridgers are engineers, scientists, designers, and health policy experts from a diverse set of backgrounds—an experiment in alchemy that helps us transform an industry dominated by EHRs and enterprise into a consumer-driven experience, one recording at a time. We believe in strong ideas, loosely held, and place a high premium on a growth mindset. We push each other to grow and expose each other to the latest in our respective fields. Whether it’s holding a PhD-level deep dive into understanding fairness and underlying bias in machine learning models, debating the merits of a Scandinavian design philosophy in our UI/UX, or writing responses for Medicare rules to influence U.S. health policy, we prioritize sharing our findings across the team and believe that "you need to taste good things to have good taste."

Abridge is an equal opportunity employer. Diversity and inclusion is at the core of what we do. We actively welcome applicants from all backgrounds (including but not limited to race, gender, educational background, and sexual orientation).

Convoy is transforming the $800 billion trucking industry, where even 10 years ago, most truck drivers did not have smartphones and electronic driver logs were uncommon. In 2015, Convoy launched the digital freight movement with an open and fully connected marketplace for brands and manufacturers to work directly with freight carriers who move truckload shipments throughout the country. This ‘Digital Freight Network’ is powered by machine learning and automation, and supported by a broad, ever-growing set of features that benefit both sides of the marketplace.

We’ve been honored to work with some great companies, such as Unilever, The Home Depot, and Procter & Gamble. We’ve also been backed by world-class investors, including the founders and CEOs of Amazon, Salesforce, eBay, LinkedIn, Expedia, Dropbox, Starbucks, and others. We are proud to have been named a CNBC Disruptor 50 Winner (3x), a Fast Company World Changing Idea, a LinkedIn Top Startup, a Forbes' Best Startup Employer, one of Fortune Magazine's 'Impact 20' list, a best place to work in Washington State, a BloombergNEF Pioneer winner, and more.

This is your opportunity to collaborate with an incredible group of people and help transform the freight industry. Join Convoy and help us transport the world with endless capacity and zero waste.

About you:
Convoy is building a team of diverse, talented, and creative engineers to automate the logistics industry. We’re developing cutting-edge software that makes trucking more efficient and sustainable, all while providing a world-class shipper and carrier experience. We’re looking for people who pride themselves on their ability to create innovative products, balancing urgency with intentionality. You approach every problem, process, and system with a collaborative, open mind and are eager to continue growing your skillset. Must be able to relocate to Seattle for duration of internship.

You will:

  • Immediately be paired with a vertically focused team and be indoctrinated into the product they support.
  • Ship code your first week- we expect our interns to contribute in meaningful ways right off the bat.
  • Have excellent mentorship. Each intern will be paired with an engineering mentor to help guide them through the summer.
  • Get the chance to own large, complex projects and see them through to the finish.
  • Earn competitive pay and perks.

We're looking for someone who has:

  • A degree in Computer Science IN PROGRESS with a graduation date in 2023.
  • Experience with an object oriented language like Java, C++, Ruby, Python, etc.
  • Working knowledge of data structures and algorithms.
  • Strong communication skills and ability to fluently express ideas to business stakeholders.

Nice to haves:

  • Previous internship experience is strongly preferred.

Benefits:
Employees' wellbeing is top of mind for the Convoy team. As an intern with Convoy, you will be eligible for awesome benefits including:

  • Competitive monthly housing stipends
  • An ORCA transportation card so you can explore Seattle's neighborhoods
  • Fun intern events (such as chartering a boat in Lake Union!)
  • Opportunity to join and contribute to one of our Employee Resource Groups
  • Ability to make a real world impact!

Convoy is an equal-opportunity employer and we welcome applicants from all backgrounds. If you’re a passionate team player who wants to have an outsized impact on a diverse and dynamic team, we’d love to hear from you!

My Favorite Run is a mission-driven fitness startup dedicated to empowering everyday runners to transform their relationship with exercise by building the first mindfulness based running app that focuses on mental health and self-improvement over external comparison and metrics. Our mantra is that "running is not about being better than someone else. It's about being better than you used to be." We apply principles of mindfulness, psychology & cognitive science to help runners become the best versions of themselves!

Over the years, we have built an extensive online running community of over 250K runners across our social media platforms (@myfavoriterun on IG, FB & Pinterest). Check out our accounts to learn more about us!

Key Features (will provide more details later on):

  • Reflective Journaling Prompts
  • Guided Audio Runs
  • GPS tracking that emphasizes warmup & heartbeat monitoring
  • Personalized workouts & training plans
  • Community forum based on inner growth & reflection

What we are looking for:

We are in the process of developing an innovative and highly-interactive mobile fitness app for our dedicated community of runners. Here is a brief description of what we are looking for in a developer intern:

  • Passionate about working for a budding startup and playing a key role in our growth
  • Interest/experience in running would be ideal but not required. Passion for mindfulness, mental well-being, and empowering runners to achieve their goals is a must!
  • Experience with REACT, React Native, HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, or other relevant mobile coding languages.
  • Previous experience with building and/or designing mobile applications would be ideal
  • Basic knowledge of mobile UI/UX and application programming skills

Qualities:

  • Creative, Independent Thinker: Highly creative thinker who tends to find solutions that others don’t see or inappropriately dismiss. Comfortable with taking the contrarian perspective for the sake of expressing their authenticity & vision.
  • Introspective & Self-Aware: You are an innately reflective person who has a deep understanding of your own strengths and areas of improvement. You are highly attuned to your emotions and that of others, and find meaning in developing close relationships with others and creating an impact on the world through your work.
  • Extreme Ownership & Founder Mindset: You go beyond what is expected and understand that the job isn't done when you complete a task. You possess a "founder" mindset and treat the company as if it were your own.
  • Relentlessly Resourceful: highly proactive, does not quit, and finds innovative solutions with little guidance. Bias for action and ability to thrive in an ambiguous environment with a high degree of autonomy.
  • Growth Mindset & Persistent: You realize that just because you aren't good at something YET, it doesn't mean you will never reach the goal. You are relentlessly persistent in acquiring the right skills to achieve your goals and won't quit when the going gets tough.
  • Passion for Fitness, Mindfulness, & Female Empowerment: You have a passion for helping runners, specifically women, develop a healthier relationship with exercise. Demonstrates personal dedication and interest in physical and mental wellbeing (i.e exercise, meditation, self-care, and self-improvement).

description:
Bodo can be translated into “Run” or “Accelerate”, and our technology does just that. Python is the de facto language for data applications but has limited performance and scalability. Bodo is the first Python Supercomputing Analytics platform that empowers data scientists to run Python workloads with the extreme performance and scalability of High Performance Computing (HPC) without code rewrites. The exponential growth of data in the enterprise presents an immense opportunity for transforming industries through advanced analytics and AI/ML, and we aim to enable this transformation.

Bodo’s technology provides automatic parallelization and acceleration for analytics workloads for the first time. This allows data scientists to focus on solving business problems instead of scalability and performance of their codes. Bodo is already deployed at Fortune 500 enterprises with great success.

Description

Bodo is looking for a software engineering intern interested in distributed systems to develop Bodo’s revolutionary cloud analytics platform. This requires a strong entrepreneurship spirit and the ability to turn challenging technical ideas into reality. As a software engineer you will be building the cloud platform that hosts the fastest, most scalable and accessible analytics platform for data scientists and data engineers, with significant impact in large-scale enterprise cluster and cloud compute environments.

Responsibilities

  • Help develop, deploy and maintain Bodo’s cloud analytics platform
  • Help enhance simplicity, robustness, efficiency and scalability of the Bodo Cloud Platform
  • Contribute to various efforts in platform development
  • Design and implement automated CI/CD pipelines to build, test, and release infrastructures
  • Debug complex distributed system issues

Qualifications and Skills

  • BS/MS/PhD student in Computer Science or a related field
  • Strong programming experience (Java, C++, JavaScript, Python, etc.)
  • Experience in distributed systems
  • Experience working with cloud technologies: Kubernetes (K8s), Docker, Terraform, microservices, AWS, Azure, GCP, etc.
  • Team work, strong communication skills, and attention to detail

Developing a new complex technology and building an enterprise-grade software product around it is not easy - we are looking for technologists with strong passion and drive to make it happen!

Learn more about our product:
https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCSOD99SjLAX-UR_gGRNQzTA

Bodo provides a competitive salary, significant equity stake, employer paid medical, dental and vision, employer partially paid dependent benefits, employer paid life insurance, remote work and flexible working hours. Unlimited time off and new Macs also are a perk while working on a new technology offering.

About Us
We’re Endless West, makers of molecular spirits. Our small, independent team of scientists, sommeliers, writers, chefs, and dropouts is creating the next generation of wine and spirits. Our work has already attracted significant interest from a range of people — whiskey enthusiasts, scientists, members of the culinary world, creatives in design, technology, and fashion — across the country. And we’re just getting going.

We’re relentlessly curious, optimistic enough to run after ambitious ideas, and skeptical enough to analyze every angle and consider every option. We support each other as colleagues and care about each other as people, believing that the health of our business can be measured by the health of our team. We are obsessed with leveraging scientific learning, creative storytelling and business expertise to explore the limits of what’s possible.

Everyone is welcome at Endless West. We know diverse teams build better products and we are committed to creating an inclusive culture built on a foundation of respect for all individuals. We strongly encourage candidates from non-traditional backgrounds, historically marginalized, or underrepresented groups to apply.

About the Role
We are looking for a product development intern to join our R&D team at Endless West. The intern will help our product development team develop and prepare prototype formulations for many beverage types. They will also assist with preparation of sensory samples, small scale consumer beverage samples, help with compound dilutions and blending for production. As we are a start-up and small team, responsibilities can vary daily, and will also include general lab operations. You will work hard and learn a tremendous amount.

Anticipated duration of internship is 3 months.

Job Responsibilities
● Creative problem solving
● Prepare small and medium scale formulation batches of various beverage products
● Preparation of compound stocks and dilutions as needed
● Preparation of compound blends for production as needed
● Help with product development and sensory analysis
● Help with experimental design, execution, analysis and reporting
● Safely handle and prepare large volumes of laboratory chemicals
● Document all experimental procedures in a laboratory notebook

Requirements
● Studying Food Science, Chemistry, Biochemistry, Biology or a related field.
● Second or third year students preferred.
● Knowledge of solution preparation and use of lab equipment including analytical balances and micropipettes is essential.
● You have a highly analytical mind, pay great attention to detail, and find a start-up environment appealing.

About You
You’re highly-motivated and experienced enough to hit the ground running from day one. You're inquisitive. You understand which questions to ask, and how to apply sufficient scientific rigor to answer them. You aren’t afraid to articulate ideas and aren’t afraid to be wrong. You’re able to laugh at yourself.

Why Endless West
In a town full of companies that sell prospective hires on happy hours and ping pong tables, here’s what we are uniquely able to offer:
● A small, flat organization. We don’t believe in hierarchy for hierarchy’s sake.
● Smart, friendly colleagues.
● Actual autonomy and agency. We choose empowerment over micromanagement.
● A team that values EQ as much as IQ.
● A team that values hard work but believes in the importance of self-care and taking meaningful breaks.
● An environment that encourages empathetic debate. We state cases, defend positions, argue productively, and make decisions together. We don’t have any issues with being wrong. People’s opinions are actively sought out and valued.
● An environment where we not only acknowledge the hard work and successes of our teammates, but also celebrate them.

Candidates must be currently local to San Francisco/Bay Area and be able to commute to/from the office located in the Dog Patch area of San Francisco.

Interested? We'd love to hear from you! Please apply!

Jeti is looking for a talented intern to join our software engineering and development team. Our small business produces high quality work for respected companies in the Columbus, Ohio area and seeks an intern who will work in a team environment to solve problems and explore new technologies. The intern will work closely with our (Senior Software Engineer or whoever the intern will be working with) to learn the day-to-day tasks in the software engineering and development department as well as work in a group on a complex software project.

Interns will be paid $16 per hour. The internship will start on Monday, August 23rd, 2021 and end on Friday, December 3rd, 2021

About Jeti

Jeti is a new type of social network based on your location. By providing an experience grounded in the local community, Jeti is rethinking how we frame the ideal social network. In an age where the internet allows us to meet people from around the world, it’s easy to miss potential connections that could be waiting just across the street.

Our tech stack:
• Typescript
• React (+React Native)
• Node.js
• PostgreSQL
• GraphQL

What You Will Learn

• Learning Git: pull requests; CI/CD; GitFlow branching model
• Practical experience with a wide variety of software engineering tasks
• Collaborating hand-in-hand with skilled teams of software engineers
• Working with a diverse team of engineers and designers from across the globe: from Miami and Philadelphia to Krakow and Istanbul
• Shadowing, mentoring, and training opportunities with seasoned professionals
• Hands-on experience with real client work
• Participate in the delivery of complex software projects in a team-based environment
• Flexible schedule for students

Responsibilities

• Code and configure technical components to match requirements
• Review code
• Document and test new software applications
• Assist with organizing code merges and environment management tasks
• Assist with unit testing code and configuration changes
• Research competitor offerings
• Provide input on roadblocks and potential risks/issues regarding development
• Develop applications (coding, programming)
• Interview beta testers

Qualifications

• Rising Junior or Senior at a 4-year institution preferred
• 2-3 years of programming experience
• Must have proficiency in TypeScript
• Candidates should demonstrate a thorough understanding of engineering technology
• Ability to work in teams and be able to work independently on research related tasks with limited supervision
• Excellent written, oral, and communication/presentation skills
• Knowledge of Google Cloud Platform is a plus
• Paid interns must attend an Ohio-based school OR be residents of Ohio

CLARA is looking for a software engineer intern who is interested in building data processing systems at scale using Scala, Python, Apache Spark and/or some similar ecosystem. They will have strong familiarity working in a cloud environment like AWS or GCP. They will be comfortable working with application engineers, data scientists, product managers and product delivery teams. This person will be working with a mentor from the Data Software engineering team

Key Responsibilities
● Build frameworks to handle data at high scale using technologies like Apache Spark and data cataloging tools like Apache Hive and AWS Glue on top of a multi-tiered data lake storage.
● Use exploration and analytic tools like Apache Zeppelin, AWS Athena/Presto on top of Apache Hive to probe and validate data.
● Build robust data processing pipelines using Airflow, Kubeflow or similar and integrate with multiple components and data sources and sinks.
● Design new product features, champion the use of cutting-edge technologies.
● Collaborate with the Machine Learning team to ensure that data processing, structure and accessibility maximizes model performance.
● Work on a bi-weekly sprint schedule in a fast-paced startup environment. Participate in and contribute to scrum meetings, i.e., daily stand-up, sprint planning, and retrospectives
● Deliver value in the form of timely, high quality, performant software components and services

Qualifications & Experience
● Candidate must be pursuing or have completed MS in computer science or related field
● Candidate must be able to legally work in USA
● Strong programming skills in at least one of the following languages, Scala or Java, Python
● Experience in sequel databases like MySQL, Oracle, Postgres, or others
● Strong analytical skills and advanced SQL knowledge, indexing, query optimization techniques
● Ability to translate data needs into detailed functional and technical designs for development, testing and implementation

Nice to have
● Experience of one to three years working in a fast paced company
● Experience with the following software/tools:
o Highly proficient with Scala and Spark
o Apache Spark, Hive, etc.
o SQL and NoSQL databases like MySQL, Postgres, DynamoDB, Elasticsearch
o Workflow management tools like Airflow
o AWS cloud services: RDS, AWS Lambda, AWS Glue, AWS Athena, EMR (equivalent tools in the GCP stack will also suffice)
● Experience implementing software around data processing, metadata management, ETL pipeline tools like Airflow
● Experience working with cross-functional teams in a fast-paced environment
● Knowledge of healthcare data pertaining to insurance claims is helpful

Internship Duration: Flexible. Will work with the candidate to finalize the length of the internship.

ABOUT US
At ZaiNar, we’re leveraging patented innovations using software-defined radios and advanced signal processing to build revolutionary new products in Positioning, Navigation, and Timing. Our imaginative team has developed the world’s most precise network time synchronization and distribution capabilities – wirelessly syncing to sub-nanosecond accuracy. We’re solving leading edge problems in RF location tracking and network communications. Our initial target market is asset tracking in dynamic industrial environments ($10B+), and the opportunities beyond that are endless. ZaiNar already complies with release 16 of 3GPP standards for 5G, to enable ZaiNar location tracking for any 5G-NR device without hardware changes. ZaiNar is VC-backed by tier 1 funds including Softbank, and has graduated from multiple accelerator programs including StartX, Alchemist, and Plug and Play.

Ensuring a diverse and inclusive workplace, where the best idea wins, is important to us. So, come join a curious, collaborative, and forward-thinking team, where everyone has the freedom to shape their own future, our company‘s, and the world’s – one nanosecond at a time.

THE ROLE
Join a team of brilliant engineers developing the next generation of networked software-defined radio systems to support ZaiNar’s super-precise network time distribution capabilities. We are seeking an Engineering Intern for Summer 2021. ZaiNar is looking for highly motivated software interns to be a part of a star team. Our company is seeking self-starters who are interested in owning real engineering projects during their internship. ZaiNar Engineering is in an important phase of product development, and there are many interesting projects. A well-matched intern will bring excitement, curiosity, and flexibility to the role.

We are prepared for, and flexible with, working from home. Due to the pandemic, the role will be partially or fully remote, but we do have an office in downtown Redwood City, CA that is open with strict safety guidelines in place and in compliance with all the current local, state, and CDC regulations.

COMPELLING ATTRIBUTES
● Studying computer science, EE, or related fields towards a post-graduate degree (PhD preferred)
● Strong data analytics, signal processing and/or wireless communication background
● Familiarity with super-resolution algorithms for angle of arrival estimation
● Background in estimation theory and statistical signal processing
● Solid knowledge of convex and non-convex optimization techniques
● Experience with Python, C++, and comparable programming languages
● Experience with Linux development environment
● Experience with radio hardware (hobby or professional)
● Ability to be a self-starter and solve problems proactively
● Excited about working in an agile, startup work environment
● Ability to work independently and provide creative solutions
● Excited about deploying tech in multiple test environments and locations
● Fluency in English (written and spoken)

ALSO INTERESTING
● Web development and data visualization
● Embedded firmware experience
● Hardware build skills
● Knowledge of RF lab equipment

Kintsugi is developing smarter mental healthcare with voice biomarkers. Our team has been awarded multiple National Science Foundation SBIR awards for developing new AI technologies. In our latest technical milestone, we’re now able to detect depression and anxiety from less than 20 seconds of free form speech.

In this role, you will be a member of a team that develops and applies cutting edge techniques to detect depression and anxiety. You will be part of the R&D team and contribute to creating state of the art models.

What you'll do:

  • Work collaboratively to build a platform for scientific discovery in this exciting new domain of speech for healthcare.
  • Have access to a wealth of unique data and best-in-class algorithms, providing a solid foundation to build and iterate on.

  • Knowledge of deep learning frameworks (e.g. Pytorch, TensorFlow)
  • Exposure to industry or academic research
  • Strong programming skills with working knowledge of Python
  • Experience working in a Linux environment
  • Team player with good communication skills (oral and written)

Preferred Qualification

  • Signal/Speech Processing experience
  • Experience dealing with real world large-scale datasets
  • Ph.D. in Computer Science, Speech/Signal Processing or Machine Learning

Human Connection Economy 4.0 (HCE 4)

HCE 4: HCE 4 is a professional, international and innovative federation that accompanies organisations and businesses that wish to migrate towards the 4th Industrial Revolution (also known as Economy 4.0). The Role
Work directly with our CEO and CTO to develop software used by top engineering executives. We build eng management tools. You'll learn more than all yours peers since you'll be building tools for engineering management at top software companies and helping them build best practices.

We expect you to learn quickly and contribute at a higher level than a typical intern. In exchange, we provide you with the experience of building actual products for real companies.

Why Haystack?
Our CEO has scaled engineering teams to 100M+ global users. Our CTO built his own cryptocurrency exchange and scaled it to $1M+ in transactions and ~5% of iOS applications currently run his software.

See how small scale startups to large scale enterprise engineering orgaizations work first hand from our customers. There are few internships with as much opportunity for hands-on experience with world class leaders.

Things we look for

  1. Experience with SQL
  2. Experience with Python
  3. Self-Directed
  4. Ability to learn new technologies

Details
Full-time, unpaid internship. 3 months minimum.

Note: Please tell us in one or two sentences about the most impressive thing other than work that you have built or achieved.

Embody is an audio lifestyle company changing the world of Music, Gaming and Content Production. We are a team of researchers, engineers, musicians and gamers who came together through passion for all things audio. We are developing technologies at the intersection of acoustics and data science to craft experiences that your ears were made to hear. Our mission is to bring personalized auditory immersion to the center of our technology driven lives. Be it gaming, music, fitness, or hearables, an extraordinary auditory reality is what we are set to accomplish.

At Embody, we are looking for highly motivated engineering students who want to do meaningful work that will directly impact the business while gaining first-hand experience in a highly collaborative startup environment. As a Computer Vision Engineering Intern, you will be involved in researching about, developing, and deploying Embody’s core Image Processing and Computer Vision modules. More so, you will get to see through an entire production cycle from a product’s inception all the way to it’s production and release.

Required Skills:

  • Pursuing a degree, prefereably Master's, in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering or a relevant field and preferably in their final year; ready for an internship.
  • Solid programming skills with proficiency in C/C++ and Python. MATLAB experience is a plus.
  • Experience with general computer vision frameworks, machine learning, linear algebra, vector calculus and probability theory. Experience with position estimation algorithms is a plus.
  • Experience with 3D modelling and 3D computer vision and 3D perception technologies is a plus.
  • Experience with version control software such as git, svn, etc. is a plus.
  • Experience with .NET and/or JUCE frameworks is a plus.
  • Ambitious, curious, gritty, and a go-getter attitude.

This is a paid internship position based in the Bay Area. You will be working from home until we can safely reopen our office in San Mateo, CA. Salary will be adjusted according to the location you're remotely working from until the time we reopen.

If interested, please reach out to us with your resume and cover letter (optional) at career@embodyvr.co or nikhil@embodyvr.co, or apply to this post. Please add “Computer Vision Engineering Intern” in the subject of the email while applying. Should be authorized to work in the US. Sponsorship not available.

Data Science Internship Job Description

Dashbot is looking for a highly curious & driven individual to join our team for a truly unique learning experience to work on the cutting edge of conversational AI & NLP technologies. In this internship, your primary focus will be to help automate many of the processes that we need to build for our data science initiatives. This is an exciting opportunity to join a fast-growing company, work with blue-chip global clients, and work in the cutting-edge technology industries of Conversational AI, ML, NLP, and more!

About Dashbot

Dashbot is the market-leading analytics layer for Conversational AI — such as chatbots, voice skills, IVR, etc. We help Fortune 500 companies such as Quickbooks, TurboTax, GoDaddy, GEICO, Travelers, and NBC Universal increase engagement, satisfaction, and conversion of their bot initiatives through Dashbot’s actionable insights and tools. In addition to traditional metrics like engagement and retention, we offer conversation-specific analytics like AI response effectiveness, sentiment analysis, conversation flows, NLP/Intents reports, full chat session transcripts, and more.

We’ve served over 25,000 bots and have processed close to 100 billion messages to date.

Dashbot is backed by world-class investors such as ff Venture Capital, Bessemer Venture Partners, Scrum Ventures and Samsung.

Responsibilities

  • Writing scalable code using Python.
  • Developing back-end components.
  • Building and debugging React.js components
  • Helping prototype and annotate NLU related data.
  • Integrating user-facing elements using server-side logic.
  • Coordinating with development teams to determine application requirements.
  • Testing and debugging applications.
  • Helping with project management.

Requirements

  • Junior or Senior looking for a great opportunity to learn about implementing the latest in NLU concepts.
  • Python knowledge, including Flask.
  • Experience using React or other frontend frameworks.
  • Knowledge of AWS or other cloud providers, with Lambda being a big plus.

Applicants are encouraged to apply if they meet some but not all of the requirements, and have an interest in learning those areas on the job.

Why Dashbot?

  1. Impact: We are in the early stages of our journey, but growing tremendously fast. The input and effort you put in will have a tremendous impact on both our customers and Dashbot as a company.
  2. Learning & Living in the Future : You will be joining the market leader (that's us!) in the bot analytics space, and be exposed to cutting-edge technologies such as Conversational AI, Machine Learning, Natural Language Processing, and more. This entire industry is still in it’s nascency, and you’ll not only a get a front row seat, but will be an on-court player helping move this industry forward.
  3. The Journey: There are a million reasons not to join a startup, and 1 reason to — it’s all worth it (read Chip Huyen’s post on 7 reason not to join a startup and 1 reason to). Joining startups is the only way to get 15 years of experience in 5 years or less, and you will see & learn more in a few years than most people do in their entire career. Not only that, you will be embarking on this journey with some of the most amazing, brilliant, quirky, passionate, and driven people here at Dashbot.

How do I apply?

You can apply here or by emailing us directly at careers@dashbot.io — We review every application!

Equal employment opportunity ****

Dashbot is an equal opportunity employer: we value diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

position: Web Development Intern – Work on new challenges while learning new skills
description:
Who we are.

Part consulting group; part startup accelerator we are a startup of startups. Our goal is to build a team that can quickly find the valuation of any idea and help bring it to market in an efficient low-cost manner. This may include software development, UX/UI design, marketing or a number of other skills. Whether it's a client company or an internal idea we have what it takes to make it successful.

We’re looking for a co-founder to join the team and lead a team of senior developers and interns, help with product development and become part of the face of the company.

The ideal candidate is an experienced engineer who is comfortable in both large and small environments. Someone who understands leadership and organizational philosophy and most importantly is still hungry to build companies. So far it's been a fun idea and we're optimistic about success across multiple areas.

Benefits of working with us:
• Enhance your skillset and knowledge
• Opportunity to learn about many different verticals
• Feel empowered and change things - We value ideas and suggestions
• Work in an inclusive culture where transparency, creativity, accountability and ownership are encouraged
• Freedom to take out-of-the-box approach
• Support and resources to grow into a senior management position
• Flat Organization structure
• Exposure to startup challenges

Who you Are
• People tell you that you have a high attention to detail
• You are a bottom-up thinker, and are wholly unsatisfied with a functional solution that you do not understand
• You write clean, readable, testable and maintainable code
• You love working with other people, and people love working with you

Skills

• Front end development experience, using at least one major client side framework (React, Angular, Vue, etc)
• API development experience, using at least one major server side framework (Django, Rails, Node/Express, etc.)
• Experience using a variety of database technologies (SQL, NoSQL, key-value stores, etc.), and familiar with the tradeoffs and use cases for each

Bonus Skills
• Familiarity with React Native, Firebase/Firestore, GraphQL/Apollo, Docker/Kubernetes, and/or streaming content analytics would be considered a strong plus
• You have solid software engineering fundamentals:
o You understand unit/integration/system testing, and have a practical understanding of when each is necessary
o You have good software design skills, and know how to apply separation of concerns, inversion of control, dependency injection, etc.

The Celo mission is to build a financial system that creates the conditions for prosperity for everyone.

Celo aims to remove the barriers for large-scale adoption of cryptocurrencies as means-of-payment. Using a novel address-based encryption algorithm, the Celo protocol makes sending money as easy as sending a text. Additionally, Celo uses stable-value tokens pegged to fiat currencies, like the US Dollar, to minimize volatility. Celo is an open protocol enabling many to participate in the system, even with a budget Android smartphone. The first application launching on the Celo platform is a social payments and money transfer app, aimed at developing markets.

We are looking to hire interns for a fully remote, 12 week software development opportunity to assist on our Protocol and Applications Engineering teams.

About Us:

  • We are a full-stack company i.e. we are building both blockchain protocols and the user experiences on top of them
  • We are experienced startup founders and operators
  • We are highly technical, with backgrounds at places like Google and MIT
  • We are mission driven with a big goal: to bring sound currency and property rights to those who need it most
  • We have a strong engineering culture, which values open-source

You will:

  • Implement, test, and audit the stability and/or identity portion of the Celo protocol
  • Build back-end services that power our APIs
  • Help to hit product milestones by writing high quality, well tested code
  • Perform and participate in code reviews
  • Work in a high performance scrum team
  • Collaborate with product and design teams

You have:

  • A strong passion for Celo's mission
  • Ability to write high quality, well tested code
  • Strong experience developing production software
  • Strong communication skills and ability to lead technical discussions
  • Experience building software that is reusable, extensible, and modular
  • A passion for testing and achieving high test coverage

  • Enthusiasm to work in a startup environment

cLabs ("Celo Labs") started Celo in 2018 and is one of many contributors to the open source project Celo. cLabs builds financial technology to enable prosperity of all beings.

cLabs is a Teal organization, a method of decentralized management and organizational governance. Roles are defined around the work, not people, and there is a high degree of autonomy. As such, we're all proud to hold the job title of "Partner." For more information on our culture, we encourage you to check out our blog at https://medium.com/celohq/the-future-is-teal-cc264a5d51d3.

To build technology and products that are used and loved by people and solve real-world problems, we need to build a team with many different perspectives and experiences. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply and always consider qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records, in accordance with the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.

Applicants in need of special assistance or accommodation during the interview process or in accessing our website may contact us by sending an email to assistance(at)celo.org. We will treat your request as confidentially as possible. In your email, please include your name and preferred method of contact, and we will respond as soon as possible.

Pika.Group is an early-stage startup that is a subsidiary of Percolata, backed by Silicon Valley's top VC firms (Andreessen Horowitz, Menlo Ventures, Google Ventures, Foundation Capital, and more). We strive to make algorithmic trading more accessible for individual traders. Pika helps day traders develop machine learning models and automate execution. Having a forecasting model as a separate feature can provide last mile optimization and give traders the optimal time when to make a trade. Learn more here: Pika.Group

We are seeking a highly qualified Machine Learning Intern to join our team. Pika Group is a fully distributed workforce and the compensation is equity based. This position will require the individual to work with all aspects of the engineering team, helping to improve the accuracy and completeness of our models.

Position Description:

  • Design, develop, and implement machine learning models
  • Design advanced neural network training strategies
  • Generate and maintain design documentation
  • Work closely with a highly skilled, multidisciplinary team of engineers

Qualification:

  • 2+ years’ experience programming Python
  • Deep learning/neural network knowledge
  • 2+ years’ experience with relational databases and SQL programming
  • Experience with Google Cloud, AppSheet, Keras, Panda, numpy, scipy, PyTorch and Tensorflow is a plus
  • Solid communication skills
  • Currently enrollment in relevant program
  • Legal authorization to work in USA
  • Time series forecasting experience desired

Requirements:

  • Minimum GPA of 3.5
  • Must have computer science/programming background
  • Must have taken a machine learning course
  • Top 25 Computer Science school
  • Willing to work for a fully distributed remote company
  • Part-time for nine months during the school year @10 hr./week or full-time @40 hr./week for 3 months
  • Equity based compensation only

ScrapeVest is seeking a talented individual who possesses infinite curiosity. You'll partner with our Founder & CEO and Web Developer to create groundbreaking technology. This is an incredible opportunity to make a meaningful impact on the future of ScrapeVest.
