White Fox Scooters is the first docked electric scooter solution for walkable cities and micro-communities. Our docks have been initially deployed and hosted through partnerships with local governments as well as local businesses such as hotels, parking garages, and apartment buildings. We’re taking the electric scooter sharing model to the streets of New Jersey, hopefully New York soon, (as well as all other walkable cities) since we truly believe it is the most fun and efficient way to get around. We disrupt the electric scooter sharing industry in a key way: we place a strong emphasis on public safety. Our docks keep the scooters out of the path of pedestrians and allow us to share helmets with our riders. The company is led by our founder, Sidd Saxena, who has had prior experience in technology investment banking, ran multiple profitable businesses, and leads the YPO YNG Initiative in New York City.

Interns at White Fox Scooters will have the opportunity to make an impact in a way they never have before. Because of our small team, you will be able to interact and share ideas with all members, ask for feedback, and develop yourself as much as you develop the organization.

White Fox Scooters is looking for someone with experience in backend development. We are looking for a candidate who can create and manage databases for our users and/or scooters. You will be working with Electrical and Computer Engineering Interns who are currently designing the hardware and software running within our docks and scooters to build smart docking station with automated locking and charging features. Docking station and scooters, both will have unique id and several methods defined in computer of docking station. When the scooters are docked or undocked, the database must be updated to reflect who is using which scooter and at which docking station a scooter is located. Interns must be available a minimum of 20 hours/week. Course credit available.

Requirements:

> Currently pursuing a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in a related field, or graduated with a Bachelor’s degree in a related field within the last 6 months (Master’s level preferred)

Strong background in computer programming

Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite and/or Google Suite

Strong attention to detail

Creative problem-solving skills

Competence in research skills

Strong written and oral communication skills in English

Demonstrated experience with database creation or management

Has knowledge of a web framework or a mobile development framework

Project experinece with Django,Flask webdevelopment framework required.

Other Experience: Postman, JWT, JSON, HTTPS Required.

Has experience integrating different API's, REST API preferred.

Experience with these is a plus, but not required:

Basic knowledge of hardware and embedded software systems

Testing and certification of electrical systems

Python

Raspberry Pi

We have a flawless solid idea, a restless team, and a MVP which helped us enter an accelerator program held by one of the biggest technology hubs in Ontario.

We are looking for smart creatives who are passionate about what they do. They have overcome the fear of failure and know that the only way to win is to try again and try harder every time.

ZAKKI is a social startup focusing on creating an inclusive community for the elderly and people with disabilities. Our mission is to facilitate alms and donations collection and distribution to help the elderly and people with disabilities who work in the informal sector to get better livelihood through micro-business management, giving them greater market exposure.

Our Minimum Viable Product (MVP) can be found on https://www.zakki.org.
Currently, we are still redesigning ZAKKI fully function product. We are expecting to develop the ZAKKI fully function product in the upcoming years.

And, we are also developing a ramification project; reporting platforms of sexual misconduct (sexual harassment, sexual assault, rape), human trafficking, and bullying. And we also have an ongoing anti-corruption and a lost-found project. EduGame of anti-discrimination and anti-violence for toddlers to pre-teens. We also have a funeral service project . The volunteer networking and community learning hub. The crowdsharing for goods and food donation. And last but not least, the ZAKKI on the spot marketplace intended to cater to the beneficiaries (the elderly and people with disability) micro-business market exposure.

All matters relating to volunteering are based upon one’s ability to perform the job, as well as one’s dedication to ZAKKI’s Mission and needs.

  • ⁃ Agile Project Management tools such as Jira, Asana or equivalent 
  • ⁃ Google Suite, all Office Tools  
  • • Excellent oral and written communications skills and experience interacting with both business and IT individuals at all levels including the executive level  • Creative approach to problem-solving with the ability to focus on details while maintaining the “big picture” view   Specific Requirement:  Knowledge of one or more of these skills below is preferred; • Knowledge on UI/UX Designing process • Able to use versioning control system such as GIT, GitLab, Github. • Proven ability to lead software development projects and ensure objectives, goals, and commitments are met   Please fill up the Google Form: https://forms.gle/p2pkFdK3ejHZkgE17  select role AGILE PROJECT MANAGEMENT

ZAKKI is a social startup focusing on creating an inclusive community for the elderly and people with disabilities. Our Minimum Viable Product (MVP) can be found on https://www.zakki.org.
Currently, we are still redesigning ZAKKI fully function product. We are expecting to develop the ZAKKI fully function product in the upcoming years.

ZAKKI is an online platform-based organization (website and mobile application) that is focused on helping the elderly and people with disabilities get better livelihoods to build inclusive communities in Indonesia. ZAKKI facilitates the collection and distribution of donations to help the elderly and people with disabilities working in the informal sector to obtain better livelihoods through the assistance of micro business management and giving them greater market exposure.

Currently, ZAKKI is developing a ramification project; reporting platforms of sexual misconduct (sexual harassment, sexual assault, rape), human trafficking, and bullying. And we also have an ongoing anti-corruption and a lost-found project. EduGame of anti-discrimination and anti-violence for toddlers to pre-teens. We also have a funeral service project . The volunteer networking and community learning hub. And last but not least, the ZAKKI on the spot marketplace intended to cater to the beneficiaries (the elderly and people with disability) micro-business market exposure.

ZAKKI provides equal volunteering opportunity for everyone regardless of age, sex/gender, color, race, creed, nationality/origin, marital status, sexual orientation, political belief, or disability that does not prohibit essential performance job functions. All matters relating to volunteering are based upon one’s ability to perform the job, as well as one’s dedication to ZAKKI’s Mission and needs.

We are recruiting VOLUNTEER as either DEVELOPER ADVISOR and or PROGRAMMER itself.

• Linux system administration, web server configuration, SQL database (Oracle or MySQL or PostgreSQL), No SQL (Mongo DB) and other common web stack technologies

• Java Programming

If you think you have what it takes, email your resume to hello@grabalatte.io with “Software Engineering Intern” in the subject line.

About Us

Professionals and Entrepreneurs often need quick answers to solve questions they have while on their career or business journey. This is needed now more than ever during Covid. LATTE provides on-demand mentorship and community-based resources for advice, guidance and feedback. Unlike traditional methods of finding help, LATTE provides an approachable way to get help from vetted top-notch mentors and resources that were once never accessible.

LATTE's vision is two fold: To dismantle the belief there are not enough underrepresented professionals in the pipeline for work at top companies and to eliminate the three most prominent barriers to personal development:
1- Fear of Connecting
2- Access
3- Cost

We’re looking for a Frontend Engineering intern/coop to join us in September 2021 for a 4 or 8 month work term, with the opportunity for conversion to full-time employment. You will work with other engineers and designers to help us ship outstanding product features, standardize our component library, and deliver high-quality polished code.

A little about us:

ZenHub is the leading team collaboration and project management suite built into GitHub and GitHub Enterprise. At ZenHub, every team member is charged with getting to know customers deeply, learning how to solve their toughest problems, and turning them into evangelists.
Our customers are smart cookies: some of the best teams at companies like Imgur, NASA, Microsoft, Docker, and Zenefits use ZenHub to stay in the zone. Ideal team members are technical enough to get their hands dirty and product-focused enough to help translate customer requests into product features.

What we’ll accomplish together:

  • Make every user interaction with our product a delightful and polished experience.
  • Work within our best practices to deliver a consistant UI experience.
  • Contribute to the ideation, technical design, implementation, and testing of product features.
  • Improve technical skills and share knowledge with the rest of the team.
  • Ship features with the users in mind and strive to provide them with a seamless experience.

Our Ideal Candidate:

  • Has a deep interest in learning about web technologies to push the platform to its limits.
  • Is excited to learn from a team of dedicated engineers solving real world problems.
  • Familiarity with agile software development methodologies.
  • Knowledge of modern web development libraries such as React, Vue.js, or Angular.
  • Interest or knowledge of UX and UI design principles.
  • A completed or nearly completed BS/MS in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or equivalent experience.

More about ZenHub:
Don’t sweat it if you don’t have everything listed in the role description. One of our values is “Growth Mindset”. If you have some of the qualities listed above, and are excited about the role and motivated to learn – we want to hear from you!
At ZenHub our people are the priority. We believe the more perspectives we embrace, the stronger our team. We recruit the best, and welcome people of all backgrounds regardless of race, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, or ability. With a focus on respect and a commitment to continuous learning, we’re building an inclusive culture that supports our team in doing their best work. We work hard to provide our full-time team members perks that make their lives better by offering:

○ Boundaryless working style. We want our team to work from wherever is best for them. Whether you prefer to work from the comfort of your home office or from our bright, spacious, and dog-friendly Zen-den, we support you. For those opting to wfh, we offer a generous monthly stipend to cover ongoing remote work expenses. If you opt to join us in-office, we’ll contribute to your commute expenses or bike maintenance.

○ A flexible vacation policy. We work hard and it’s important we take time to recharge. We have a flexible time off policy with no hard limit and encourage our team members to take a minimum of 3 weeks off per year.

○ A commitment to continued learning and development. We provide an annual professional development budget to use towards conferences, classes, books, and other opportunities to maintain and expand your skill set.

○ Fitness reimbursements. Stay fit with our monthly reimbursements for health-related benefits like gym memberships, fitness apps, and personal training.

○ Top-of-the-line equipment. In addition to receiving a company smartphone of your choice with a paid voice/data plan, every team member receives a generous annual new tech budget to try new gadgets, tools, and platforms.

○ Flexible parental leave policies. We understand the importance and demands of a growing family. In addition to state, provincial, and federal leave allowances, parents on our team have the ability to create flexible schedules or take days off when family needs to come first.

○ Social Connection. When it’s safe to gather again our team will have access to a shared collaboration space in Vancouver, but our team is focused on fostering strong relationships and an equitable experience no matter where in the world you’re working.

Check out our careers page to learn more about what other benefits we offer!t what other benefits we offer!

description:
Position Summary:

We are looking for an enthusiastic software QA engineer to help us update the product documentation and improve the performance and usability of our mobile app and web-based subscription for brands and retailers. This position is both a technical product management position and a QA engineer position.

We are looking for a Quality Assurance (QA) engineer to develop and execute exploratory and automated tests to ensure product quality.

QA engineer responsibilities include designing and implementing tests, debugging and defining corrective actions. You will also review system requirements and track quality assurance metrics (e.g. defect campaign workflows and collaboration opportunities with matchmaking brands to creatives.)

The QA technician role plays an important part in our company’s product development process. Our ideal candidate will be responsible for conducting tests before product launches to ensure software runs smoothly and meets customer needs, while being cost-effective. If you hold an engineering background and enjoy providing end-to-end solutions to software quality problems, we'd like to meet you.

Ultimately, you should monitor all stages of software development to identify and resolve system malfunctions to meet quality standards.

Responsibilities

  • Review requirements, specifications and technical design documents to provide timely and meaningful feedback
  • Create detailed, comprehensive and well-structured test plans and test cases
  • Estimate, prioritize, plan and coordinate testing activities
  • Design, develop and execute automation scripts using open source tools
  • Identify, record, document thoroughly and track bugs
  • Perform thorough regression testing when bugs are resolved
  • Develop and apply testing processes for new and existing products to meet client needs
  • Liaise with internal teams (e.g. developers and product managers) to identify system requirements
  • Monitor debugging process results
  • Investigate the causes of non-conforming software and train users to implement solutions
  • Track quality assurance metrics, like defect densities and open defect counts
  • Stay up-to-date with new testing tools and test strategies

Requirements

  • Proven work experience in software development
  • Proven work experience in software quality assurance
  • Strong knowledge of software QA methodologies, tools and processes
  • Experience in writing clear, concise and comprehensive test plans and test cases
  • Hands-on experience with both white box and black box testing
  • Hands-on experience with automated testing tools
  • Solid knowledge of SQL and scripting
  • Experience working in an Agile/Scrum development process
  • Experience with performance and/or security testing is a plus
  • Pursuing BS/MS degree in Computer Science, Engineering or a related subject

Education/Experience:

  • Current enrollment in an accredited university or development program
  • Essential Competencies And Behaviors
  • Highly self-motivated contributor who works well as an individual and within a team environment
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills
  • Detail-oriented and highly organized with the ability to multitask in a fast-paced environment.

Klatch 2021-2022 Academic Fellowship

Klatch (formerly known as JobEcademy) is offering an exciting full year fellowship to work with a seasoned team to change the online learning landscape for millions of people. We’re selecting a cohort of 6-10 highly talented undergraduate and graduate fellows from universities across the country for a part-time Fellowship during the academic year (15-20 hours per week, September – May). Each week you’ll engage with a remarkable group of your peers while receiving the mentorship and training from an experienced startup team.

Help reimagine the world of online learning while learning the ins and outs of starting a business from a CEO and founder who has built and led many successful national companies. While this full-time internship is virtual, you’ll get constant face time with the team, stakeholders, & others to constantly be engaged, learning, and receive opportunities to drive projects that otherwise usually take years of being at a company for accelerated real life learning. Each year we receive hundreds of applicants for our fellowship training program. If you’re an ambitious, hard working student that is passionate about changing the landscape of online learning, this could be the perfect opportunity for you!

OUR 2021-2022 ACADEMIC FELLOWSHIP ROLES:

We’re a fast-moving startup and looking for adaptable, coachable individuals who like to learn and do anything and everything. Roles will be flexible and adapted throughout the academic school year. Please indicate your top 3 choices in your cover letter:
• Online Learning & Community Coordinators: Are you a natural at customer service and enjoy making a frictionless experience for those you assist? In this role you’ll work closely with talented subject matter experts across many industries to help them develop their live workshops, troubleshoot any issues, and actively bring feedback back to the team inform our product development.

• Learning Development / Video Production: Do you have experience building out training, curriculum, breaking down complicated concepts, PowerPoint design, and/or making great learning or promotional videos? You’ll work with subject matter experts and distinguished professors to assist in building training content to change the entire model of online learning for a national audience.

• Business Development: Do you love meeting new people? Figuring out their pain points & how you can help? In this role you’ll have the unique opportunity to reach out to subject matter experts, understand their journey, and share how we can solve their problems.

• Marketing, & Social Media: Are you a social media aficionado? Do you enjoy sharing content, retweeting links and drumming up attention for happening? In this role you’ll help lead the company’s marketing and social media efforts and learn about best practice social media campaign design.

• Product Development: Does the idea of building new products and quality checking existing ones get you excited? Do you have experience in product development or have high attention to detail and incredible organizational structure? Help develop our product learning the ins & outs of our software, project management, and design tools to help assist our product management capability and developers. Previous UI/UX experience is also highly valuable.

Please note that these are our current opportunities and constantly evolving. Let us know where your strengths, experience, and interests are. Fellows will fill many roles and work across many areas over the course of the academic year. We are a very small, nimble team.

ABOUT US:

Klatch is building the model for live, interactive group workshops for adults to learn nearly any topic from anywhere in the world. We believe lifelong learning is inherently social, not one-way pre-recorded hours of laborious videos. Our platform and model offers expert-led, community-based social learning. We enable experts across nearly any topic to stimulate an engaging classroom through an integrated cohort-based platform, social tools, and best in class facilitator training. We have no small dreams. We are on the path to transforming the world of adult education and have the experienced team and resources to do it. If you get excited by being part of a small team on the frontlines of disruption, Klatch might be the place for you!

ABOUT YOU:

• Very strong attention to details, big picture, critical thinking, and problem solving skills
• You leave your ego at the door, own your mistakes, and are solutions-focused.
• Are fun to be around, excited by a small, fast-moving team, and able to wear many hats
• Enjoy getting your hands dirty & passionate about solving the world’s biggest problems
• You can work effectively remotely on your own and with a team over video calls.
• Able to read & synthesize documents quickly, including complex data
• Are self-driving and excited about managing up rather than being micro-managed
• Have the skills and tenacity to thrive in ambiguous or challenging circumstances
• Have a thirst to learn new skills and technologies, and can pick things up easily

WHY US:

Help reimagine adult learning while getting extensive experience building a business from the ground up from a CEO who has built successful national companies, led turnarounds and acquisitions, run national nonprofits with millions of members, and overseen multi-billion dollar programs at the highest levels of national government. We have an extraordinary group of world renowned advisors and investors that include: the earliest investors & founders of many global billion dollar marketplaces, executives responsible for massive global operations and logistics, marketing gurus who have established some of the world’s biggest brands, learning experts, educational foundations, large business networks, software and technical experts, legal and regulation experts and more. While a very small, fast-paced team we don’t take ourselves too seriously and have a lot of fun working together.

The Application Process: This is an unpaid academic internship in partnership with your university. If selected for our year long cohort, you will have a professor sign our internship agreement (some students have elected to also get credit through their university but this is not required). Include in your cover letter the top 3 specific role(s) you are most interested in, your earliest available start date and latest end date, that you understand a professor will sign off on the program, and any background experience that might be applicable. All Fellows will go through a similar training program while roles will be considerably different depending on prior experience and capabilities.

Dates & Details: This fellowship will run continuously (aside from breaks) from early September to end of May at 15-20 hours per week with some flexibility when those hours are done. Only apply if you can consistently dedicate at least 15 hours per week during weekdays. You will report to senior team leaders with regular interaction with the CEO.

position: Full Stack Web Development Internship with Food Tribe
description:
Food Tribe is looking for interns!

We're Food Tribe, a socially conscious restaurant review platform, and we're looking to bring on a few web development interns to help build out a suite of digital products.

Experience in HTML Web page or email creation
Strong familiarity with JQuery

Basic knowledge of video encoding software

Quick learner with ability to take direction, work under pressure and operate as part of a team
Excellent verbal and communication skills
An extreme attention to detail and organizational skills

Ability to deal effectively with people at all levels

Currently or previously enrolled in an accredited college or university and taking at least one class, or be a recent graduate of an accredited college or university within the last six (6) months at time of application.
Currently or previously pursuing an undergraduate degree or graduated with a major in computer science, web design, web technology or related




Preferred Qualifications

Familiarity with building native and mobile web apps
Familiarity with maintaining web servers and databases
Web Design and User Experience


Responsibilities A Day in the Life…

The Web Developer Intern will play a big role in supporting the Corporate Communications Digital Media team. Day-to-day tasks will vary from participating in client meetings to maintaining web tools.

Work with editorial team to update and manage content on multiple websites including foodtribeusa.co
Gather weekly/monthly web/social media analytics for multiple accounts
Create and code multiple HTML email and web pages
Maintain existing and potentially create web apps/tools

DevOps Internship

As a DevOps Engineer on our team, you'll help us build out the core web applications and tools that will serve to enable our research and development teams to effectively test and analyze our data.

In our small but growing organization, you'll not only be developing and shipping new features but also designing core aspects of Food Tribe’s content and data analysis product.

In this role you’ll build a continuous integration pipeline to allow the Software team to release features faster and more frequently. You’ll be also creating a QA testing framework so that the team can write and run automated tests in a predefined environment. You will be involved in identifying and fixing bugs, documenting our research platform, and providing support to the Research team in using the research platform.

THE SKILL SET
Computer science or related background
Previous experience in at least 1 software development role in industry

Must haves:

Strong desire to lead
Ability to define project deliverables
Flexibility
Lack of ego
Patience

Interested in applying?

Sweet! Share with us why you want to work at Food Tribe and don't forget to mention any side projects, academic papers, and personal websites/blogs.

Data Science Internship @ Food Tribe

At Food Tribe, its our mission to connect good people with good food. Food Tribe’s unique dataset contains billions of interactions between users and local restaurant + food businesses (www.foodtribeusa.co/mission).

The Data Science team performs analyses, builds models, and designs experiments that directly impact Food Tribe’s business and users. Our remote team consumes data at Food Tribe, adept at tasks from modeling content growth and user behavior to sharing insights about engagement.

We’re looking for interns to work side-by-side with our Tech Team at Food Tribe to make sense of these interactions to deliver impactful analyses and products to our users, business partners and the general public.

*We Are Looking For: *

  • Pursuing a BA/BS, MS, or PhD in Statistics, Math, Physics, Economics, Computer Science or related quantitative discipline.
  • Fluency with data analysis tools
  • Solid understanding of statistical inference, experimental design and analysis.
  • Enthusiasm for clean code and sharing reproducible results.
  • Communication skills to work with partners on engineering, product and business teams.
  • An eye for great data visualization
  • Endless ideas about how to leverage Food Tribe’s unique data set.

*What You Will Do: *

  • Define key metrics to track Food Tribe’s performance and inform product decisions.
  • Assess and frame questions from partners into actionable deliverables.
  • Design, execute, and analyze complex experiments impacting users.
  • Devise and evaluate models for diverse business needs, such as identifying growth opportunities, personalizing user experience, and matching consumers to businesses.
  • Own analyses start-to-finish and communicate key insights to stakeholders.
  • Share your technical skills to develop and maintain high-quality, reusable analysis tools.

*Interested in applying? *

Sweet! Share with us why you want to work at Food Tribe and don't forget to mention any side projects, academic papers, and personal websites/blogs.

NOTE: Candidates applying should be available from January 2nd to June 30th 2022.

Sense builds home monitoring technology to help people understand their household energy consumption, know what is going on in their homes, and ultimately reduce their energy footprint. We help make homes safer, more efficient, and more reliable. We are serious about impacting climate change, and we regularly measure reduction in carbon emissions from our technology.

Sense was founded in 2013 by pioneers in speech recognition technologies. This background provides the team with the intuition to unlock key insights relating to home energy efficiency and deliver those insights to customers. We use machine learning technology to provide real-time insights on device behavior. Customers rely on Sense for a wide range of uses including monitoring their home appliances, determining whether they left appliances running, finding faulty appliances, and identifying how to reduce energy costs.

We are looking for an intern or co-op to join our Data Science team in 2022. You’ll be diving into messy time-series data, improving our visualization tools, exploring data-driven modeling, and ultimately improving our customers’ visibility into their homes.

Requirements

We are looking for someone who is:

  • Passionate about the energy sector and climate change
  • Eager to work in a young, fast-paced, and exciting startup environment
  • A 3rd year, 4th year, or graduate student working towards a numeric degree: computer science, electrical engineering, applied mathematics, physics, etc.
  • Familiar with classifiers and regressors in machine learning.
  • Experienced in software development in Python.
  • Adept at communication: eager to learn insights from data and present them to the team.

Nice to have

  • Experienced in signal processing, time-series / frequency analysis, algorithms, and data structures.
  • Experience with Jupyter notebooks.
  • Experience with software development tools: git, testing, debugging.
  • Experience with deep learning frameworks such as Tensorflow or Pytorch.

Benefits

Benefits

  • Be a part of a team that will make a difference in the world.
  • Gain experience at a startup building a consumer product from the ground up.
  • Work with a small team of experienced entrepreneurs creating revolutionary technology.
  • Deep dive into a wide range of interesting software problems to be solved.

Sisu network is a Ethereum compatible network that allows people deploy smart contract with very low transaction cost. In addition, Sisu leverages Threshold Signature Scheme (TSS) that enables decentralized coin swapping between 2 different chains without going through the hassle of KYC process.

This internship is for someone who is hard working and really wants to learn how to build a blockchain from bottom up.

This position allows you to dig deep into Ethereum source code or explore Cosmos's core or how to implement a TSS signing. There are many jobs out there that requires you to write simple smart contracts but they will not be near the level of challenges that this position offers.

If you are a great engineer and want to get into blockchain space, this position is a perfect step for you.

90% of the code is written in Go. Some experience with Go is preferrable. However, I am looking for someone with strong CS background, quick learner and the ability to work hard.

In you application, show me the your AMAZING projects or achievement you have got (e.g. competitive programming prizes or complicated open source Github project you have built).

You will work with me complete the project and launch the testnet. Blockchain is a fast moving space. You will work really hard but also learn a lot.

Our team builds new technologies that protect millions of people from phishing attacks. We aspire and succeed to reach far beyond today’s security market.

We are seeking a talented Security Engineer to identify, track, and defeat sophisticated targeted cyber attackers as part of our new PhishGuard team. In this position, you will examine and mitigate phishing attacks in realtime.

As a Security Engineer, your experience, thinking, and action will be the key to our success. You will develop software and algorithms to help. identify Cyber Attacks in the real world. You will collaborate with our team to develop new ways to present and interact with our insights. You will stop the adversary. You will show the world how the adversary works.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS

  • Incoming 2nd or 3rd Year Undergraduate enrollment at US College Degree Program in one of the following majors: Computer Science, Information Technology, Information Security, or Computer Security. Sorry, graduates of these programs will not be considered for this opportunity. Graduate students are also ineligible for this position.
  • Current GPA of 3.1 or higher. GPA proof will be required.
  • Ability to synthesize technical information and document it in a non-technical manner including through graphical and verbal depictions
  • Excellent english writing skills
  • Experience with Domain Names, IP Addresses, Emails (Subject, From, To, Addresses), Hyperlinks, DNS, IPv4, IPv6

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

  • Experience writing Go, Python, React
  • Experience with Postgres, BigQuery
  • Experience with REDIS
  • Experience with Kafka

DUTIES

  • Drive the next wave of security technology through prototyping concepts into solutions
  • Define, design and implement software to address tactical and strategic purposes
  • Collaborate with researchers to apply research techniques at scale
  • Work with large scale data systems

TIMING

  • This is a Spring/Summer 2022 position.

position: Internship in React Native Android App (Remote & Unpaid)
description:
If you are looking to be a pioneer in creation of a seamless behavior of devices for its users, an opportunity to be part of an implementation of a new Android app from scratch to deployment, then come help us launch HuTouch (product by Niiti).

At Niiti, we focus on providing real life experiences so that students can:

  1. Gain advanced core skills
  2. Work with teams of different domains
  3. Learn what it takes to deliver on commitments

Outgoing interns see this as a path to their dream jobs.
"one of the coolest projects... it feels great knowing that my work will help impact and augment the end-user experience" - Nitish V (College of Engineering, University of Michigan). Read more about what our interns say on our HuTouch Group on LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/groups/8991258/

HuTouch is part of an early stage startup with its MVP. HuTouch is Apple Handoff for non-apple devices, i.e., it will allow users to pick up their activities (apps, data) from where they stopped when they move between devices.

HuTouch needs a React Native mobile application developer intern (specifically for Android) to help accomplish the below goals & tasks (priority as stated):

  1. Research and development to identify solutions for functionalities designed by our early adopters. You will be required to have problem solving skills, study different materials and come up with solutions for functionalities within HuTouch that are not developed yet. This may take up 40% to 50% of your time on this project.
  2. Deliver code & User Experience not just with high quality but also with a logical flow in mind. The tasks associated to this job requirement is coding and unit testing, where the intern will need to make sure no critical or high defects creep into the developed code. This may take 30% to 40% of your time on this project.
  3. Demo of individual features developed and end to end flow. It'll be required for you to present the working app to the founder over a call while you screen share. There is no need for powerpoint presentations here, as this will be a pure demo of the app. This will take up 10% to 20% of your time on this project.
  4. Understand the flow within HuTouch and apply it to design frameworks for HuTouch. An intern will be asked to read about HuTouch, React Native for Android, to think like an architect and identify any foreseeable risks during implementation. This will take up the remaining time on this project.

Visit www.HuTouch.com for more details & to see the demo video on our patent pending concept on continuity.

Skills required:

  1. Knowledge of coding skills in React Native platform for Android
  2. Client side coding to interact with APIs for AWS or cloud solutions
  3. Problem solving skills that drives the urge to solve by looking at a problem from different angles/scenarios and presenting with multiple solutions.
  4. Communication skills to articulate the problem and clarify assumptions

Samaritan seeks a team member to join us in helping people on the street access the resources needed to find a home. If that sounds like you, and you've got a gift for Android development, we'd love for you to consider sharing your gifts with the people we serve.

Outreach teams and case managers use our smart wallets—called beacons—as a resource for people experiencing homelessness. Individuals set their own housing and health goals and then can access the financial and social capital needed to meet those goals.

The Samaritan app enables providers to issue beacons, update goals & needs, and help beacon holders spend money. It also enables everyday individuals and organizations learn the stories of individuals and join their team of supporters to help them meet set goals. Over 10,000 "samaritans" invested >$100K and 1,000 letters of encouragement into a pilot cohort of 500 beacon holders, enabling dozens to reach life-changing outcomes. This is just the start, with additional pilots in LA, OKC, and NYC coming online soon (learn more).

You'll be joining an incredible task-force of 6 (one backend, one backend/Android, one iOS, and three non-technical). You'll collaborate to ship user-requested features and upgrades that grow the amount of financial & social capital that is put into the hands of people in need.

Samaritan hackers are compensated on a bounty system: every feature or upgrade has a bounty on it, which goes to you when you ship it. So the higher the impact you have for our users, the higher your compensation.

Strong preference given to candidates who can be onsite with us in Seattle (once this virus blows over). Will also consider a FT remote candidate in the right circumstances. Look forward to hearing from you!

SKILLS REQUIRED:

  • Native Android Java
  • Frontend Implementation & Animations
  • Git
  • Kotlin
  • Activities
  • Fragments
  • Services
  • Broadcast Receivers
  • REST API Integrations with Retrofit 2

PLUS:

  • RxJava and RxAndroid
  • Unit Testing with JUnit
  • UI Testing with Espresso Framework
  • CI

SOFT SKILLS:

  • Balance engineering excellence with velocity

  • Communicate effectively with teammates, onsite and remote

  • Translate information between technical and non-technical team members

  • Eagerness to own a feature from conception to deployment

  • Willingness to wear many hats (you might help design implementations for features that span multiple codebases and platforms—you'll be responsible for doing whatever needs to be done to get features to users)

  • Quickly adapt and reprioritize to the needs of the team (no two days here are the same)

  • Ability to learn independently

| about | Samaritan exists to help people on the street gain the social and financial support needed to find a home. If this sounds like your type of work, and you know or can pick up Rails, we'd love to hear from you about a fall / winter hackership.

Health and human services offer Samaritan Members as a resource for people experiencing homelessness. New Members set their own goals and then can access capital from a team of supporters to meet needs (like phone service, medications, or proper clothing) and enable action (such as meeting a housing specialist, applying for work, or accessing medical care) towards those goals. Over time, more than 50% of Samaritan Members measurably improve access to care, housing, employment, or another goal.

We've practiced this model in Seattle, Oklahoma City, Orange County, with new pilots starting in Denver, Portland, and New York City. For now, we have a mighty team of 8 (frontend, backend, iOS, Android, plus four non-technical). But the 15-year vision (we're year 5) is to have helped 100,000 adults and families towards housing (and to have the next 100,000 Members enrolled!). So we've got some work to do and would love to hear from you!

Samaritan Hackerships run 10-12 weeks and are compensated by a bounty system. Every feature or upgrade has a bounty on it, which goes to you when you ship it. The higher the impact you have for our users, the higher your compensation. Our hackers have ranged $1000-$3000/month, with a few outliers low and high. Most of our FT hires come from Samaritan Hackership graduates.

  • help design technical implementations of new user stories
  • help manage and scale our infrastructure on AWS as we grow

We're We3 👋

  • A free mobile app that connects you with the most compatible people nearby.
  • How? We use quizzes to create deep psychographic profiles of users and use social science and machine learning to privately connect them in group chats of 3.

Why 💡

  • The strongest predictor of your overall happiness is not beauty, health, social status, or even wealth—it’s the quality of your close relationships.
  • As a society, we’re growing increasingly isolated, and it’s killing us.
  • Our Mission is to eradicate loneliness, and create life-changing friendships at scale.

We’re a Startup 🚀

  • We’re a team of 3 entrepreneurs. That’s it.
  • We like to get stuff done. With no funding, we’ve reached half a million people.

The Job 👩‍💻

  • Develop, maintain & improve the features that convert thousands of strangers into new friends every single day.
  • Own and deliver complex projects from the planning stage through execution.
  • Contribute to the technical design process, break down large tasks.
  • Investigate the edge-cases, exploring any problems that arise in depth and proposing robust solutions.
  • Design, evaluate and measure solutions to problems varying in scope.
  • Technologies we use: Angular, Ionic5, Ruby, Postgres, BigQuery, Google Cloud Platform.

You are...👇

  • Hungry to have a massive impact in the world.
  • Ready to take on more responsibility than would usually be given at this stage in your career.
  • Eager to learn fast and apply your learnings.
  • Comfortable working in a fast-changing decision-making environment.
  • Confident enough to interrupt when you don’t understand.
  • Low ego, and self-aware enough and notice when you are wrong.
  • Capable of thinking and communicating clearly, in writing and person.
  • Disciplined enough to work effectively at home.

Must Have 🧐

  • English Proficiency (spoken & written)
  • JavaScript/HTML/CSS
  • Angular Experience

Great to Have 🤩

  • Mobile Development Experience (web, native or hybrid)
  • Ruby
  • Ionic Framework Experience
  • Git

  • SQL

Nice to Have 🤤

  • Firebase
  • Google apis
  • AWS
  • Heroku
  • Linode

At Carta, we design products that transform the way hospitals use data to deliver care. We make analyzing data fast, easy, and useful for everyone. We’re looking for Engineers skilled at rapid iteration and excited about solving problems that can save lives. This is a startup role, where we will ask you to wear many hats and solve many different types of problems.

You love solving complex engineering problems, by creating beautiful, and well-tested algorithms. You’re a positive individual who leads by example, drives conceptual thinking, and brings a curiosity and experimental approach to solving engineering challenges. You enjoy building new features and writing elegant code. If this describes you--you belong at Carta.

We have open positions in Fall and Winter and we will be reaching out to you in July regarding this role.

Excited to talk to you!

About Applied
Autonomy is one of the leading technological advances of this century that will come to impact our lives. The work you’ll do at Applied will meaningfully accelerate the efforts of the top autonomy teams in the world. At Applied, you will have a unique perspective on the development of cutting edge technology while working with major players across the industry and the globe.

As the foremost enabler of autonomous vehicle development, Applied Intuition equips engineering and product teams with software that makes it faster, safer, and easier to bring autonomy to market. Applied’s suite of products, focused on simulation and analytics, delivers sophisticated infrastructure built for scale. Companies of all sizes use Applied to comprehensively test and rapidly accelerate their autonomous vehicle development. Headquartered in Silicon Valley with offices in Detroit, Tokyo, Munich, and Seoul, Applied is composed of software and automotive experts from the top companies in the world (such as Google, Amazon, Apple, Waymo, Tesla, Delphi, GM, and Bosch).

About the Role
(We are hiring for all levels of experience.)

We are looking for bright engineers interested in designing elegant solutions to difficult problems in the autonomy space. Our software engineers work across our suite of products, tackling a variety of full-stack, infrastructure, robotics, and graphics challenges. At Applied, we encourage all engineers to take ownership over technical and product decisions, closely interact with users to collect feedback, and contribute to a thoughtful, dynamic team culture.

At Applied, you will:

  • Work across our entire stack to develop new products, features, and tools for our customers' autonomy development workflows
  • Have an unparalleled opportunity to work with domain experts across a variety of fields: infrastructure, robotics, and graphics engineers, as well as startup veterans
  • Carve out your own area of expertise and influence product decisions
  • Collaborate with other members in the autonomy ecosystem and learn about different approaches to solving core issues in autonomy

We are looking for someone who:

  • Is a self-starter and can quickly become comfortable with new technical tools
  • Designs efficient and effective solutions to a wide range of engineering challenges
  • Takes initiative in a fast-paced environment

Nice to have:

  • Working knowledge of frontend, API layer, database ORM, containerization, or cluster orchestration frameworks (such as React, GraphQL, SQLAlchemy, Docker, or Kubernetes)
  • Experience working with simulation tools, modeling physical problems, or using robotics middlewares (such as ROS)

Ensemble Energy (now part of SparkCognition Inc.) provides a platform for operators of energy assets to use their data to reduce costs and increase production. Our mission is to reduce the cost for clean energy power plants making them even more cost competitive. We are a dedicated team of engineers with many years of experience in energy and analytics. We are looking to add to our team a full stack engineering intern to help us build our exciting advanced analytics platform.

Required Skills & Experience:

  • React/Redux, HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, Python, Django and REST API’s
  • Current BS or MS student or recent graduate. CS major is a plus
  • Strong foundation in Computer Science, with deep knowledge of data structures, algorithms, and software design
  • Experience with GIT, CI/CD tools, Atlassian software, AWS CodeDeploy, Lambda, Serverless a plus
  • Experience with Elasticsearch/ELK stack a plus
  • Contribute with ideas to overall product strategy and roadmap
  • Self-starter to take ownership of the platform engineering and application development
  • Work on multiple projects simultaneously and get things done. Take products from prototype to production
  • Collaborate with other team members for continuous development

Preferred:

  • Ability to stay-on for part-time or full-time as a co-op after summer 2021
  • Ability to demonstrate a portfolio of projects (GitHub, papers, etc.)

Bonus - If you have worked on one or more below then highlight those projects when applying:

  • Experience with Time Series DB - M3DB, Prometheus, InfluxDB, OpenTSDB, ELK Stack
  • Experience with visualization tools like Tableau, KeplerGL etc.
  • Experience with AWS IoT Core, Greengrass, MQTT or other IoT communication protocols a plus

Ensemble Energy is an exciting startup in industrial IoT space focused on energy. Our mission is to reduce the cost of energy from clean energy power plants making them more competitive to dirtier sources. Our platform provides prescriptive analytics to power plant operators by combining the power of machine learning, big data and deep domain expertise.  As a data science intern, you will participate in developing machine learning algorithms to solve some of the most exciting challenges in this space. In addition, you will also be responsible for helping the product development team in implementing the algorithms into the platform. 

Required Skills & Experience:
- Currently Enrolled or graduated with MS or PhD in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Statistics, or equivalent fields. Specialization in machine learning preferred. 
- Strong understanding of machine learning algorithms & principles (regression analysis, time series, probabilistic models, supervised classification and unsupervised learning), and their application.
- Experience with Deep Learning algorithms such as Convolutional Neural Networks, Recurrent Neural Networks and LSTM.
- Familiarity with Deep Learning frameworks such as TensorFlow and PyTorch, and strong experience in at least one of those.
- Excellent programming skills in prototyping languages such as Python and R. Python is preferred.
- Ability to demonstrate a portfolio of projects (GitHub, papers, etc.) will be a plus.
- Smart, motivated and can-do attitude is absolute must
Excellent verbal and written communication.

Ensemble Energy is an exciting startup in industrial IoT space focused on energy. Our mission is to accelerate the clean energy revolution by making it more competitive using the power of data. Ensemble’s AI enabled SaaS platform provides prescriptive analytics to power plant operators by combining the power of machine learning, big data, and deep domain expertise. As a data engineering intern, you will be participating in developing and deploying fault-tolerant ETL pipelines, perform data visualization and enable the development of ML algorithms.

Required Skills & Experience:
• Currently enrolled or recently graduated with MS or PhD in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Statistics, or equivalent fields. Specialization in data engineering preferred.
• Strong understanding of data engineering principles using big data technologies
• Expertise in relational databases (MSSQL/MySQL/Postgres) and expertise in SQL. Exposure to NoSQL such as Cassandra. MongoDB will be a plus.
• Experience with distributed computing using Hadoop and Spark
• Exposure to deploying ETL pipelines such as AirFlow, AWS Data Pipeline, AWS Glue
• Excellent programming skills in Java, Scala or Python. Python is preferred
• Experience using Tableau for data visualization will be a plus

Preferred:
• Ability to stay-on for part-time or full-time as a co-op until December 2019
• Ability to demonstrate a portfolio of projects (GitHub, papers, etc.)

The most important requirement is a can-do attitude and desire to make a change. Come join an exciting startup that is working on immense technical challenges and a mission to do our part to fight climate change.

About Upped

Upped Events is a SaaS Fintech startup that uses AI-constructed engagements to measure and manage every stakeholder at an event (attendees, staff, managers, vendors, the event owner, sponsors, etc). Using attendee smartphones, Upped’s software-only infrastructure can scale to any event size, use-case, or format. Real-time event data is combined with external data sources and analyzed by its AI model to maximize engagement opportunities that can be provided to the event owner or each attendee individually. While beta-testing its predecessor’s mobile payment prototype, Upped achieved ‘average attendee spend’ numbers as high as 115% over those attendees without Upped. A prior Wharton Business Plan Competition semi-finalist, Upped was recently designated by Startupbootcamp as a top-20 up-and-coming EvenTech company after winning Cambridge Innovation Center’s 3675 competition. The company’s Phase 1 product will be completed by the end of October 2020, during which time the company will be raising investment, growing its management team, and refining its AI offering.

Your Role

Upped is currently looking for a Wordpress/Elementor website developer and designer to assist with the refinement of Upped’s website ahead of product launch. Successful candidates will be hardworking, driven, and self-starters. Primary work topics will be reviewing, updating, making visual enhancements to, fixing bugs, and giving time estimates for future changes of Upped’s Wordpress/Elementor website. These individual will be joining a global team of developers and business persons, and should have skills surrounding Wordpress/Elementor as well as UI/graphic design capabilities. This individual will work under the guidance of Upped’s CEO, advisers (e.g. NASA Lead Electrical Engineer), and development lead in a remote/virtual work environment.

These individuals will be joining a lean and growing startup, so will need to thrive in a fast-paced and complex environment, be organized and detail oriented, and maintain a can-do attitude with a willingness to pitch in wherever needed. Following the internship, Upped will work with them to assess whether there is a match for a full-time position or consultation opportunities, and is happy to provide a strong recommendation letter for future employment.

Duties & Responsibilities will include:
• Working with internal Upped’s CEO, IT Architects, usability associates, and advisers to understand business objectives, needs, processes, development standards, and optimal user experience for Upped’s technology
• Doing Wordpress (Elementor) website review, including content updates & visual enhancements, fixing identified bugs/display issues, and giving time estimates for future changes to design or functionality
• Develop responsive WordPress themes, including website setup and configuration
• Helping to make Upped approachable, including trying to portray customer-facing, revenue-generating features such as Upped’s AI and chatbot functionalities in the best light
• Being a client advocate in all ways, using Upped’s product to provide clients value they will grow to need
• Keeping communicative, actively engaged, and detail oriented so as to produce quality work and update management. Problem-solve, troubleshooting and debugging complex issues or working with available resources/the CEO to create solution pathways.
• Being present at all company-wide meetings to ensure opportunities, challenges, and ongoing accountability against company benchmarks
• Learn. At Upped we support you in any way that we can – if you’re looking for something else, just ask Mark.

Basic qualifications and character traits:
• Undergraduate Degree in Computer Science or related field (unless you are entirely self-taught in Wordpress/Elementor)
• Stack: HTML, CSS, Wordpress, Elementor, and graphic design tools (to make website look great)
• Ability to communicate precisely and clearly (in both spoken and written English), breaking down complex subjects into easy-to-understand concepts
• Desire and ability to work autonomously and ability to juggle multiple projects at once
• Enthusiasm for a startup environment and an optimistic energy that pushes you to excel for the sake of making a difference in the world/life
• Proficiency in Microsoft Office, Google Drive/email, and general web research among other trade-specific tools
• Strong decision-making skills supported by research/quantitative reasoning
• Out of the box thinking, emotional intelligence, creativity, and tact are essential

Other valued qualifications:
• Graduate degree (Computer Science, Statistics, Applied Math, data analytics, engineering, or related field)
• Experience in Cloud based development platforms and APIs
• Experience in the festival/conference/entertainment/ticketing/event industries
• Detail oriented with a healthy dose of cost/benefit reasoning (your time and attention are valuable)
• Ability to operate with significant autonomy within the context of completing primary objectives
• Able to prioritize, execute, and take initiative in a complex/fast-paced environment
• Some experience with internet marketing, ad campaigns, FB marketing, Ad Words, or other PR assisting tasks
• Familiarity with mobile apps and other leading-edge software applications

Application Information
To apply, please send a resume and cover letter explaining why you would be a good fit for the position to careers@uppedevents.com, with “Wordpress/Elementor website developer and designer” in the subject line

Please direct any questions or concerns to mark@uppedevents.com

Description:
We are looking for a passionate security intern to join our Cybersecurity team. The responsibilities include to ensure to secure the client applications from potential breaches. Assist to create, leverage automation, continuously develop, maintain and mature Offensive Security Program. Be a resourceful part of the talented team responsible for application and infrastructure penetration testing, supporting external vulnerability reports and overall vulnerability management.

Perform penetration testing coverage across the global organization. Perform independent manual penetration tests of cloud and global IT infrastructure, web application, APIs, and IOT devices.

To be successful as a security analyst for a startup, you should be an inspired self-starter and have passion to learn and explore.

Job Responsibilities:

  • Plan scope and timing of static/dynamic application security testing.
  • Coordinate and execute testing plan.
  • Ensure security defects are documented and tracked for all releases, major technology and process changes.
  • Analyze testing results to validate, classify risk and rank findings.
  • Prepare and deliver reports with findings and recommendations.
  • Support remediation activities.
  • Perform penetration tests and validate cyber security controls.
  • Exposure to security research and publishing.
  • Experience of Application (Web or Mobile) Penetration Testing.
  • Familiarity with Security Standards and groups (OWASP, SANS).
  • Hands - on experience of Security Testing tools.
  • Basic Knowledge of Programming and scripting languages.

Job Requirements:

  • Experience in performing penetration testing on web and mobile applications.
  • Ability to communicate technical issues to non-technical audiences at multiple organization levels.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • Ability to develop good relationships with current and potential clients.
  • Any Graduate or Post Graduate with passion in the security domain.
  • Certifications: CEH or any application security training from well recognized training institutes with at least 6 month training.

Posted positions are not open to third party recruiters/agencies and unsolicited resume submissions will be considered free referrals.*

*Fall 2021 Engineering internship *

Proctorio is proud to introduce our Fall Engineering Internship Program. We are inviting 6 university students to gain first-hand experience at a growing software company where education always comes first.
We are seeking motivated students in software engineering or computer science majors who are looking to expand their knowledge of web and mobile development and system administration of various internal and commercial projects.
The paid Proctorio Fall Engineering Internship Program will last four months from the beginning of September till the end of December , and will be organized in-person only in Proctorio Headquarters in Scottsdale, Arizona.

Interns will have an opportunity to use or improve knowledge in technologies or languages as JavaScript, React, NodeJS, Vanilla JS,HTML/CSS,jQuery, C#, Python,Java, Xcode. Also Figma, Grafana, GitHub, Selenium, AzureDevops, Databases, Raspberry Pi.
As a part of the team will work on development of Web applications and browser extensions.

What you can expect from Proctorio during the internship:

  • Mentorship program with Proctorio’s engineering staff
  • Innovative projects to improve Proctorio’s suite of products and services
  • Working on at least 2 software development project during the internship
  • Work in a agile environment with fast feedback
  • Provided lunch during the work days
  • One week paid vacation
  • Single or dual, fully equipped office in newly opened Proctorio Headquarters
  • Accommodation within walking distance from Proctorio office (non AZ locals)
  • One paid round-trip flight ticket from your home (any U.S. state) to Arizona and back (non AZ locals)
  • Earn $25 per hour

Expectations and duties of intern:

  • Enthusiasm and willingness to participate in short-term project development
  • Active engagement during the entirety of the internship program
  • Ability to work with teammates in a highly-collaborative environment
  • Great attitude and problem-solving skills
  • 40-hour work week
  • Punctuality

About Proctorio

Proctorio is a leading remote proctoring provider that ensures exam integrity through secure and scalable means. Staffed by 125+ experts in online education and equipped with thorough bias, privacy, and accessibility training, our team is deeply dedicated to learner success.

We currently serve 1,200+ partner institutions within higher education, K-12, corporate, and federal agencies. Proctorio’s partner retention nears 100% with the vast majority of our contracts renewing for successive growth. We serve 2.5 million active weekly users and have proctored 32.5 million exams worldwide since 2013, 20 million of which were proctored in 2020 alone.

We are currently designing and building a disruptive cloud-based technology with the potential to change the face of higher education and human potential worldwide. Our platform connects to hundreds of thousands of students in 200 countries in real-time and uses the latest AI and ML technologies to ensure that the integrity of test-taking is not compromised.

Proctorio prioritizes data security and test-taker privacy by complying with international, national, and local compliant data security regulations. Proctorio was designed with user accessibility from day one and actively engages leading accessibility experts, conducts third-party software audits and usability testing, and implements feedback from our partner institutions.

Fyusion is a machine learning & computer vision company that enables anyone to capture and display interactive 3D 360 images using their smartphone. Our unique 3D format allows for significant additional functionality that 2D images can’t offer, including: background image effects & automatic damage detection for cars, and an understanding of the human skeleton for tagging products & features in fashion E-commerce. Our investors and customers include large international conglomerates and industry leaders, which puts us in a unique and advantageous position. We have ambitious goals and are looking for new energetic team members to help us reach them together.

The Computer Vision team at Fyusion develops and applies state of the art algorithms in visualization, 3D reconstruction, SLAM, bundle adjustment, state estimation, and sensor fusion. We combine this with the efforts from our Machine Learning team to deliver an intelligent product which is loved by our customers.
We are looking for candidates who are excited about solving complex problems at the intersection of classical 3D geometry and Deep Learning. You will have the resources and opportunities to publish your work at major conferences.

Here are our requirements:

  • Experience with 3D geometry, SLAM, Structure from Motion, bundle adjustment, view synthesis
  • Proficient in C++, OpenCV

Bonus if you have experience with Computer Graphics:

  • NeRF (Representing Scenes as Neural Radiance Fields for View Synthesis)
  • Rendering photorealistic data
  • image based rendering
  • computational geometry

Here's what we can offer you:

Paid company holidays, commuter benefits, company catered lunches, a fully stocked snack pantry, team and company off-sites, but the most exciting: the chance to work on an incredible pioneering technology team that impacts user-facing services.

If you read this and think this is what you want to do, apply! If you read this, and think that you might need some help hitting all of the points, please apply! We have an entire team that is happy to mentor and share their knowledge with you.

Blink Health Pharmacy is a new tech-powered pharmacy revolutionizing the way people access prescription medicine. Our pharmacy is affiliated with Blink Health, which leverages its proprietary technology to provide users with access to low negotiated prices on over 15,000 medications.

Our core mission is to delight our customers and turn them into fans. We understand that in order to do this, we must work closely with pharmacies to ensure prescriptions can be processed quickly and effectively so our customers receive the best experience. You are Blink's champion with the pharmacy. You will field calls to and from pharmacies and prescribers, obtaining prescriptions for Blink’s patients.

We are looking to you to create positive relationships with our pharmacies by assisting them in filling our customers’ medications. This is your opportunity to join a health-tech enterprise. Apply your expertise outside of the retail space in a new and exciting way that offers innovative new services to patients nationwide.

Responsibilities:

  • Field calls from patients, providers and pharmacies across the country
  • Receive, enter, process and fill prescriptions as per Blink protocols.
  • Obtain a fundamental understanding of the Blink Health product for quick pharmacy assistance
  • Resolve open orders through communication with pharmacists and the Blink Health Customer Experience team
  • Perform all tasks in a safe and compliant manner that is consistent with corporate policies as well as State and Federal laws
  • Work collaboratively with the management team and pharmacists
  • Under the direct supervision of a pharmacist, perform tasks such as external pharmacy transfers, internal pharmacy transfers, and internal verbal orders from providers.
  • Other responsibilities as assigned by Pharmacist in Charge

Requirements:

  • Must at least be in Professional Year 2 in an accredited Pharmacy School
  • PA Intern License
  • Strong phone presence in a support/service capacity
  • Strong attention to detail with a high degree of accuracy

  • Strong technical aptitude and ability to learn complex new software

  • On-site in Pittsburgh

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity of all kinds. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

About Us

Our team strives to create the first truly human-first fintech platform that guides you throughout your life. We hope to empower people to actively engage in their financial lives and provide them with the resources they need to succeed financially.

We believe there is a fundamental problem in fintech world today around educating customers on financial services and practices and connecting them to resources that will actually serve them.

Our initial product pairs influencers with industry professionals to provide an interactive and fun way of learning finance for college students.

If you've ever felt lost or overwhelmed about your finances and are excited to join a team whom is actively trying to reduce that anxiety, read on.

With Us You Will:

  • Gain valuable, real-world experience building consumer education product for Gen Z.
  • Work closely with mentors from top tech companies such as Google, Bytedance (TikTok), and Citizen
  • Work across the stack on a variety of different projects, where you will learn mobile, backend, and frontend technologies
  • Opportunity to work hand-in-hand with design and product team with autonomy on what gets built and how
  • Opportunity to work on a video-first based product with influencers such as Chris Paul, Vernon Davis, etc.

What We Look For:

  • Possess excellent communication, sharp analytical abilities with proven design skills, able to think critically of the current system in terms of growth and stability.
  • Strong Computer Science fundamentals. You do not need to have a degree in Computer Science.
  • You can be a good coder in any language (C++, C, Java, Scala, Rust, Haskell, OCaml, Erlang, Python, Ruby, PHP, Node.JS, C# etc.), but willing to work on Dart, Golang, and TypeScript.

Tech Stack:

  • Mobile development is on Flutter framework and utilizes programming language Dart.
  • Our backend is written in Golang.
  • Our web applications is on React framework and utilizes programming language TypeScript.
  • All of our infrastructure is on AWS.

Please submit your resume before May 19th 2021
