position: Looking for a techie for an exciting project
description:
Looking for a friendly, competent, reliable, patient and polite techie who can do the following things flawlessly:

  1. Migrate a small Wordpress site to free hosting. Currently my hosting is not free, and they try to start charging me for php issues. Currently the site is on dated php and when they tried to update it, it doesn’t work. So they left the old php but they want to charge for “support”, and I had enough of it. I asked them to leave the site up as is, with the old php, and I want to move it to a different hosting and close this account. I created the site around 2016.

  2. Knowledge and ability in creating e-book on Kindle. All the written material is finished, need help with the entire process of posting it as a book with free hosting on Kindle. I read some of the Amazon manuals but it’s over my head. Will need help with the entire process, creating the pdf’s, posting them, etc. will have to coordinate this project, work well together. If you have previous experience in creating a professional e-book, it’s an advantage. Will need ISBN number.

If you can do all this, and you are a perfectionist who works for optimal results, please reply by email, tell me about yourself and your experience, and why/how you think that you can accomplish this project. Please don’t send tech terminology as I will not understand it. Just describe your experience, interest and pay expectations in plain English. Please send links to work samples, especially for Kindle projects. Don’t forget to send your name and contact info.

Looking forward to discuss,

Thank you

position: Full Stack Developer Intern - Fall 2021 - Remote - Unpaid
description:
About Software Tools Review:
X2 Analytics is building product intelligence and data-driven analytics to improve business outcomes for customers. The Analytics features offer marketing opportunities, product competitive analysis, sales prospects, and product improvement recommendations based on actual buyer insights.

About the role:
You will work with cutting-edge B2B-facing products where you have the opportunity to work as a full-stack developer. You will have the opportunity to work in web design development, server's communication development, REST-API, SQL stored procedures/functions development, and database schemas design. You will be required to work between 20 to 40 hours per week for at least 3 months.

Key Responsibilities:
You will be assigned to work on one or multiple tasks based on your interest/skills:

  • Develop front-end web application
  • Develop code for communication between the front-end and the back-end server
  • Develop SQL scripts and stored procedures to perform specific tasks
  • Develop data analytics and visualizations report
  • Design database schemas

Qualifications:

  • Currently pursuing a Master degree or higher in Computer Science or Engineering, or a senior level of a Bachelor degree
  • Proficiency with a relational database (MariaDB or MySQL)
  • Knowledge/Experience with Django REST Framework is a plus
  • Experience with Linux commands
  • Problem solving and critical thinking skills
  • Good verbal communication and interpersonal skill

position: Machine Learning / Data Science Intern - Fall 2021 - Remote - UNPAID
description:
About Software Tools Review:
X2 Analytics provides product intelligence and data-driven analytics to improve business outcomes for customers. The Analytics features offer marketing opportunities, product competitive analysis, sales prospects, and product improvement recommendations based on buyers' insights.

About the role:
You will work with cutting-edge B2B-facing products where your ideas have a meaningful impact on the product. The internship has a flexible start date and end date but requires 20-40 hours per week for 3 months. You will be working with a team of software engineers to design, develop, and build a machine learning/deep learning system. The position will allow you to put your academic studies and programming skills to use on a real-world application.

Qualifications:

  • Currently pursuing a Master's degree in Machine Learning, Computer Science, Data Science, Statistics, or related areas.
  • In-depth knowledge in machine learning, data science, and deep learning design as well as open-source development software to build them
  • Excellent programming skills in Python
  • Detail-oriented
  • Strong problem-solving skills
  • Good verbal communication and writing skills

We are looking for interns to mentor for the summer. This position will allow you to apply your Deep Learning and Computer Vision theoretical knowledge (which you gained by doing online courses or at your university) to build state-of-the-art models and deploy them in real world applications

Interns should have the following skills

  1. Python
  2. Numpy, Scipy, matplotlib, jupyter, scikit-learn
  3. Any Deep Learning Frameworks - Keras, Tensorflow, Pytorch (Keras and Tensorflow preferred)
  4. Supervised Learning - Linear Regression, Logistic Regression, KNN, SVM, Decision Trees, Random Forests, Gradient Boosting, Naive Bayes
  5. Unsupervised - K-Means, MoG/GMM, EM
  6. Fundamentals like - loss, cost, accuracy, Gradient Descent, Linear Algebra, Batching, variance, bias, regularization, Hyperparameter tuning, Dimension Reduction (PCA, NMF)
  7. Version Control (Git) and Linux/Unix
  8. Projects in Computer Vision, NLP or Speech
  9. Docker and Kubernetes experience is a plus
  10. Experience Deploying models on cloud and/or Edge Devices is a plus

This mentorship program will have two rounds of interviews.

  1. Preliminary Round
  2. Train a model from the list below and upload it on our platform www.aivis.ai along with it's code on Github.
  3. Inform us in the chat that you have uploaded a model.
  4. Once you pass the first round you will have a final video interview.

Project List for Preliminary Round.

  1. Face Recognition
  2. Gesture Recognition
  3. Pose Estimation
  4. Counting Number of people in a frame
  5. Pedestrian Detection
  6. Age and Gender Recognition
  7. Object Tracking
  8. Counting All Vehicles in a Video Stream
  9. Emotion Recognition through Facial Expressions
  10. Tumor Segmentation
  11. Object Detection in one of the follwoing a) Open World b) Indoor c) Road d) Aerial Images
  12. Action Recognition
  13. Group Activity Recognition
  14. You can also upload your own model but it should be related to Computer Vision and should be a little challenging,

Please note that this is an unpaid position.

Job Position: Front-end developer.

Reports to: Emily Hery https://www.linkedin.com/in/emily-hery/, Munchkin Labs CDO

Purpose: Design, build, test, and improve a mobile application interface for a social media platform.

Key Responsibilities:

Have an in-depth understanding of what our users need.
Speak with users frequently to update this understanding.
Create rapid UI mockups of features and concepts.
Build production-ready versions of a wide array of UI elements.
Represent the end user during internal discussions in all aspects of the business, not just software.
Have an up-to-date understanding of current cybersecurity best practices.
Write and maintain documentation.

At Viridian Exchange, we are looking to attract passionate, talented interns to help us build out our decentralized application on the Ethereum blockchain.

As a blockchain development intern, you will be responsible for the following:

  • Assisting co-founders in building our proprietary exchange smart contracts
  • Researching prior solutions and creating flow diagrams to display possible solution logic
  • Brainstorming with the team to solve critical code logic and find the most efficient solutions
  • Thoroughly documenting / testing smart contract code

Desired Skills:

  • Solidity (or other blockchain dev experience)
  • Truffle / Ganache
  • AWS
  • GitHub Workflow
  • ReactJS and NodeJS proficiency
  • Excellent communication, teamwork, and organization abilities

Bonus:
-Passionate about trading cards, collectibles, or NFTs
-Knowledge of the pokemon / sports cards market

This is an UNPAID, part-time 8-10 week internship, must be located in the US to apply (preferably on EST).

Company

Terra Cover’s mission is to build solutions that help manage and mitigate the ever-growing water-related challenges for businesses and government agencies. We use satellite images together with advanced AI techniques to track changes in water availability across the globe. With support from the NSF (National Science Foundation), we are building a geospatial platform to monitor global water resources that will be used by Terra Cover partners.

Role: Applied Machine Learning Intern

We are looking for an applied machine learning scientist to work on our water monitoring platform. You will work with the lead machine learning scientist to develop novel physics-guided machine learning techniques to integrate satellite images from multiple sources to monitor water resources at high spatial resolution and temporal frequency. The platform will also use advanced uncertainty quantification techniques to integrate sparse ground observations with our satellite-derived observations effectively.

Impact

This opportunity will provide invaluable experience in working with petabytes of data on cloud infrastructure in a fast-paced environment of a startup company. Building solutions to socially and environmentally relevant problems requires close collaboration with the stakeholders. This opportunity will provide hands-on experience in communicating the science to stakeholders with diverse backgrounds.

Desirable Candidates

  • Graduate degree or pursuing a degree in computer science or data science.
  • Experience developing/implementing complex machine learning models on large datasets (knowledge of uncertainty quantification methods is a plus!).
  • Coding proficiency in Python.
  • Experience in working with satellite imagery and cloud infrastructure is preferred but not required.
  • Willing to work at the intersection of multiple disciplines with little guidance to solve complex problems from scratch and quickly learn new methods when needed to fill the knowledge gap.
  • Passion for seeing research through from initial conceptualization to final application.

Responsibilities

  • Lead the development of Bayesian deep learning and multi-source data fusion models to combine multiple sources and incorporate uncertainty quantification within our water monitoring platform.
  • Work closely with industry stakeholders to develop case studies and translate scientific research into operational products.
  • Build effective strategies to evaluate model performance in different geographies and improve the robustness of the underlying machine learning techniques.
  • Manage the processing pipeline to extract imagery data into machine learning compatible format.

Location

This role is remote, but candidates based in Denver, CO, or Minneapolis, MN, are preferred.

Duration: 3 months - 6 months

Benefits:

Competitive package in a disruptive startup
Health/Dental Insurance

Note: Visa sponsorship is not available for this position. Successful candidates must be authorized to work in the United States.

As a software engineer intern, you will partner with other engineers and designers to build out the first product for our customers.

You will own development end-to-end—taking ideas from customers, scoping, building, testing, shipping to production, getting feedback, and iterating.

Our stack: Python / Flask, TypeScript / React, PostgreSQL, Google Cloud

Qualifications

  • Prior software engineering internship experience. Bonus if you've worked in small teams
  • Currently pursuing a Computer Science or related degree and plan to graduate within the next 1-2 years
  • Understanding (or interest in learning) basic financial concepts as applied to small-medium businesses

What we offer

Chance to join the founding team of a well-funded startup chasing a huge opportunity. We offer:

  • Competitive salary
  • Equity once full-time
  • Great location: We're located in Chelsea NYC, a short walking distance from the A/C/E/L trains. If you're remote, we'll support you with a co-working space or work-from-home setup stipend
  • We're still small—help us figure out what benefits are most useful for you

Note: When you apply, please indicate your availability.

We looking for voluteers all over the world who can help us build our platform. We're a nonprofit that is focused on helping indigent college students in Africa raise tuition.

We're looking for fullstack developers with MERN Skills, or PHP and any Javascript framework for frontend technology.

We've our UI/UX ready.

We would be excited if you chose to join us!.

Full Stack Developer / Software Engineer (C# .Net Core Angular.js, HTML). Pioneering software house is seeking a skilled. Full Stack Developer to join their highly collaborative, growing team, develop their skills and make an impact.

The company is aleading provider of fleet and logistics management. Currently, they are building an IoT application for their fleet management and predictive maintenance.

As a Full Stack Developer you'll play a critical role in upholding the company's daily operation; showcasing your technical skills through designing and developing the internal web-based system. You'll work across the full stack using a range of Microsoft web technologies including C#, .NET Core, Angluar.js and JavaScript, producing clean, scalable code, integrating backend data and designing functional, user-friendly UIs and web layouts using HTML and CSS.

Requirements:
*You have solid C# .Net development skills
*You have solid .NET Core and Angular JS skills
*You have experience with Microsoft Web technologies (ASP.Net, MVC, WebAPI)
*You have good knowledge of JavaScript, HTML, CSS
*You have experience with SQL
*You're a positive team player, keen to work collaboratively and share ideas

If you're interested in this Full Stack Developer (C# .Net Core Angular.js, HTML) role, apply now or get in touch today for a confidential discussion.

Mandelbulb Technologies seeks a Data Engineer Intern for the Data Analytics department.

We are looking for passionate and curious professionals to help level up data and analytics team. Like us, you love data driven analytics, and love to extract insights out of the data. We look for those whose curiosity drives them to try new things, aren’t afraid to fail, and continuously learn.

The Data challenges at Mandelbulb are extensive and you can expect to level up in all data domains. This includes software engineering, cloud-based systems, truly BIG data engineering and analytics.

The Daily

  • Be part of the enterprise data platform process, helping teams design and implement analytic-based features.
  • Learn the internals of building a robust end-to-end data pipeline on all levels especially in databases, data modelling, data processing infrastructure and software development.
  • Contribute code to production data systems and gain strong software engineering practice.
  • Gain hands-on experience in distributed data processing technologies: Apache Spark, Hive, Kafka, Azure Data Services
  • Learn techniques for high volume distributed data processing and storages.
  • Ensure the integrity, availability, and confidentiality of data, database systems and supporting services.

The Essentials

  • You have a drive to learn, ask questions and motivation to find the answers.
  • You are familiar with one or more of these technologies: Python, SQL, Go
  • You are comfortable with DevOps cloud tools (Azure/AWS) and have some working knowledge of monitoring tools
  • You have side projects or viewable public code on Github, Bitbucket, etc.
  • You are currently pursuing a BS or MS in Computer Science, Engineering, or related technical discipline, with an expected graduation date of 2021 or 2022

Bonus Skills

  • You are well-versed in object-oriented programming (OOP)
  • You have some experience with Hadoop/Spark or other data engineering or database software
  • You have side projects or viewable public code on Github, Bitbucket, etc.
  • You have some experience with cloud PaaS

The ideal candidate is an experienced engineer who is comfortable in both large and small environments. Someone who understands leadership and organizational philosophy and most importantly is still hungry to build companies. So far it's been a fun idea and we're optimistic about success across multiple areas.

Benefits of working with us:
• Enhance your skillset and knowledge
• Opportunity to learn about many different verticals
• Feel empowered and change things - We value ideas and suggestions
• Work in an inclusive culture where transparency, creativity, accountability and ownership are encouraged
• Freedom to take out-of-the-box approach
• Support and resources to grow into a senior management position
• Flat Organization structure
• Exposure to startup challenges

Roles and Responsibilities

• Build machine learning and artificial intelligence (ML/AI) models to help achieve company goals.
• Assess feasibility of using specific ML/AI models and approaches to solve specific goals.
• Utilize large amounts of data to study and develop efficient, performant, and scalable ML/AI models.
• Experiment with large datasets to reveal useful and interesting trends that can be applied to specific solutions
• Work with the larger development team to create MVP and Enterprise level products based on ML/AI.

Who you Are

• Successfully brought machine projects from concept to delivery before (e.g., Kaggle competitions, internships, other projects)
• Strong theoretical and practical understanding of common machine learning algorithms (gradient boosting, random forest, neural networks, etc.)
• Proficient in Python and relevant data science and machine learning libraries (numpy, pandas, scikit-learn, etc.)
• Some experience writing Python code in a production environment
• You are innovative, self-driven, and enjoy going the extra mile to reach success

Skills

• Experience with NLP
• Experience with Tensorflow and/or Keras
• Experience with PySpark
• Experience with AWS or other cloud providers

description:
Fresh Sip is currently looking for a driven Shopify/Marketplace Developer Intern who has an interest in working with brands in the Food & Beverage industry.

About A Fresh Sip:
We are trailblazers setting the stage for the growing new trend in the beverage industry -- making drinking culture inclusive. We are building a marketplace for the "low" and "no" alcohol beverage vertical as thousands of new beverages continue to enter the market. This is an opportunity to get in at the ground level of emerging wave and demand of niche marketplaces and the quickly expanding nonalcohlic beverage vertical.

We are a team of ex-tech entrepreneurs, consultants, TEDx and global speakers, and brand experts who had to cut back on drinking alcohol for health reasons over the last decade. As former startup founders and tech entrepreneurs we saw the trends highlighting an uptick in zero-proof and low ABV beverages and decided to build a platform & community highlighting this growing space.

You will be working very closely with and be mentored by the founding team.

Internship Objectives:

  • Support the build of our beverage data filteration system
  • Support the expansion and maintenance of our shopify store
  • Support the planning and development of our new marketplace
  • Work with our team to develop new strategic initiatives
  • Support product efforts

Requirements:

  • Current student or recent graduate with a background in a related subject area (engineering, data science, business, computer science, STEM)
  • Ability to write high quality code
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • An ability to work on multiple projects and tasks at the same time
  • Working knowledge of development best practices and experience working in a team
  • Ability to explore complex problems spaces objectively from multiple points of view
  • Experience in HTML5, CSS3 and JavaScript/ECMA
  • A strong knowledge of Shopify platform
  • Knowledge of shopify liquid templating language
  • Experience working with / building e-commerce stores and marketplaces
  • Basic knowledge with Shopify theme development and customization
  • The ability to always seek the simplest and most elegant solution to often complex problems
  • Drive to continously build on shopify knowledge and stay up to date on trends
  • A strong understanding of responsive web design techniques

Bonus

  • Specific knowledge of Java, Python, Ember.js and/or JavaScript are a plus
  • Specific experience in or knowledge of data systems is a plus
  • Deep knowledge of Liquid and previous shopify development is a plus
  • A practical understanding of out of the box marketplace solutions like marketcube.io, sharetribe, multi-vendor marketplace on shopify is a BIG plus
  • Experience working with different Shopify JS APIs (storefront, AJAX Cart, Sections etc) is a plus

A Fresh Sip is currently looking for a driven Front End Developer Intern who has an interest in working with brands in the Food & Beverage industry.

About A Fresh Sip:
Our mission is to make drinking culture more inclusive. We aim to make navigating the "low" and "no" alcohol beverage space easy without compromising fun, sophistication or experience. We are an early staged startup but we already have deep relationships with dozens of reknown beverage brands, restaurants, bars and mixologists.

We are a team of ex-tech entrepreneurs, consultants, TEDx & global speakers, and brand experts who had to cut back on drinking alcohol for health reasons over the last decade. As former startup founders and tech entrepreneurs we saw the trends highlighting an uptick in zero-proof and low ABV beverages and decided to build a platform & community highlighting this growing space.

You will be working very closely with and be mentored by the founding team.

Internship Objectives:

  • Support the build of our beverage data filteration system
  • Support the development of our new custom platform
  • Work with our team to develop new strategic initiatives
  • Support product efforts

Requirements:

  • Current student or recent graduate with a background in a related subject area (engineering, data science, business, computer science, STEM)
  • Ability to write high quality code
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Working knowledge of development best practices and experience working in a team
  • Ability to explore complex problems spaces objectively from multiple points of view
  • General familiarity with some of the following: HTTP, REST and web API best practices Modern JavaScript and/or Ember.js SQL, relational databases and key-value stores

Bonus

  • Specific knowledge of Java, Python, Ember.js and/or JavaScript are a plus
  • Specific experience in or knowledge of data systems is a plus
  • Familiarity with Shopify and Wix integrations is a plus

MedAtlas is growing its team and looking for a Software developer keen on:

  • Assisting with all aspects of software design and coding.
  • Attending and contributing to company development meetings.
  • Writing and maintaining code.
  • Analyze and test programs before formal launch.
  • Writing reports.

Additional skills:

  • Digital health experience
  • Knowledge of African market

EasyTry is a disruptive product for eCommerce that enables a virtual try-on experience in online shopping. Founded in 2020 we are rapidly growing and building AI-driven products in eCommerce, FashionTech, and MarTech fields.

Key facts +10'000 virtual try-on │ 👤 +5000 users│ 💪 15 adventurers in our team
🏆 Rewards: RB Young Awards, Top 3 Retail Startups IDRF
📍 We are the remote first team with HQ in the US and R&D center in Russia

The opportunity
Join our exciting R&D AR team to take part in experiments, fun projects and focus on building viral projects. The main software we will use is Lens Studio by SNAP.

Mandatory:

  • Javascript
  • Experience with several kinds of filters in Lens Studio (Games, Make-up, Try-on...)
  • Fluent in English or Russian

Additional:

  • ML Knowledge
  • Shaders Knowledge
  • Experience with software like Unity, 8thWall, Arcore...
  • Assets Creation (3d modeling, Textures)

What you get:

  • Great experience in Startup's R&D
  • Learn about products in AR, FashionTech, and eCommerce
  • Create several crazy projects for portfolio
  • After internship, you have a chance to get a full-time R&D job

We are looking to hire a talented Data Scientist to help build a product recommendation system for our online beauty site. This recommendation system will be used to match customers to products that match their specific skincare, haircare, wellness needs, and beauty preferences.
Selected intern's day-to-day responsibilities include teaching coding in programming languages scratch/JavaScript/Python to US kids in the age group 8-15.
Supporting development and maintenance for our Website Zencca.com. Zencca is one of the first ever Cannabis discovery engines.

Responsibilities
You will be designing a ecommerce web applicaiton to present data of purchases, products. You will be working on the backend as well as the front end of the application.

Requirements
Proven experience as a Full Stack Developer or similar role
Familiarity with common stacks
Knowledge of multiple front-end languages and libraries (e.g. HTML/ CSS, JavaScript, XML, jQuery)
Knowledge of multiple back-end languages (e.g. Java Python) and JavaScript frameworks (e.g. Angular, React, Node.js)
Familiarity with databases (e.g. MySQL, MongoDB), web servers (e.g. Apache) and UI/UX design

position: DevOps Developer - Part Time Volunteer Intern
description:
Who We Are

iContribute is a volunteer platform that connects students to local volunteer opportunities. Our mission is to foster community involvement amongst youth through a centralized app. We have already onboarded some of Ottawa's largest non-profit organizations such as the Ottawa Food Bank and the Ottawa Salvation Army, and there are many more yet to come!

As part of a startup environment, you will be working very closely with multiple different aspects of the team such as project management, design, and marketing. Lastly, despite things going virtual, at iContribute we still strive to offer a place to relax and bond together by offering optional board game nights and team socials if you ever need to relax!

Required

Please contact us at icontribute.recruiting@gmail.com and include a copy of your CV, a few sentences as to why you want to work at iContribute, and any relevant project or Github links.

Role Description

  • Strategize, develop and implement a plan to enhance and automate the current iContribute development flow
  • Identify improvements that can be made to our workflow
  • Select and kickstart the best DevOps tools to help optimize our processes in the context of Mobile and/ or Web development
  • Contribute to the design, development and evolution of our platform

Minimum Qualifications

  • Currently enrolled in a Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Computer Engineering, or a related technical field
  • Available to work from September 2021 to December 2021 part-time (10 - 15 hours)
  • Experience in one or more areas of Computer Science, such as Introduction to Software Engineering, Object Oriented Programming, etc.
  • Familiarity with DevOps pipelines
  • Ability to handle multiple tasks simultaneously in a fast paced environment with minimal supervision
  • Critical thinking and problem solving skills
  • Strong communication skills

Preferred Qualifications

  • Relevant side projects, portfolio, work experiences, or previous software internships
  • Experience with Git/ GitHub, build tools (ex. Maven, Make, or Gradle), CI/Build Servers (ex. Jenkins or Bamboo), Issue Tracking (Jira or Confluence), as well as Scripting Languages such as Bash, PowerShell or Python
  • Experience with Containerization software such as Docker or Kubernetes
  • Proficiency using Configuration Management or Orchestration tools such as Puppet, Chef or Ansible
  • Knowledge in testing frameworks such as Jest, Enzyme, Mocha, Jasmine, etc. General interest in entrepreneurship

About Lunchclub

At Lunchclub we're helping people relevantly grow their professional network. We use AI to scale data-driven matches to thousands of people weekly, small groups of like-minded individuals, and panels with some of the world's best. We've introduced people who have started companies together, received/given mentorship, received funding, made their next hire, or friend. We're a small, tight-knit, but distributed team, powering connections in and between 57 cities across 6 continents.

About engineering at Lunchclub

We're a small team of generalist software engineers driving big outcomes with a lot of shared responsibility. We often work outside the traditional Fullstack/Backend/Frontend mould to create, fix, and improve Lunchclub for our users and fellow engineers. Our engineers also actively take part in discussions on product, design, user interviews, and more. The fastest way to learn technology is to build things at an early stage startup — we expect you to grow a lot as an engineer during your time here.

About the role

As a software engineer intern at Lunchclub you'll...

Build features from start to finish. Start with research or an idea, work with design to draft up a spec, build, launch, and polish.
Improve and iterate on existing features through A/B testing, user, or team feedback.
Build and improve existing internal tools, helping us maintain our team's high impact on our growing community.
Play an active role in the shaping of the future of the product and business.

This role could be for you if...

You love problem solving — especially with code.
You're looking to grow quickly as an engineer and do not fear ownership, even at an early stage of your career.
You know how to balance building quickly with building well.

Bonus: You're adept with Javascript/React, Python/Flask, MySQL, Docker.

Benefits

Flexible vacation time.
Hybrid remote/office work culture.

Lunchclub is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know.

Learn more about us here: https://techcrunch.com/2019/09/18/lunchclub-raises-4m-from-a16z-for-its-ai-warm-intro-service.

We are looking for passionate, motivated software engineering interns who are excited to build their experience as they develop tools to power the next generation of cloud applications. We are hiring for a variety of roles, including:

  • Distributed systems
  • Machine learning
  • Frontend
  • Observability
  • Production serving
  • Ecosystem
  • C++
  • Reinforcement Learning

About Anyscale:
Anyscale provides an application development platform for developers to build distributed applications. We’re commercializing a popular open source project called Ray, which is a framework for distributed computing as well as an ecosystem of libraries for scalable machine learning. Our goal is to build a standardized platform for distributed computing. Ray was developed at UC Berkeley by Robert Nishihara and Philipp Moritz, under the guidance of Ion Stoica and Michael Jordan, and the four of them have co-founded Anyscale. The company raised a $20.6M Series A and a $40M Series B funding from Andreessen Horowitz (a16z), NEA, Foundation Capital, Intel Capital, Ant Financial, Amplify Partners, 11.2 Capital, and The House Fund.

With Ray, we're making it easy to program at any scale (from your laptop to the datacenter) by providing easy-to-use, general-purpose, and high-performance tools. In addition, we are building a rich ecosystem of libraries (for reinforcement learning, hyperparameter search, experiment management, machine learning training, prediction serving, and more) on top of the core distributed system so that users can rapidly build sophisticated applications. Help us build the future of software development.

As part of this role, you will:

  • Develop high quality software to empower software developers and simplify programming
  • Work with a team of leading distributed systems and machine learning experts
  • Communicate your work to a broader audience through talks, tutorials, and blog posts
  • Help us to build and shape a world class company

We'd love to hear from you if you:

  • Are passionate about machine learning and distributed systems
  • Are interested in working at a startup and making an impact
  • Have relevant software engineering internship experiences at tech companies
  • Have side projects that showcase their passion for programming outside of the classroom setting
  • Are a at least a rising junior

About Anyscale:
Anyscale provides an application development platform for developers to build distributed applications. We’re commercializing a popular open source project called Ray, which is a framework for distributed computing as well as an ecosystem of libraries for scalable machine learning. Our goal is to build a standardized platform for distributed computing. Ray was developed at UC Berkeley by Robert Nishihara and Philipp Moritz, under the guidance of Ion Stoica and Michael Jordan, and the four of them have co-founded Anyscale. The company raised a $20.6M Series A and a $40M Series B funding from Andreessen Horowitz (a16z), NEA, Foundation Capital, Intel Capital, Ant Financial, Amplify Partners, 11.2 Capital, and The House Fund.

With Ray, we're making it easy to program at any scale (from your laptop to the datacenter) by providing easy-to-use, general-purpose, and high-performance tools. In addition, we are building a rich ecosystem of libraries (for reinforcement learning, hyperparameter search, experiment management, machine learning training, prediction serving, and more) on top of the core distributed system so that users can rapidly build sophisticated applications. Help us build the future of software development.

position: Financial Engineering and Data Science Intern

location.city: Los Angeles • Santa Monica • Los Angeles County

description:
Our new startup, Pace It, is focused on helping retirees convert their hard-earned assets into lifelong paychecks. Millions of baby-boomers are retiring and are facing a tough problem of enjoying their retirement without running out of money. Our digital platform tailors a personalized drawdown strategy for them and assists them to stick by it. By addressing the unique financial circumstances of retirees, PaceIt is poised to become the one-stop solution for all the boomers’ financial needs.

We are four founders with many years of combined experience in the retirement space. We have been helping individuals accumulate for retirement and have realized that there is no good solution to guide them through withdrawals once those individuals retire. We are leveraging our experience and wide network with retirement plan providers and record keepers to distribute our solution. We have already signed a major 401(k) record keeper as our launch partner. We are now focused on building our core team towards a launch of our MVP in 2021. The company is well funded to achieve that goal.

We’re currently looking for a phenomenal financial engineer with data science capabilities for an unpaid internship starting on June 21, 2021. The internship will allow you to grow and to take part in a multi-disciplinary development effort. Two of the founders are UCLA professors with many years of experience coaching graduate students.

Example of the tasks that you might be asked to complete:
• Develop Monte Carlo simulations for modeling retirement portfolios.
• Use machine learning algorithms to improve portfolio modeling.
• Analyze transaction data and develop algorithms for tracking individuals spending versus their budgets.
• Develop machine learning algorithm to predict life expectancy and spending patterns of retirees.

Requirements:
• Previous work in a start-up and/or hi-tech environment is a plus.
• Experience modeling investment risk and return using Monte Carlo simulations.
• Experience using statistical computer languages (mostly Python) to manipulate data and draw insights from large data sets.
• Knowledge of a variety of machine learning techniques (clustering, tree-based techniques, artificial neural networks, etc.) and their real-world advantages/drawbacks. Familiarity with Tensor flow and Keras is a plus.
• Knowledge of advanced statistical techniques and concepts (regression, properties of distributions, statistical tests and proper usage, etc.) and experience with applications.
• A drive to learn and master new technologies and techniques.
• Previous experience with cloud technology (AWS in particular) is an advantage.

This is a rare opportunity to take part in a high-growth venture at an early stage and help build a company with an important mission. If you want to do good and do well, help us create a needed financial solution for the many baby boomers retiring every day.

1) Will learn the basic knowledge of designing an overall architecture of the web application.
2) Learn to maintain quality of any applications.
3) Learn how to design and launch new features.
4) Will be Introduced to frameworks such as AngularJS, KnockoutJS, BackboneJS, ReactJS.
5) Learn to work in teams

Pre-Requisites:

1) Basic know-how of programming languages like Java, JavaScript, HTML, CSS.
2) Basic Knowledge of code versioning tools (GIT, AWS).

Please note, this role will be virtual for Summer 2021. All interested candidates are encouraged to apply!
We're looking for an engineering intern with a computer vision and/or graphics focus. Aspyre is an equal opportunity employer. We welcome candidates from all backgrounds.

About the Role

As an intern at Sigma you will learn:

  • Opportunities to interact with Sigma leaders, build your network, and learn about the business.

What’s next:

To get started, submit your application through our job posting. We review the resumes quickly that we receive but sometimes there are a lot of applications so please be sure that the relevant information on your resume stands out.

Every interview process might be a slightly different but generally you can expect the process to look like this:

  • Interview to debrief on the take-home challenge

Invitae is dedicated to bringing comprehensive genetic information into mainstream medicine to improve healthcare for billions of people. Our team is driven to make a difference for the patients we serve. We are leading the transformation of the genetics industry by making genetic testing affordable and accessible for everyone to guide health decisions across all stages of life.

POSITION SUMMARY

The Site Reliability Engineer internship position is responsible for a variety of process and infrastructure initiatives, including platform maintenance and enhancements for our flagship cloud-based genomics product, automating existing pipelines to improve efficiency and long-term ecosystem health, performing software updates across our AWS platform, and ensuring that managed assets are performing as expected through the use of telemetry, automated alerts, and self-healing infrastructure.

RESPONSIBILITIES

As an intern, your job duties may involve some or many of the below duties:

  • Ensure that the infrastructure supporting our genomics platform is highly available, scalable, and maintainable
  • Maintain and extend existing configuration management deployments
  • Perform software installations using existing infrastructure and configuration management tools
  • Collaborate with the Cloud Operations team to migrate existing deployment tools into a fully automated and managed process
  • Collaborate with DevOps team to extend and enhance existing CI/CD pipelines
  • Work directly with the DevOps team and software engineers to ensure system integrity
  • Monitor metrics and develop ways to improve telemetry gathering, reporting, and alerting
  • Follow all best practices and procedures as established by company
  • Review, understanding, and compliance with Invitae HIPAA Security policies and procedures
  • Safeguarding the privacy and security of protected health information and European Union personal data
  • Processing and handling of European Union personal data only as directed by Invitae for purposes of personalized molecular pathology

EXPERIENCE

As an intern, you should be familiar with many of the items below, though it is also expected that many of these skills would be developed while serving in this position:

  • Current student in computer science or related field, or equivalent working experience
  • 3 years in an SRE/DevOps role, or related IT or operations field
  • Familiar with Linux and Bash
  • Familiar with configuration management tools (e.g. Salt, Ansible, Chef, Puppet)
  • Familiar with AWS tools and infrastructure (EC2, S3, IAM, ECS, Lambda, and CloudWatch)
  • Familiar with CI/CD tools (e.g. Jenkins), and scripting languages (Python strongly preferred)
  • Familiar with IAC tools such as Terraform (preferred)
  • Familiar with containerized systems in a cloud environment
  • Familiar with Scrum and Agile development methodologies
  • Good interpersonal skills and communication with all levels of management

KEY ATTRIBUTES

  • Drive and determination
  • Ability to work in a fast paced and dynamic environment
  • Ability to participate with others as a member of the team to ensure that demanding and difficult projects are handled smoothly and cooperatively to enhance the success of the projects and maintain strong relationships within all parts of the company
  • Strong communication and presentation skills
  • Self-starter
  • Driven to perform
  • Able to organize, prioritize, and delegate tasks to efficiently move projects forward

EDUCATION

  • Current student in computer science or related field, or equivalent working experience

At Invitae, we value diversity and provide equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.

About Us:
At Sybill, we are building a video call mind-reading partner for salespeople. Sybill joins your calls with you and provides insights on your participants’ reactions during various call segments/topics. Imagine demoing the product to your clients and knowing exactly what excited them, what confuses them, and who might be interested in buying. We’re a venture-backed, early-stage enterprise SaaS startup, and our entire team comes out of Stanford, MIT, IITs, and various enterprise SaaS companies.

Role
We are building the world’s pioneering emotional intelligence platform for video calls, and the role involves learning and working with semi-structured, and multi-modal data of video, audio and text.
We bring out rare and highly useful insights about video call participants using our proprietary Machine Learning technology models, which you would be contributing towards.

Requirements

  • Passion for building robust end-to-end data engineering pipelines for real-time systems at scale.
  • Ability to think analytically about data-driven problems and reason among various solutions
  • Proficiency in data science and machine learning using Python

Benefits

  • Join a fast-growing startup and help create your personal J.A.R.V.I.S. assistant
  • Work on some of the most challenging and rewarding AI problems of our generation
  • Get out of the home and enjoy the in-person work environment
  • High-end Apple equipment for work as well food on the house

Since 2008, Simulmedia’s mission has been to make TV and video work better for advertisers. Our demand-side TV buying platform generates more wins for advertisers across linear TV, streaming, and gaming. We leverage TV’s unparalleled reach and the power of data to help brands, networks, and agencies find audiences most likely to take notice, tune in, and transact. Our goal is to empower both performance and brand marketers to take direct control of their TV buying and drive greater business impact with every ad dollar spent. We’re already helping hundreds of brands like Experian, 1-800-Flowers, Dollar Shave Club, HBO Max, Michaels, and MassMutual grow their reach, awareness, and conversions.

As an Analytics Intern at Simulmedia, you will face complex technical challenges that relate to the television advertising industry. You will be mining complex datasets to provide useful insights to various stakeholders such as account managers and the product team. You will be engaged in supporting ad-hoc client requests related to the launch, management, and optimization of advertising campaigns. Some of these requests will eventually turn into larger, productionable projects in which you will work with the rest of the Science and Engineering teams.

The Analytics Intern will, at times, be engaged in the information discovery phase to gather requirements and client requests. The ideal candidate is eager to work with Data Scientists and Account Managers and has data mining and data analysis capabilities focusing on SQL and Python, business acumen and strong analytical skills. Additionally, you will write complex queries delivering insights and reports to clients and deliver ad hoc data analyses that provide strategic insights to clients.

Skills & Experience

  • Proficiency in both Python and SQL and can transform data into an appropriate shape to use for modeling
  • Experience with quantitative challenges involving real world data and are comfortable building efficient code to share while learning new technologies
  • A keen analytical mind with the ability to understand business problems communicated by an Account Manager and distill complex information into understandable insights with actionable recommendations

The Simulmedia Experience
We take tremendous pride in maintaining a high bar for employees and fostering a strong team environment. While we work hard every day, we also believe in relaxing together with lots of team activities. We have an unlimited vacation policy, tuition reimbursement, and no employee financial contribution for medical, dental, and vision benefits. We offer competitive salaries, stock options, and an annual bonus based on performance. And last but not least, we provide a free Citibike membership to all employees!

Company Vision
To be the first place advertisers go to find and scale their high-value audiences and elevate the accountability and performance of their TV and video advertising.

Our Core Values
Help Others Win
Focus on the Right Things
Show, Don’t Tell
Be Inclusive
Make an Impact
Strive to Be Greater

position: VR For Good - VR development internship
description:
Interested in Virtual Reality (VR), VR Gaming and Games For Change? We are looking for you!
BardoVR’s “AfterDeath” is an interactive, game-based VR simulation of the Tibetan Book of the Dead, which describes the journey consciousness takes from the moment of death until its rebirth in another form. Using mindful, meditation-based techniques (calm focus, equanimity, compassion) - “players” access increasingly higher realms within the game-simulation, as they simultaneously deepen their mindfulness/meditation practice.

We are an early stage startup with lots of hats to wear.

  • VR programmer Intern: Intern able to code/program in Unity/Unreal Engine for additions/revisions to our existing AfterDeath VR demo. LA-based if possible.

  • We are looking for candidates that are interested in Transformative Technology, Virtual Reality (VR), Fractal Generation, game design/development, health and wellbeing, data analytics/big data, games for change, positive psychology, neuroscience, Buddhism, psychedelics, or growth hacking.

What will you get working with BardoVR?

  • Opportunity: Experience working with emerging VR and VR gaming technologies.
  • Visionary Product: Be part of the team that is building an awe-inspiring gamified tool that changes lives.
  • Access: BardoVR is working with a visionary group of transformative technology thinkers, innovators, entrepreneurs, and artists who want to change the world.
  • Training: Opportunity to work on a diverse range of projects (VR, data analytics, product development, biz development, and social media/marketing).
  • References/Recommendation

A few things to know about this position:

  • Equity compensation based on performance and long term role at BardoVR available.
  • Requires a minimum ~15-30 hrs per week (depending on role and responsibilities).
  • Requires a minimum commitment of 1-2 months (longer commitments - a plus!).

Please include your resume, and tell us what makes you unique! If you do not hear from us, please be patient – we are growing rapidly. More info @ https://www.bardovr.com/. Contact tom@bardovr.com for more info and/or with any questions!

Thanks.

Tom Seidman
Founder-CEO

BardoVR team:
Tom Seidman - Writer/Director. Dartmouth College, American Film Institute (Directing Fellow). DGA Assistant Director for Robert Redford, Clint Eastwood, Peter Weir. Independent filmmaker. Meditiator/student of Buddhism for over 25 yrs.

You ideally have an interest in Smart Cities, urban agriculture, GIS mapping and networked systems. You’re quick to consider the best approach for difficult development problems and are always looking to improve your craft. Full-stack mobile development, familiar with Node.js and one or more data management system (MongoDB, PostGres, MySQL)

position: Internship for 3D Avatar and Costume Creation - NO prior experience is required
description:
Anifie, a virtual concert app, is looking for an unpaid intern to create 3D avatars and costumes. In this role, you will be mentored and trained to learn how to create beautiful avatars rapidly -- over 10X faster than the industry standard while maintaining quality. While it is an unpaid internship, you will directly interact with seasoned business executives and some of the top creators, including a Grammy Award winning producer, in the world. You might also interact with AI engineers. Your avatars will be likely used in shows of some of the top artists. You will learn new 3D technologies. You will learn how it feels to work in a rapidly growing VC-backed startup.

No prior experience is required.

The Role
You will be a crucial member of the core team, from building back-end infrastructure to user-facing applications — and everything in between. You will build features across the platform from user-facing web applications, workflow systems, data modeling engines, and integrations with disparate third party systems. You will help establish technical strategy and direction and will also support growing and developing a world-class engineering team. There are so many important problems to solve that directly impact the lives of the 10,000 Americans entering retirement every day.

We're looking for a software engineer intern to support our core team. As an early team member, you will have broad impact over the technology, the product, and our company's culture.

What you'll need to be successful

  • Passion and excitement for the cause: to re-define how Americans age and transition into their third chapter.
  • Deep software engineering background and proven ability to ship world-class software products.
  • Familiarity with data structures, storage systems, and front-end frameworks. Proficiency with programming languages such as Java, React, JavaScript, TypeScript or similar languages.
  • Proven ability to drive product and engineering strategy.
  • Comfort with ambiguity. While starting from a blank slate is challenging, you find it exciting, rewarding, and empowering. You are able to build products from the ground up.
  • Obsession with end-user experience.
  • Low ego.
  • First-principles thinker: we don't care how others have done things.
  • Ability to define projects and execute. Excited to set goals and be held accountable for hitting those goals.
  • Superlative positional empathy with a strong understanding of how technical decisions impact the user of what you’re building.
  • Skill and comfort working in a rapidly changing environment with dynamic objectives and iteration with users.

Job Description Summary

You will research and develop innovative ML strategies for challenging problems that will affect future Globalbluex products. You will collaborate with broader teams across Globalbluex to transfer AI/ML solutions. You will have opportunities to provide technical mentorship and guidance and prepare technical reports for publication and conference talks. You are self-motivated, excellent problem solver, a go-getter. You are quick to build relationships and work well with change and ambiguity. You have strong programming skills with tried experience crafting, prototyping, and delivering advanced algorithmic solutions.

Responsibilities

  • Utilize DL (Deep Learning) frameworks like Pytorch or Tensorflow to build and train neural models for NLP tasks
  • Perform hands-on Machine Learning tasks and statistical analyses in Python
  • Own projects from their inception to production release (and beyond)
  • Write efficient, clean, documented, scalable and maintainable Python code following the Object Oriented Paradigms and Design Patterns.
  • Take ownership of NLP projects and products alongside the rest of the NLP team members
  • Maintaining the production environment and resolving production issues.
  • Enhance existing solutions including code refactoring to optimize for performance, reliability, efficiency, and scalability
  • Write and maintain clean and modular code to deploy in production environment
  • Lead design, research, and implementation of state-of-the-art conversational AI systems to enable organic, emotionally responsive conversations
  • Push the envelope on current conversational AI technology and develop new capabilities for our interactive robot platform

Minimum Qualifications

  • MS in Natural Language Processing, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Applied Mathematics or Physics, Machine Learning or a related technical field
  • 1+ years Professional Experience in NLP and Machine Learning
  • Experience working on various NLP projects like Text Classification, Named Entity Recognition, Sentiment Analysis, Topic Modeling, Machine Translation, Natural Language Inference, Keyword Extraction etc.
  • Experience in developing and building upon existing chatbot frameworks (e.g., ParlAI, Rasa, HuggingFace, etc.) as well as ML frameworks (e.g., PyTorch, Tensorflow)
  • Experience in working with databases such as MySQL
  • Experience with AWS ecosystem preferred
  • Experience with CPU/GPU optimization preferred
  • Proficient using libraries such as Pandas, Gensim, Scikit Learn and Numpy.
  • Proficient with data visualization tools and libraries such as plotly, matplotlib.

Preferred Qualifications

  • Strong program fluency in Python and SQL
  • Good understanding of Statistical Concepts such as A/B Testing, p-values, bootstrapping etc.
  • Proficient in Software Development, Object Oriented Paradigms and Design Patterns
  • Excellent communication skills to effectively lead and collaborate with an interdisciplinary team

Benefits

  • Flexible working hours
  • CPT/OPT/STEM OPT sponsorship
  • A dynamic, ambitious and fun work environment

position: Ruby On Rails & Javascript Internships (Sports Fans Wanted!)
description:
We are looking for passionate sports fan programmers to help bolster our product under the counsel and leadership of senior programmers and management.

At the moment, watching sports is an utterly broken experience. Wasting time Googling for game times, streaming links, and tv information is commonplace, and this presents a massive opportunity.

SportsBot5000 makes watching ALL your favorite sports and teams 10X easier.

Instead of forcing viewers to hunt for game times, stream links, and tv listings, SportsBot5000 centralizes everything that a fan needs to get to their games as quickly as possible, and enables them to watch ANY game in just one click. Highlights, links to buy tickets, gambling info and SMS notifications are also all presented at every fan's fingertips to make every aspect of watching and monetizing sports more effective.

You can see our current proof-of-concept beta at: http://sb5k2.herokuapp.com/. This demo is not ssl-protected so you may need to bypass some https browser security concerns to view it.

SportsBot5000 is seeking passionate young engineers to help bolster and scale our code to grow this application quickly. Both frontend and backend roles will be considered--if you can bring something useful to the table, then we are interested.

Jobs include:

  • Maintaining match and team data (database is currently Ruby on Rails)
  • Maintaining television and stream data
  • Maintaining data-collecting scrapers
  • Maintaining dev and production servers
  • Upgrading front end and UX
  • Successfully launching to production
  • Abiding by good standards of engineering, including testing and pipeline adherence

Being an avid sports fan is a plus, though not essential. We are currently a very dedicated and motivated team, and we are looking for someone equally skillful to help us bolster the codebase foundation of this application.

If you are interested in solving this problem and helping build the dominant go-to source of sports entertainment in the near future, please apply. Generous equity is available to the right talent if you can controbute effectively. Part-time is also an option.

location.city: New York City • San Francisco Bay Area • Remote

description:
About Injective Labs

Injective Labs is building a decentralized exchange that provides limitless access to all financial markets. Injective enables fully decentralized trading without any restrictions, allowing individuals to trade on any derivative market of their choosing.

Injective Labs is backed by a prominent group of stakeholders including Pantera Capital, Binance, Mark Cuban, Hashed, and many others. We have offices in New York City and Hong Kong.

Injective is valued at over $1 Billion and has been dubbed the "DeFi Robinhood" by the likes of TechCrunch.

Job Description

Algorithm developers are responsible for building and maintaining the models that drive our trading. A typical day involves applying rigorous statistical analysis to vast quantities of market and financial data to produce provably predictive trading models. Working in close collaboration with fellow algo developers and core developers, you will research, develop, and test novel order execution and model training methods to increase trading efficiency.

Requirements

Candidate must have a bachelor's degree at minimum from a prestigious university in CS, Physics, or Math. Candidates must be capable of working independently as well as part of a team. Must have great experience with Rust. Previous exposure in trading strategy implementation in a production environment will be a plus.

Remote work is acceptable. Working language is Chinese
and/or English.

We can provide working visa sponsorship in the US / HK for any qualified candidates. We can also provide US green card sponsorship for fulltime position. Please send your resume to maxim.shen@injectiveprotocol.com

*About Injective Labs *

At Injective Labs, you'll have the opportunity to work at the bleeding edge of decentralized finance on products that will redefine our global financial markets. By joining us at this early stage, you will be able to have a high impact on the growth of Injective as well as advance the state of DeFi.

Injective Labs is reimagining trading and decentralized finance. Injective enables fully decentralized trading without any restrictions, allowing individuals to trade on any derivative market of their choosing. Our goal is to enable anyone to create and trade limitless markets whether they be digital assets, synthetics, or stocks.

Injective is backed by a prominent group of stakeholders including Pantera Capital, Binance, Mark Cuban, Hashed, and many others.

Injective is valued at over $1 Billion and has been dubbed the "DeFi Robinhood" by the likes of TechCrunch.

Job Description

Researchers are responsible for applying, adapting latest deep learning, machine learning and reinforcement learning techniques to achieve various goals in order to make impactful deliveries, while also conducting novel research as required. We are interested in all aspects of ML including: predictive modelling, clustering, time series analysis, natural language processing. Successful researchers manage all aspects of the research process including methodology selection, data collection and analysis, implementation and testing, prototyping, and performance evaluation.

Some successful researchers have joined us from similar backgrounds at other firms. Others have joined from related fields or directly from academia and have thrived with hands-on guidance from our large team of experienced portfolio managers and researchers. Our most exceptional team members combine strong technical skills and a passion for problem solving with an intense curiosity about financial markets and human behavior.

Requirements

● Students enrolled in a master/PhD program in machine learning, computer science, statistics, or a related field.
● Superb analytical and quantitative skills, along with a healthy streak of creativity.
● Demonstrated ability to conduct independent research utilizing large data sets.
● Passion for seeing research through from initial conception to eventual application.
● Curiosity about financial markets, especially in crypto currency markets.
● Strong scientific programming in Python, Tensorflow 2.0, Keras and PyTorch.
● Sense of ownership of his/her work, working well both independently and within a small collaborative team
● Empirical, detail-oriented mindset.

Note: We sponsor CPT/OPT. Depending on individual candidates, we can also sponsor H1B after the internship

DTonomy is a Cybersecurity company solving a critical problem facing Security teams today: too many alerts and incidents that exceed the capacity of skilled professionals to investigate and resolve them. Organizations today have hundreds to thousands of daily alerts from hundreds of sources and these numbers will only continue to grow. Most organizations are short staffed which results in inconsistent investigation processes, high mean time to response, increased risk and analyst burnout.

DTonomy’s Assisted Incident Response platform (AIR) orchestrates hundreds of internal and external data sources and tools into a single platform, and leverages automation and artificial intelligence to enable analysts to triage all alarms and threats, not just the highest rated or most critical, without additional investment in resource.

AIR’s unique adaptive learning engine and automated workflows guide IT teams through steps and procedures, resulting in up to 10 times quicker resolution of incidents, decreased downtime, and reduced alert fatigue for staff.

Job Description:

  • Work with product team and participate in full cycle of product development
  • Analyze internal and external data, deliver high quality model through scientific validation and integrate them to product
  • Build Data Pipeline using state-of-the-art technology
  • Write tech document and provide feedback.
  • Designing and implementing efficient code

Key Qualification:

  • Get Things Done

  • Self starter, highly motivated, comfortable in a fast paced environment

Overview

TABS Suite, a Diligence-as-a-Service platform, is a small but powerful team that goes beyond observation and recommendation, focused on helping startups and current / future investors make better business decisions to identify and mitigate issues through our product, the TABS Score (www.tabsscore.com).

We are relentless in uncovering new opportunities to help them achieve greater returns. Our deep knowledge and expertise stem largely from personal experience building independent ventures over the past decade and advising and investing in many across a variety of industries. We value evidence over opinion, and our team of intellectually curious overachievers works tirelessly to provide clear and effective solutions and strategies. As TABS rapidly gains market traction, we are looking for our Spring/Summer '21 software engineering interns to help mold and augment our existing platform.

What you will do:

• Work on a small team of 3-6 engineers, responsible for entire modules of the Toast product
• Build, and maintain high performance, flexible, and highly scalable web and mobile applications
• Participate in designing, estimating effort, implementing, testing, debugging, configuring, integrating and documenting database, middle-tier and front-end code
• Diagnose performance bottlenecks and implement optimizations
• Think in terms of the end-user and design accordingly
• Actively contribute to product design and feature selection discussions
• Participate in code reviews to ensure technical implementations meet functional requirements

Program Requirements:

• Currently enrolled in an academic program
• Deep self-learning software development experience
• Mobile software development experience a plus
• Well-versed in tiered web application architecture and databases
• Proficient / Fluent in the web front-end basics - HTML, CSS and JavaScript

KlearNow is pioneering “Logistics as a Service” (LaaS) by creating the industry’s first fully cloud-based digital network that can be used across the entire array of supply chain participants to simplify the transit of goods worldwide.

KlearNow’s LaaS model/platform is powered by our proprietary artificial intelligence/machine learning (AI/ML) engine that automates the digitization of the many current siloed, manual, and paper-based processes ultimately turning a mass of disconnected data into a structured and adaptable resource for all partners.

KlearNow is an Operational and Certified Customs Business provider in US, Canada and UK with plans to grow in many more markets in near future. Over and above the core customs clearance solution, KlearNow is also providing consolidated freight visibility, data and document management and intra-port activity for efficient Drayage.

Our mission is to transform global commerce with an AI-driven, shared-economy platform that makes logistics more simple, cost-effective and provides end-to-end visibility.

Design, develop, and operate resilient distributed services that run on ECS or Kubernetes to serve hundreds of millions of users around the world

Be a part of a rapidly growing, series A funded company where you will have the opportunity to extend our leadership position and fast-track innovation behind AI-powered intelligent supply chain solutions.

KlearNow has a flexibility of a small start up with the security of a well-funded organization with strong investors and advisors.

About LocalScale
LocalScale is an organisation focusing on the development of resilient and sustainable local economies through the use of technology, science and regenerative activities.
Our vision is that, given the challenges faced by our civilisation, the depletion of natural resources, and the decline of fossil energies, the transformation of our societies will only be possible through positivist approaches and intrinsically guided by principles of sustainable/regenerative and ethical development of local communities, while respecting and restoring natural ecosystems and promoting diversity and inclusion.
In order to achieve this vision, LocalScale offers an inclusive, free-to-access organisation and a platform that will promote the creation and use of local products, that will provide local economic alternatives to traditional financial systems, that will foster local entrepreneurship and local communities while advocating for social equality and social justice.
LocalScale is based in San Francisco, California, USA.

I won't bore you here with the list of Java skills you need to have for this role: if you're a Java hacker and know the latest tricks on the stack. we're good. Above all our organisation wants to attract individuals who are inspired to change the status quo, who care about the human and natural ecosystems and believe that their action can contribute to change and make a significant impact.

We still have a very small team but a strong supporting community around the world. Our organisation is guided by 3 foundational principles:

*** The Theory of Small Wins: we know that the task before us is massive but we move fast and celebrate every little victory along the way, because every win is part of a more global step in the right direction.
*** The Two Loop Theory of Organizational Change: this theory suggest that change emerges in human systems out of a spontaneous series of local actions, and these local actions spontaneously link together both organically and purposefully in ways that facilitate the development of integrated networks of relationships that are aligned in the pursuit of mutual interests and goals.

  • The Theory Positive Change Cycle: this one refers to the cycle of emotions experienced when someone discovers that important change is upcoming, and demonstrates the importance of being an actor of that change as a way to transform the negative emotions into positive ones.

Our mission is to make success more attainable, inclusive and common for all students. We are breaking down the barriers that have traditionally dictated a child’s odds of success.

The internet can be used for more than watching videos, sharing photos or ordering food. We’re inventing the right use cases to enable all students everywhere to study over the web, creating a multi-generational change that the world desperately needs.

We win, by helping students win in the infinite game of life.

The Opportunity
We’re solving a massive 1 billion person problem.

In the greatest country in the world, 9% of students from the lowest income quartile finish college compared to 77% for the rich. This means the wind that is blowing the cycle of poverty, continues to turn it faster and faster.

Today, we are beginning in the United States. However, students born all over the world, in every village, slum, and region where there is a shortage of teachers and resources, any place or space where there is a child born unlucky, CircleIn will be at their fingertips.

description:
About the Role Opportunity
SpaceLab is a people incubator where young professionals can gain real-world experience working with over a dozen people in cross-functional roles to produce a real-world application. The position currently is not funded, so keep that in mind while investigating the opportunity.

About the role and current project:
Goal: Develop a front-end web application based on a current design that allows a user to see a “map” of the sky above, or a “SpaceMap” (working titles exist).

  • This SpaceMap responds to a mouse on desktop or touch on a smartphone or tablet.
  • User can drill down into a spot on the map (like zooming in on google maps) and can investigate parts of the sky
  • User is shown stars that are in the area of interest and a number of planets that orbit said star if any exist
  • User can drill down to each planet and see some basic facts about the planet, including which research project discovered it
  • This SpaceMap should be a 3D rendering of stars and planets and should give the user the chance to see multiple views of the planet such as the following (if only a static photo or no photo is shown, follow link to see interactive view online):

https://36bvmt283fg61unuud3h7qua-wpengine.netdna-ssl.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/10/globe.gif

Current Progress:
The project is currently in Development Phase. Our initial design has been completed and our Dev team is coding out the front end for our MVP. Our hope is that you have the WebGL or other 3D graphical skills to jump this MVP from a 2D web app to a 3D web app. Our Data Science Team has replicated Neural Networks created by NASA scientists using data from the Kepler Mission, and we are working to iterate on that and use new data from new missions on our modified models.

About Compa

Compa is a new way to create offers with software. Our data science engine scales compensation analysis so that every decision is data-driven. Data-driven decisions help us make better human decisions. Our tools are designed to make compensation easy to understand and communicate so offer decisions are consistently fast and accountable.

Creating offers should be simple, unbiased, and designed to win. Compa makes this possible, and opens up incredible new ways to understand and manage compensation outcomes at scale.

About the role

Compa is looking for interns to join our team. As an intern, you will join Compa for 10 weeks and work on our core product and systems.
We’re looking for interns that want to code, grow, and have an impact on the world:

Code

  • Work with Compa’s engineers and CTO to build a core product feature end-to-end.
  • Work on Compa’s React frontend and Django backend.
  • Coding is a team sport at Compa - we work together to build the best features and scalable systems.

Grow

  • As intern, you will be giving meaningful work and contribute directly to Compa’s core product and systems under the guidance of experienced engineers.
  • Our founding engineering team is passionate about helping engineers grow to their full potential - and has a track record of doing so at Facebook and Oculus.
  • Compa is a safe place to learn and to grow - we have a no blame culture. Human error is a consequence of complex systems, not bad people. When mistakes happen, we work together to make our systems more resilient, not hunt for blame.

Impact

  • We’re applying technology to build scalable solutions to one of society’s toughest challenges - making compensation more transparent, fair, and equitable.
  • Pay is deeply personal and affects everyone who works for a living. At Compa you’ll be part of a small team on the frontier of making compensation better for everyone.
  • We’re a VC-backed early-stage startup, you’ll have the opportunity to influence matters of company culture, strategy, go-to-market, and fundraising.

About you

  • You want to make compensation more transparent, fair, and equitable.
  • You want to learn in highly ambiguous and constantly changing situations.
  • You have a bias for action - transform ambiguity and uncertainty into concrete next steps.
  • You are able to overcome obstacles to ship - done is better than perfect!
  • You are a collaborative problem solver.
  • You are looking to realize your potential by engaging with challenging problems, both technical and societal.

Bonus Points

  • Experience with React and/or Django

About the company:

Unilingo translates videos for top YouTube creators who want to reach a global audience and increase their ad revenue. We provide tools that make it easy and affordable to translate, distribute, and manage translated IP. In a world where 80% of content consumption is not in English, Unilingo’s premise is that small to medium sized content creators should have a single system for content translation, distribution, and management to reach a global audience. AI Translation is not good enough, human translation is expensive, no single management system exists to reach new audiences beyond one language, and high production value user-generated content is heavily undersupplied in emerging markets (1MM people come online for the first time each day). Unilingo works with creators with a combined following of 45MM subscribers and 7B lifetime views including WatchMojo and Veritasium 7% MoM viewership growth. Our translated content was viewed over 20m times in the last 30 days.

We work together to give everyone the power to share their story, explore what they love, and connect with one another in the process. Job Duties and Responsibilities:

Your main objectives will be the design and implementation of a deep-learning based framework that uses mobile sensor data to perform user-authentication. Apart from the raw sensor data itself, certain high-level aspects related to the user like the walking patterns, phone handling, daily life events, etc. would help identify the real user of the device. Depending on the duration of the internship, you might additionally have the opportunity to gain a first-hand experience of deploying the framework you develop, on a device (mobile phone) and evaluate real-time performance. Zighra transforms mobile sensor data into human-relatable intelligence, and hence this project sits at the heart of its technology.

At Zighra, we're creating something new, something connected, and something with global impact. Zighra has been granted several patents in the sensor based authentication space with over 100+ citations from organizations like Google, Paypal ,Square, IBM, MS, Intel, Mastercard, Blackberry and Alibaba among others. We're a small team with big goals.
